title: Mechanical\Structural Draftsperson
description:
Core Engineering Services Ltd. is located In Kamloops, B.C. We provide consulting and design engineering to the mining and forestry industries.

Core Engineering does not offer pre-determined solutions, but rather our focus is to work with our clients addressing their needs individually. Projects are developed with a simple practical approach. We draw on experience we have gained from working with our clients, various mills and various industries. In brief, we work to provide solutions that meet our client's needs with the greatest total practical value. We always approach any task with that attitude.

Our goal is to build long-term relationships with our clients by completing projects of small to medium size year in and year out. The development of long-term relationships with our core clients reduces costs of finding a consultant for these smaller projects. Trust and familiarity are already established with the site, personnel, standards and procedures that are unique to each and every client.

We currently have the following job opportunity available:

Mechanical\Structural Draftsperson\Designer:

Our Designers provide a wide array of services to support our clients' needs from upgrading existing equipment or plants to complete green field system design. Our team works closely with each other to make sure the solutions and designs will meet the client’s requirements. We are looking for individuals interested in being a fast paced environment willing to learn and adapt to various job duties. The role of a designer may turn itself into the role of a project manager with our in house hands on mentorship.

Responsibilities and Duties:

· Work with an engineering/design team to develop mechanical and/or structural fabrication drawing packages.

· Design mechanical system.

· Detail Mechanical Items using AutoCAD

· Prepare Fabrication Drawings

Qualifications and Skills:

· 1-2 years of direct experience with the design/detailing of equipment and support structures.

· Candidates with Team management and customer relationship experience are preferred.

· Proficient in the use of AutoCAD detailing software. Willing to train but AutoCAD experience is a must.

· Ability to produce accurate work with attention to detail on time and within budget.

· Experience in MS Office programs.

· Ability to read and understand mechanical and structural drawings/specifications.

· Ability to operate and maintain CAD equipment, plotter and other drawing reproduction equipment.

· Must possess strong communication and interpersonal skills and demonstrated abilities to interact with clients, fabricators, contractors and co-workers.

· Candidates must be team players, as well as work independently.

title: Application Engineer for PLM /CAD tools
description:
We're seeking an Application Engineer with strong PLM /CAD tools experience for a long term contract assignment.  This position will be based in the U.S., although most of the work will be performed remotely.  There is a strong possibility of long term contract extension.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Provide pre-sales PLM / CAD support to customers.
  • Provide technical support for Dassault Catia and Siemens NX CAD products
  • Demonstrate PLM / CAD tools.
  • Assist with customer evaluation, proof of concept activities.
  • Obtain Siemens and Dassault certification to demonstrate PLM software.
  • Able to provide customers with Application Engineering services and training / support.
  • Train and mentor customer technical leads and subject matter experts in the application of CAD products

QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Automotive Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or related field
  • Experience with CAD methods, preferably as it relates to Automotive
  • Excellent communication, organization and presentation skills
  • Ability to work as an individual or as a team member
  • Some travel may be required.
  • Experience using one or more of the following: Siemens NX, Siemens Simcenter Dassault 3DEXPERIENCE Catia, Dassault Simulia
  • Knowledge of common design processes, objectives and constraints in Automotive Industry
  • Familiarity with PLM systems application, configuration and usage.

title: Architecte d'affaires - Bilingue
description:
Client ID: 5096

Architecte d’affaires - Bilingue

Dans le cadre de ses ententes avec ses différents clients, Procom est actuellement à la recherche d’un Architecte d’affaires - Bilingue pour une entreprise dans le domaine financier. Notre client est situé à Québec.


Description des tâches et responsabilités – Architecte d’affaires - Bilingue

Les responsabilités du poste incluent :

- Définir, détailler et soutenir la vision d’affaires du programme et des initiatives;
- Définir et prioriser les besoins, objectifs d’affaires et initiatives en fonction de la valeur d’affaires attendue et des bénéfices attendus;
- Déterminer et définir les caractéristiques clefs de solutions attendues et les découper en besoins et initiatives EPICs SAFe;
- Contribuer à l’ajustement en continu de la vision et de la feuille de route du programme afin de maximiser la création de valeur et l’alignement avec les objectifs stratégiques;
- Participer à l’élaboration du plan de livraison du programme et des initiatives afin de concrétiser la vision et les stratégies établies et permettre l’atteinte des bénéfices d’affaires recherchés;
- Assurer une cohérence en proposant des solutions pour optimiser la gestion des dépendances entre les initiatives;
- Collaborer étroitement avec les différentes parties prenantes (technologies de l’information, architectes d’affaires, PO, PM, experts métiers, etc.) afin d’assurer une analyse suffisante des besoins et priorités;
- Évaluer, commenter et approuver les solutions proposées par les architectes pour répondre aux besoins d’affaires énoncés;
- Soutenir les équipes pendant la réalisation, en s’assurant que les objectifs d’affaires sont compris;
- Obtenir, au besoin, les alignements de la direction.


Exigences du poste – Architecte d’affaires - Bilingue

- Baccalauréat en administration, informatique ou autre discipline appropriée;
- Expérience minimale de 5 à 10 ans en architecture d’affaires;
- Expérience d’au moins 2 mandats à titre de responsable de l’architecture d’affaires d’un projet de plus 5 000 jp;
- Expérience d’au moins 2 mandats à titre de responsable d’architecture d’affaires d’initiatives de transformation numérique en lien avec le consommateur;
- Expérience dans des mandats-conseils ou projets où le candidat a fait preuve d’aisance en travail d’équipe et d’une grande autonomie;
- Expérience d’encadrement des travaux de conseillers en architecture d’affaires et d’analystes d’affaires;
- Expérience dans les projets utilisant la philosophie Agile ou l’Agilité à l’échelle (SAFe);
- Capacité d’analyse et esprit critique orienté vers les solutions et l’amélioration continue;
- Connaissance des bonnes pratiques en architecture d’affaires;
- Connaissance du domaine de l’assurance de dommages;
- Niveau d’anglais écrit et oral avancé.


Type de poste
Contractuel 14 mois avec de fortes possibilités de renouvellement.

Date de début
Immédiatement

Numéro de référence
BH330170

title: Architecte de solution - Bilingue
description:
Client ID: 1410

Architecte de solution - Bilingue

Dans le cadre de ses ententes avec ses différents clients, Procom est actuellement à la recherche d’un Architecte de solution - Bilingue pour une entreprise dans le domaine des assurances. Notre client est situé à Québec.


Description des tâches et responsabilités – Architecte de solution - Bilingue

Les responsabilités du poste incluent :

- Concevoir des solutions (requis fonctionnels et techniques, réutilisation de composants) ainsi que la stratégie d’implantation et d’intégration;
- Produire des estimations, des envergures pour des solutions à développer ou des progiciels à mettre en place ou à intégrer;
- Réaliser les documents et effectuent les présentations des différents scénarios à envisager à mettre en place ou à intégrer afin de répondre aux besoins des clients ou d’affaires;
- Contribuer fortement et orienter la réalisation de la liste des critères d’acceptations de manière fiable, répétable et soutenable;
- Selon le besoin ou le secteur agir à titre d’expert d’une ou des solutions TI, que ce soit au niveau des progiciels ou applications maison. Prendre en charge les discussions TI avec le fournisseur, faire la veille au niveau des fonctionnalités, effectuer de l’accompagnement, autres;
- Effectuer de l’accompagnement (normes, architectures de référence, méthode de travail, autres) auprès des équipes TI;
- Animer et participer aux rencontres (internes, fournisseurs, autres) nécessaires à la réalisation de son travail;
- Agir à titre de leader en soutenant les différentes équipes (affaires, développement, projets, autres) dans la résolution de problématiques et d’enjeux, par exemple lors de projets.


Exigences du poste – Architecte de solution - Bilingue

- Posséder un baccalauréat en informatique ou l'équivalent;
- Détenir un minimum de 3 années d'expérience dans un poste similaire;
- Détenir un minimum de 10 années d'expérience en informatique;
- Posséder un minimum de 5 ans d’expérience diversifié en analyse, modélisation, développement et intégration de solution logicielle;
- Posséder un minimum de 2 ans de l’expérience dans des projets d’envergures et complexes à titre d’architecte de solutions ou similaire;
- Avoir participé à la réalisation de projets en mode agile et avoir des connaissances des Framework Agile tel que SCRUM, Kanban, autres;
- Maîtriser la langue française tant parlée qu’écrite;
- Maîtriser la langue anglaise tant parlée qu’écrite.


Type de poste
Contractuel 10 mois avec de fortes possibilités de renouvellement.

Date de début
Immédiatement

Numéro de référence
BH331693

title: Revit Technician (Hybrid or Remote)
description:
*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

We know the importance of stability during these unprecedented times and as an essential service, we've been steadily growing our employee numbers since March 2020. With many large projects on the horizon, it's an exciting time to join our team and become part of our stable, growing organization and industry.

About Houle Electric:

At Houle, we are passionate about building resilient communities. From airports, shipping terminals, and water treatment facilities, to hospitals, universities, and shopping centres, we deliver integrated electrical solutions for our industrial, commercial, institutional and residential customers.

While we are leaders in electrical construction, we also specialize in a wide range of in-house technology solutions, including audio visual, building automation, healthcare systems, network systems, and security and life-safety. As a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, we take pride in our talented people and collaborative culture that bring our client's vision to life.

About the position:

Houle's Project Planning Services department is looking for a Revit Technician to join the team. Our planning department specializes in designing and creating installation drawings from engineering construction documents, to the field stage for installation. This encompasses many electrical systems such as distribution infrastructures, wall elevations, branch power & lighting, fire alarm, and technology systems such as structured cabling, nurse call, and security.

Based out of Kelowna, the Project Planning Services team supports our large Design Build projects across the province, ranging from large residential, office high rises to major hospitals.

As a REVIT Technician, your responsibilities would be to support and work closely with our electrical planners to provide REVIT and CAD assisted drafting. This entails 3D modeling clash adjustments and coordination, concept modeling, infrastructure layouts, wiring pull plans, and electrical details.

Not only will you get to operate within Revit and CAD, but we also hope that you will take on the challenge of learning some base electrical planning with the close guidance of our planners.

There are both Hybrid and Remote work options available for this role.

Duties and responsibilities:

The incumbent would be responsible for working with our project planning services team to:

  • Work side by side with our planners to repair bulk modeling issues within Revit, on electrical products, such as Conduit racks, distribution equipment, light fixtures, and in wall devices.
  • Develop drawings using design information provided from hand sketches, Bluebeam and CAD including system line diagrams, floor plans, and elevations

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and attributes:

  • Relevant Education
  • 1+ years of Revit and AutoCAD software application experience
  • Experience with document and asset management within Revit and BIM 360, and the remainder of the Autodesk umbrella
  • Experience with modeling to standard LOD levels (Levels of Detail 100-500)
  • Experience within Revit creating and managing families is an asset
  • Capable of working side by side with planners to adjust modeling
  • Experience in architectural drafting an asset
  • Experience with reviewing and navigating through typical construction drawings
  • Thorough understanding and efficiency with drafting standards
  • Strong organizational and prioritizing skills with the ability to take initiative
  • Energetic, flexible, problem solving mindset

Culture is important at Houle. You must be collaborative in nature. You are a solution focused team player and always willing to learn. You are a bright, ambitious, honest, and a straight forward professional. Your personable nature will fit well within the friendly working environment.

The compensation for this position will be commensurate with experience. Houle offers an exciting, enjoyable work environment, competitive benefits package as well as a competitive incentive plan and many company sponsored events.

To apply, please visit https://www.houle.ca/current-career-opportunities/ and click on the listing for "Revit Technician". Opportunity will remain open until filled.

For the interview process, please be prepared to showcase your portfolio. Testing may also be required.

*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*



By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Summer Student, Architecture
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood is seeking a currently enrolled Summer Studentin Architecture from a recognized University. In this position you will be required to work within our Architectural team, remotely from home. The Student will plan, schedule and conduct technically architectural assignments under the supervision of senior architects and technologist.

 

We are looking for an enthusiastic student who enjoys working in an open and collaborative environment, with a team spread across geographical regions in Canada.

 

Key Responsibilities:  

  • Work closely with architects and senior technologist producing deliverables for a wide range of project types
  • Assist with coordinating design documents, proposals and reports with civil, architectural, structural, mechanical and electrical team
  • Assist architects and senior technologies in producing drawing packages in Revit BIM environment for conceptual, schematic, detailed design, and construction drawings that include, site plans, floor plans, demolition plans, renovation plans, roof plans, exterior elevations, interior sections, wall sections, details, schedules, etc.
  • Be self-starting, organized and deadline oriented
  • Ability to shift between projects
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities
  • Flexible to work on other duties that may be assigned

 

Skills / Qualifications:
  • Student ofArchitectural Technology coupled with a minimum of 10 years relevant experience
  • Good understanding of the Canadian Building Codes and By-Laws
  • Proficiency in REVIT, AutoCAD and Microstation required
  • Working knowledge of MS Office packages, Projectwise, BIM 360 and Bluebeam will be an asset.
  • Good communication skills and fluent in English
  • Ability to work in design development, construction document and contract administration phases
  • Ability to read and interpret architectural, civil, structural, mechanical, electrical consultantâ€™s documents and coordinate with minimal supervision
  • Strong organizational skills along with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and demonstrate a flexible approach to work assignments
  • Strong communication skills along with excellent interpersonal and organizational abilities
  • A willingness to work in a team  environment with members located in different geographical regions
  • 2nd Year Bachelor of Architecture Student
  • ***This is a Summer Position, relocation assistance or living allowances will not be provided for this position.
  • ***Candidate is expected to work from home.  
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

The Student will plan, schedule and conduct technically architectural assignments under the supervision of senior architects and technologist.', 'Assist architects and senior technologies in producing drawing packages in Revit BIM environment for conceptual, schematic, detailed design, and construction drawings that include, site plans, floor plans, demolition plans, renovation plans, roof plans, exterior elevations, interior sections, wall sections, details, schedules, etc.', 'Flexible to work on other duties that may be assigned', 'Good communication skills and fluent in English', 'Strong organizational skills along with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and demonstrate a flexible approach to work assignments', 'Work closely with architects and senior technologist producing deliverables for a wide range of project types', 'Student ofArchitectural Technology coupled with a minimum of 10 years relevant experience', 'Working knowledge of MS Office packages, Projectwise, BIM 360 and Bluebeam will be an asset.', 'Strong communication skills along with excellent interpersonal and organizational abilities', '2nd Year Bachelor of Architecture Student', 'Good understanding of the Canadian Building Codes and By-Laws', '***Candidate is expected to work from home.', 'Be self-starting, organized and deadline oriented']

title: Dessinateur(trice) en génie civil
description:
C'est vrai!  Chez Tetra Tech, la vie fait partie de nos plans... et en réalité, c'est bien plus que ça! Nous prenons à cœur l’être humain et nous sommes conscients que nos gens sont notre force! Notre réputation repose sur l’expertise technique et l’engagement de plus de 20 000 professionnels à travers le monde, dont plus de 3 500 au Canada et 1 500 au Québec. 

Ce qui fait de Tetra Tech la compagnie où vous voulez travailler

  • Les bureaux débordent de gens talentueux et sympathiques;
  • Nos troupes se sont rapidement adaptés à la nouvelle réalité du télétravail;
  • On y retrouve des experts chevronnés qui collaborent au quotidien dans un environnement des plus agréables;
  • Le développement technique et la progression font partie de la culture interne;
  • On est conscient que le mode de vie de chacun est différent et on sait s’adapter;
  • Le développement durable est une de nos priorités et nous l’intégrons au quotidien afin d’améliorer la situation de nos clients et celle de la planète.

Ce qu’il nous manque pour faire briller l’équipe « Municipale » du bureau de Boucherville, c’est un(e) dessinateur(trice) en génie civil qui se démarque par ses compétences en Civil3D, mais aussi par son esprit d’équipe!

Lieu : En mode hybride (télétravail et présence au bureau de Boucherville)

Les défis qui vous permettront de vous surpasser

  • Élaborer et préparer des dessins et des plans pour différents projets en infrastructures urbaines (égouts, aqueduc, voirie, drainage, etc.);
  • Participer aux tâches de conception;
  • Compiler et saisir les données relevées sur le terrain;
  • Accompagner les techniciens dans leur quotidien;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les ingénieurs afin de trouver des solutions adaptées à notre clientèle
  • Connaissance de CIVIL 3D un atout.

Ce qui fait de vous la personne idéale pour ce poste

Chez Tetra Tech, nous avons une place pour vous!  Avec la grande variété de projets que nous avons, votre rôle sera adapté selon votre expertise.

  • Vous possédez un DEP en dessin industriel;
  • Détenir 5 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire;
  • Vous voulez vous spécialiser en infrastructures urbaines;
  • Intérêt marqué pour le dessin et la conception;
  • Vous êtes allumé(e), et motivé par le travail d’équipe;
  • Excellente maîtrise du logiciel Civil3D et AutoCAD.

Tetra Tech souscrit à un programme d’accès à l’égalité en emploi et invite ainsi les femmes, les autochtones, les personnes handicapées ainsi que les membres des minorités visibles ou ethniques à postuler. Veuillez noter que seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées.

Nous prenons à cœur l’être humain et nous sommes conscients que\xa0nos gens sont notre force! Notre réputation repose sur l’expertise technique et l’engagement de plus de 20 000 professionnels à travers le monde, dont plus de 3 500 au Canada et 1 500 au Québec."]

title: GIS CAD Technician
description:
JOB POSTING #:  2022-0173

POSTING PERIOD: Wednesday, May 4 at 8:30 AM to Tuesday, May 10, 2022 at 4:30 PM

DEPARTMENT: Infrastructure & Geomatics

UNION: C.U.P.E Local 543

JOB CODE: 543350

POSITION STATUS: Regular Full Time; Temporary Full-Time

# OF POSITIONS: 1 (RFT); 1 (TFT)

POSITION # 00003307

RATE OF PAY: $28.49 - $33.49 per hour

SHIFT WORK REQ'D: No

DUTIES:

  • Reporting to the GIS Supervisor, this position will carry out GIS CAD tasks as assigned, the preparation of computer-aided mapping and GIS layers and geo-databases, primarily using ESRI, along with AutoDesk and GeoCortex software. 
  • Other duties will include the development of an attributed street centerline, administrative boundaries, running and checking GIS topology and development of symbology, collecting, updating and analyzing GIS-related data.
  • The GIS CAD Technician will also be expected to: 
  • Source, acquire and collect materials for subject data, verify existing municipal data based on specifications provided, review and convert relevant available data sources, data entry of existing paper-based information, perform quality control checks on converted data, document specifications, procedures and/or completed work. Operate all office and computer equipment including printers, plotters and scanners. 
  • Work in a computerized Windows networked environment. 
  • Maintain amiable relations with co-workers and the public.
  • Perform other related office duties as assigned including deliveries.
  • Will perform Occupational Health & Safety duties as outlined in the Corporationâ€™s Health and Safety Program. 
  • Will perform other related duties as required.                                                                                                                     

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must have a three (3) year Community College Diploma in one of the following disciplines: GIS Technology, Civil Technology or Planning Technology or related field or Ontario Ministry of Education equivalencies;
  • Must have over one (1) year of experience in GIS CAD software, such as ESRI suite, in a municipal civil engineering, planning, GIS or related environment;
  • Must have the ability to travel to offsite locations in a timely and expedient manner as required. If method of travel is by vehicle, a current, valid and lawful Driverâ€™s Licence is required in accordance with the Highway Traffic Act and must provide a driverâ€™s abstract as a condition of employment;
  • Must have a demonstrated proficiency in GIS CAD software and MS Access or a geo-database;
  • Must have proven proficiency or knowledge of the Windows Operating system in a networked environment, file management and data conversion;
  • Must be self-motivated, work with minimal supervision, be prepared to train in the use of new software, have proven verbal and written communication skills;
  • Must have proven organizational and time management skills;
  • Eligibility to obtain certification as a Technician with O.A.C.E.T.T., GIS professional recognized by GIS Certification Institute or other recognized professional organization will be considered an asset;
  • Successfully completing training in the Microsoft Suite of Products (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint) will be considered an asset;
  • Proficiency in the following software is considered an asset: ESRI Products (ArcGIS Server, GeoCortex), Adobe products (Acrobat, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc);
  • Knowledge of demonstrable GIS concepts and some GIS programming will both be considered an asset;
  • The physical demands analysis associated with this job indicates a sedentary to light level of work.                                                                                               

NOTE:

  • Only those applicants selected for an interview will be acknowledged
  • We offer a smoke-free office environment
  • Personal information is collected under the authority of the Municipal Act, c. 25 as amended, and will be used to determine eligibility for employment.

All City of Windsor employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment in accordance with the Cityâ€™s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy.

The Corporation of the City of Windsor is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, the City of Windsor will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities.  If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform the City of Windsor Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

title: Piping Designer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood, the global engineering and consultancy organization, is seeking a Piping Designer to join our vibrant and growing team in ourCalgary and Edmoston offices.

 

The Projects team in Calgary  has a history of delivering some of the biggest projects in the Canadian Oilsands, with associated pipelines and refinery infrastructure, as well as a strong foothold in the energy transition supporting the rapidly growing decarbonization and

renewables industry.    

 

  • Join a culture of innovation, pushing the boundaries of what is possible to seek the best solutions for our clients.
  • Our teams are making it a priority to develop flexible working arrangements that balance client, team and individual needs.

 

Responsibilities:  

  • Create and develop 3D model using AutoPlant, CADWorx, Aveva and OpenPlant an assest
  • Experience Modeling Pipelines and CPF's
  • Drafting General Arrangement drawing
  • Creating Isometrics
  • Plant Layout drawings

 

Are you ready to join TEAM Wood?

 

 

Skills / Qualifications:
  • Diploma in  Process Piping Drafting
  • a Minimum of   2 years of experience in piping design and drafting
  • Proficiency witth Autoplant, CADWorx, Aveva, is considered a plus

Additional skills required:

 

  • Good communication skills

Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Draftsperson
description:
The Opportunity: 
McElhanney has a rewarding opportunity for an individual to join our team as a Draftsperson in Edmonton, AB. In this role, you will be responsible for using computer-assisted design (CAD) to take preliminary data and produce, edit, and/or modify technically accurate drawings and plans that meet legal, client and branch specifications.

The successful candidate will work within the Edmonton Geomatics Branch, working with project managers, QAQC/Plan checkers and drafters on Upstream Oil & Gas, Renewable Energy and Land Development projects. This is an ideal opportunity for a talented individual to join our fast-paced team with opportunities to work on diversified projects.

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Complete assigned routine drafting duties using computer-assisted design (CAD). Create accurate drawings which follow project specific standards and guidelines.
  • Complete field measurements for lease area plans within buildings around the Edmonton Region.
  • Follow established practices and techniques to produce, edit, and modify standard drawings with technical accuracy from preliminary data provided by the Project Manager or Sr. Draftsperson.
  • Establish good rapport and build relationships with peers by responding to requests and communicating information in a timely manner.
  • Comply with all company policies including safety policies and WCB regulations General survey drafting standards for both crown and freehold land within Alberta, BC and Saskatchewan will be an asset.
  • Perform other related duties as required.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Recent Diploma in Geomatics Engineering Technology or similar program, or up to 5 years’ experience in a similar role.
  • Ability to work with Autodesk products will be an asset.
  • Ability to work independently and within a busy and high-performing team.
  • Ability to multi-task, excellent organizational skills, communication skills, and attention to detail.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle 
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave 
  • Great benefits, including extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching 
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone 
  • A family-like culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all 
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth 

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

#LI-junior #Hybrid # #LI-AM3 #LI-Hybrid #junior
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: AutoCAD Drafter
description:
Overview:

Corrpro Canada is looking for a CAD Drafter.    

 

Corrpro, a subsidiary of Aegion Corporation, is a corrosion engineering, cathodic protection, and corrosion monitoring business for the protection and preservation of infrastructure. Corrpro provides professional corrosion consulting and cathodic protection engineering services to major oil companies, government agencies, municipal water, sewer and gas utilities, universities, and public transportation agencies.  

Responsibilities:
  • Interpret engineering and construction sketches and mock-ups for graphical intent for cathodic protection projects for multiple offices in Western Canada
  • Implement consistent style in preparing plan, section, elevation, and detail drawings
  • Update standard details as directed by supervisor or engineering manager
  • Complete all drawings using high professional standards for clarity and neatness
  • Review blueprints, sketches, and specifications related to drafting requirements
  • Exercise judgment to determine essential information
  • Scale drawings for accurate proportion and relationship among components
  • Prepare CAD drawings to represent physical features of client facilities
  • Annotate cathodic protection components to client facility drawings as designed or as installed
  • Measure and record field data as directed by project engineers or project managers
  • Analyze  and tabulate data for customer reports
  • Provide data support for GIS work
  • Provide project administration support
Qualifications:
  • Technical diploma with a concentration in Computer Aided Drafting or related field
  • 2 years of experience with AutoCAD
  • Strong overall software experience such as MS Word, Excel, etc.,   experience  with Micro Station helpful
  • Persist at difficult tasks despite unexpected obstacles

Competitive Salary | Full Benefits Package | RRSP Matching Program

Vacation & Holiday Time | Training & Development

 

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and we value diversity in our workforce.

title: CAD Timing Engineer – Staff Engineer (Vancouver, Canada)
description:
Company:

Qualcomm Canada ULC




Job Area:

Engineering Group, Engineering Group > ASICS Engineering




General Summary:


Digital - Oversees definition, design, verification, and documentation for ASIC development for a variety of products. Determines architecture design, logic design, and system simulation. Defines module interfaces/formats for simulation. Evaluates all aspects of the process flow from high-level design to synthesis, place and route, and timing and power use. Analyzes equipment to establish operation data, conducts experimental tests, and evaluates results. Uses System tools, such as National Instrument (NI) products, LabVIEW, and MathWorks MATLAB, SIMULINK, VISIO and other toolboxes. Uses language such as HDL, C, PERL. Provides technical expertise for next generation initiatives.
Analog - Oversees definition, design, verification, and documentation for ASIC development for a variety of products. Determines architecture design and circuit specifications based on system level requirements. Is actively involved in all aspects of the design from system definition/simulation to circuit design and simulation. Heavy involvement in overseeing layout and silicon evaluation is also expected. Uses design tools such as Cadence ADE, MathWorks MATLAB and others. Provides technical expertise for next generation initiatives.




Minimum Qualifications:


• Bachelor's degree in Science, Engineering, or related field and 5+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience.

OR

Master's degree in Science, Engineering, or related field and 4+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience.

OR

PhD in Science, Engineering, or related field and 3+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience.






Preferred Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.
• 8+ years ASIC design, verification, or related work experience.
• 2+ years experience with architecture and design tools.
• 2+ years experience with scripting tools and programming languages.
• 2+ years experience with design verification methods.
• 1+ years of work experience in a role requiring interaction with senior leadership (e.g., Director level and above).
Principal Duties & Responsibilities:
• Uses tools/applications (i.e., Cadence, RTL Compiler, etc.) to execute advanced architecture and design of multiple complex blocks and makes suggestions for design protocol.
• Develops an implementation strategy that meets system requirements and customer needs for team.
• Effectively utilizes advanced problem solving and ASIC engineering practices to resolve complex architecture, design, or verification problems.
• Owns the design and verification strategies of ASICs, SoC, and IP cores, reviews the strategies of more junior team members and develops strategies for multiple blocks or IC Packages.
• Reviews complex tests from more junior team members and completes own tests to ensure that bugs are fully understood and analyzed.
• Runs advanced power checks on multiple blocks to ensure design specifications are met; makes recommendations to leadership when specifications are not met.
• Interprets the results of highly complex performance checks and reports them to team lead.
• Stays up to date on technical literature and technological advances and suggests areas for innovation.
• Writes, reviews, and edits own technical document in accordance with template and reviews and provides feedback on more junior engineers' documentation.
• Maintains regular communication with key team members to ensure continued alignment between team deliverables and product execution plan.
• Writes technical documentation and provides technical expertise for design or project reviews and project meetings to ensure team's best interest is represented.
• Acts as a tech lead on small to large projects and owns team deliverables of the project.
• Continually evaluates process used in team to facilitate effective work-flow for possible improvement. Additional responsibilities might include:
• Uses process technology expertise to help define module level choices for technology variants to meet product requirement.
• Owns development and delivery of robust technology process modules through test chip and product data analysis.
• Owns data mining and analysis of test chip and produce test data to resolve issues during technology development and ramp.
Level of Responsibility:
• Working independently with little supervision.
• Making decisions that are moderate in impact; errors may have financial impact or effect on projects, operations, or customer relationships; errors may require involvement beyond immediate work group to correct.
• Using verbal and written communication skills to convey complex and/or detailed information to multiple individuals/audiences with differing knowledge levels. May require strong negotiation and influence, communication to large groups or high-level constituents.
• Having a moderate amount of influence over key organizational decisions (e.g., is consulted by senior leadership to provide input on key decisions).
• Completing tasks that do not have defined steps; simultaneous use of multiple mental abilities is generally required to determine the best approach; mistakes may result in significant rework.
• Exercising substantial creativity to innovate new processes, procedures, or work products within guidelines or to achieve established objectives.
• Using deductive and inductive problem solving; multiple approaches may be taken/necessary to solve the problem; often information is missing or conflicting; advanced data analysis and interpretation skills are required.
• Occasionally participates in strategic planning within own area affecting immediate operations.
The responsibilities of this role do not include:
• Financial accountability (e.g., does not involve budgeting responsibility).
Qualcomm is committed to hiring and supporting individuals with disabilities. Although this role has some expected physical activity, an inability to perform one or more of the listed physical requirements should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. We will work with you throughout the application and onboarding process to provide reasonable accommodations. Examples of expected physical activity include: frequently transporting between offices, buildings, and campuses up to ½ mile; frequently transporting and installing equipment up to 5 lbs.; performing tasks at various heights (e.g., standing or sitting); monitoring and utilizing computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day; and continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely.

























Applicants : If you need an accommodation, during the application/hiring process, you may request an accommodation by sending email to accommodationsupport

















To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies : Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.






If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers (http://www.qualcomm.com/contact/corporate) .

title: CAD Designer
description:
BGC is looking for a Civil 3D Designer with 3-5 years of experience, with a minimum of 1 year of Civil Designing/Corridor Design experience. The ideal candidate will have industry experience in Geotechnical, Mining or Pipelines. They will be able to work in a fast-paced environment on their own and within a team.

This challenging yet rewarding position will require collaboration with Engineers and teammates. It will provide an opportunity to innovate designs and increase drawing quality to produce complex 3D models, generate accurate volumes, and quality production drawings.

Responsibilities:

  • Be a lead project designer involving, but not limited to, the design of dams, spillways, channels, roads, grading plans, excavations, stability benches;
  • Create and manage 3D models and data using Civil 3D and other available tools;
  • Preparation of design and construction drawings in the mining and pipeline field;
  • Produce drawings relating to earthworks design;
  • Liaise with engineers on designs/requests;
  • Communicate the status of tasks, design changes, and continuous improvement items to the rest of the team

Requirements:

  • Certificate or post-secondary education from an accredited vocational/technical institute;
  • 3-5 years of direct experience with drafting and civil designing;
  • 1+ years experience in Civil Designing/Corridor Design;
  • Experience with earthworks design and preparation of 3D models using Civil 3D;
  • Knowledge of Civil 3D and earthworks design concepts (e.g. grading, slopes, surfaces creation, volume calculations, etc.);
  • Ability to introduce new ideas and CAD routines to enhance operations;
  • Strong attention to detail is a must;
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced deadline driven environment;
  • Great listening skills;
  • Excellent communication skills.

description:

title: CAD Technician
description:
Company Introduction:

 

This position is for Massiv Die-Form, a division of Cosma International.

Cosma International, an operating unit of Magna International, is one of the world‘s premier global automotive suppliers providing a comprehensive range of body, chassis, and engineering solutions to our customers. Our pioneering technology and creativity allows our customers to ask for solutions that lie beyond what they previously thought was possible.

Massiv Die-Form, a division of Magna International, designs and builds medium to large cast automotive and hot stamping dies. Massiv Die-Form is proudly committed to manufacture products of the highest quality, reliability, maintainability and durability for the global automotive market through skilled and dedicated people focused on total customer satisfaction, ongoing protection of the environment and the profitable well-being of our company.

 

Additional Information:

Accommodations for disabilities in relations to the job selection process are available upon request.

Role Summary

Company Introduction:

This position is for Massiv Die-Form, a division of Cosma International.

Cosma International, an operating unit of Magna International, is one of the world‘s premier global automotive suppliers providing a comprehensive range of body, chassis, and engineering solutions to our customers. Our pioneering technology and creativity allows our customers to ask for solutions that lie beyond what they previously thought was possible.

Massiv Die-Form, a division of Magna International, designs and builds medium to large cast automotive and hot stamping dies. Massiv Die-Form is proudly committed to manufacture products of the highest quality, reliability, maintainability and durability for the global automotive market through skilled and dedicated people focused on total customer satisfaction, ongoing protection of the environment and the profitable well-being of our company.

Key Responsibilities

•    Interpret die layouts and die designs and translate design intent into required manufacturing process to complete a line up of automotive stamping tools.
•    Determine machining process and define areas of dies to be machined.
•    Required to create basic and complex fully surfaced models on CAD system.
•    Provide technical support to Machining, Fitting, and Engineering Departments throughout the die manufacturing process.
•    Maintain documentation record of complete die program.
•    Prepare reports and communicate all required information to appropriate parties as required or applicable.
•    Responsible for applicable QEMS policies, procedures and work instructions.
•    Perform other reasonable duties as required and assigned.
•    Responsible to carry out duties for Health, Safety, and Environment in accordance with the HS&E Agreement for Employees  - Addendum

Key Qualifications/Requirements


•    Minimum 3 Years’ shop floor experience preferred
•    Post-Secondary technical certificate, license or equivalent experience preferred
•    Full working knowledge of die-surfacing using Tebis, or equivalent software
•    Knowledge of CAM, CNC machining and die making methods an asset
•    Knowledge in reverse engineering from scan meshes (STL data) considered an asset
•    Administer CAD data to meet internal and external requirements
•    Good Mechanical Aptitude
•    Basic Math and Computer Skills
•    Ability to interpret blueprints
•    Good communication skills, interpersonal and organizational skills required.
•    Ability to work independently with minimum supervision.
•    Orientation, WHMIS, Fire Extinguisher Training, Smirtware, Tebis, 5S, 4DX, QEMS, ISO 9001 & ISO 14001 Awareness training (see EMS training matrix).

Additional Information

•    Day Shift
•    Overtime as required

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

title: CAD/BIM -Design Technology Specialist I (Underground)
description:
ABOUT MCMILLEN JACOBS ASSOCIATES

McMillen Jacobs Associates is an employee owned, multi-disciplined firm, with self-performing design-build capability. We are experts in underground/tunneling and water resources projects and deploy this expertise to serve the water, wastewater, transportation, dams, energy and aquaculture sectors including public, private, and regulatory clients using a wide range of delivery methods. For 75 years, we have worked closely with our clients at every stage of a project assisting them with planning, permits, designs, project management, construction, and start-up.

We want our employees to make a career doing what they love to do. We encourage an entrepreneurial spirit and help our team members forge their own path within the company. We support their efforts to stay on the cutting edge of technology while fostering a great work-life balance. In addition to working hard, we also have fun. We socialize and celebrate achievements at summer picnics, holiday parties, and company outings.

We are pleased to accept applications from underrepresented groups and encourage applications from Indigenous persons, youth, new immigrants, and persons with disabilities.

Benefits: Full Benefits Program consisting of Medical Services Plan (MSP), Registered Retirement Savings Plan, Dental, Extended Health Care Benefit, Critical Illness Insurance, Health Spending Account, Life Insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program, Education Reimbursement Program, Stock program, 10 Paid Holidays, Paid Time Off , Wellness Reimbursement, and Work from home flexibility.

CAD/BIM -Design Technology Specialist I

McMillen Jacobs Associates is looking for a Design Technologist who is proficient with AutoCAD design & drafting software to support our dynamic team of engineers and construction managers on high profile infrastructure projects. Familiarity with Autodesk's Civil 3D and Revit is also a plus. The successful candidate with be responsible for documentation preparation and interdisciplinary coordination for heavy civil, underground projects focusing on transportation and water conveyance. They may also provide support to civil construction inspection activities.

The successful candidate will be based in the downtown Vancouver office and this position will play a central role with our design technology team and will require someone motivated to constantly learn new skills as technology and CAD delivery advances.

This person will work closely with engineers, project managers, and our lead Design Technologist on local British Columbia projects, as well as support our offices across the United States and Australia. This is a great opportunity to define a career path with ample opportunities for growth and professional development.

This position requires exceptional communication and organizational skills, the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently, and the ability to work productively in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop preliminary and detailed engineering drawings and documents based on sketches, redline markups, and information based on verbal instructions and notes provided by designers and engineers.
  • Understand CAD/BIM requirements and adheres to standards.
  • Participate in Design Technology Practice Group initiatives.

Qualifications:

  • Civil Technology diploma
  • Experienced using the latest version of AutoCAD.
  • 0 - 4 years of Design Technology experience
  • Basic understanding of drawing presentation & organization.
  • Strong personal organization and time management skills as well as the ability to prioritize to meet deadlines.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

For additional company information and to apply online, please visit our website at www.mcmjac.com

No Recruiters, Please.

title: CAD Administrator
description:
The CAD Administrator is responsible to support the end users of the CAD and integration tools from the initial design to project completion.

This will include the execution of the maintenance and implementation tasks as required. The CAD Administrator will also be responsible to monitor processes, generate reports, and provide training for implemented processes and CAD tools in use by the end users. The CAD administrator will also support the development or improvements to the CAD tools and processes in use to meet current and future needs of the business. This will include the development, implementation and maintenance of the CAD tools, CAD tools integration with other current and future systems, development and implementation of processes related to the CAD environment, CAD templates, CAD standards, CAD part catalogues, libraries, and system specifications.

Duties/Accountabilities

Technical:

  • Support the CAD software implementation / integration with all VSY systems
  • Support for CAD database setup / management / administration
  • Maintain / update / tailor CAD library, CAD parts catalogues, system specifications, CAD templates, CAD standards
  • Support the CAD configuration control (model / MI), and data consistency with all VSY systems (e.g. ARAS / IFS, …etc)
  • Develop, generate or produce automatic extraction of CAD reports to support business needs
  • Provide CAD training and technical support to end users
  • Contribute to the development of strategies, processes, procedures, and WI to improve efficiency and quality in the use of CAD tools with the end users.
  • Develop, implement, and monitor customs tools / macros to enhance system functionality and improve overall performance
  • Find opportunities and recommendations for growing workflow efficiencies.
  • Support Digital Twin development and requirements
  • Monitor performance of the CAD hardware and software systems in use by the end users across the business.

Departmental:

  • Report resource and capability requirements to the Cad administration Manager.
  • Identify training needs, process improvements and development opportunities to ensure current and future team efficiency.

Education and Experience

  • Associate degree in CAD, engineering, a related field, or equivalent
  • Experience working with a variety of computer-aided design software, as well as excellent technical, analytical, and organizational skills.
  • Experience in Detailed Design in Shipbuilding or related field is highly preferred
  • 3-5 years 2D/3D CAD experience

Skills, Knowledge and Required Competencies

  • Demonstrated effective communication across a variety of cultures
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently to develop solutions to complex technical CAD problems
  • Good analytical skills to gather and analyze/synthesize data, confirming its accuracy and adequacy as an integral part of the business
  • Strong technical writing skills including the ability to produce and present clear detailed written technical specifications, procedures, and reports
  • Technical knowledge and marine engineering skills – cross-discipline expertise with design, detail planning, production, piping, structure, nesting and 3D models
  • Demonstrated knowledge of 3D CAD tools (ShipConstructor and/or Cadmatic), and AutoCAD software, document control systems and SQL database management.
  • Demonstrated knowledge with Navisworks, OneDrive and SharePoint
  • Experience in MSSQL and CAD scripting languages, LISP, Diesel, SQL, VBA considered an asset
  • Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills
  • Exercise good judgments and make decisions in a manner consistent with the essential job functions and corporate philosophy
  • Advanced PC and Network proficiency required – ability to fix network, licenses, version control across all MSOffice products and LISP programming

title: Civil Engineering – New Graduate
description:
At Fluor, we are proud to design and build projects and careers. This requires teams that are as unique as the projects we execute. We are committed to fostering a work environment that embraces Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DE&I) for all so our employees and stakeholders benefit from the creative solutions derived as a result of embracing differences.



Job Description:

Fluor is an industry leader in engineering, procurement, fabrication, construction and maintenance (EPFCM). With more than a century of global experience and 73 years in Canada, Fluor is the industry benchmark in building the most challenging and complex capital projects safely, on schedule and on budget.


Join us and be challenged to build great projects, a rewarding career and stronger communities.


Under the direction and guidance of senior engineers Civil Engineer in Training responsibilities include:

• Design of civil works for industrial projects involving site development earthwork, utilities and other infrastructures

• Design and analysis of roads and drainage.

• Design of pipelines for water and waste conveyance and deposition

• Prepare project deliverables such as drawings, specifications, reports and quantities take-offs

• Involved in the total project development; from preliminary feasibility studies, through \\actual design and construction.

Job ID: 132136BR

City: Vancouver

State: British Columbia

Country: Canada


We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of a diverse workforce. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by governing law.

title: PID Drafter
description:
What Vista Does

Vista Projects is an integrated industrial engineering firm that helps clients navigate the digital transformation of their projects and operations. Our proven project execution process is based on a â€œsingle source of truthâ€ model that eliminates the potential for inefficient engineering designs, cost overruns and project completion delays.

Why We Do It

We believe the world needs industrial projects and that intelligent engineering data can increase the likelihood of innovative solutions getting to market. Over the years, we have earned our reputation as a trusted industrial engineering partner, working on some of the most successful facility projects in the Canadian energy sector.

Where We Work

The benefits of our approach apply across several industrial markets, from biofuels and produced water treatment to gas processing and in-situ heavy oil. Our headquarters are in Calgary, Alberta.

What You Would Do in This Role

The Designer/Drafter assists in the preparation of design documents and drawings during the execution of a project specific to their discipline specialty.

  • Preparing layouts, calculations and designs related to the most complicated elements of projects
  • Drafting moderate-to-complex 2D drawings, charts, schedules, etc.
  • Preparing as-built drawings based on field red-line markups 
  • Performing other duties as requested

Discipline-Specific Duties & Competencies for Piping Design

  • Drafting 2D drawings including PFDs, P&IDs, DPDTs, MSDs, plot plans, key plans, site plans, etc.
  • Drafting intelligent P&IDs using PDMS, SmartPlant or other such software, AVEVA diagrams
  • Conforming to client and company standards when carrying out intelligent P&ID (or project specific equivalent) data entry tasks such as item tagging for equipment, piping, manual valves and instrumentation (in addition to other object properties)

Requirements

  • Technical school certification / degree or equivalent experience
  • Proficiency in AutoCAD
  • Ability to work within a multi-disciplinary team including Process, Mechanical,
  • Civil, Structural & Architectural, Electrical, Instrumentation & Controls and Piping
  • Excellent communication skills (interpersonal and written) and proven ability to collaborate with team members in a multi-discipline environment
  • Strong organizational skills, technical competence and attention to detail

Preferred

  • Ten years of experience in a designer capacity, ideally with a focus on the energy industry
  • Two years of experience in facilities engineering and design in the energy industry
  • Technical school certification
  • Advanced computer skills and experience in major design so

Why People Like Working with Us

Working with Vista is a chance to contribute to the type of challenging industrial projects that the world requires. If that doesnâ€™t excite you, this role likely wonâ€™t be a fit.

Challenging projects require focus and we enable our people to do their best work with modernized project systems that are based on our leading use of intelligent data-centric execution architecture. Our staff and clients like it because it gives them real-time access to validated data shared across all project departments. This fosters project design and business decisions based on a single, authoritative source of truth and provides increased transparency and collaboration with team members and clients, leading to improved engineering quality and a product we can all take pride in.

What We Offer

An opportunity with Vista is not just a job; it is a chance to tackle challenging industrial projects with colleagues who are among the most recognized and accomplished in their disciplines.

Vista offers all employees

  • A stimulating, fast-paced and challenging work environment where you will contribute to the interesting industrial engineering projects;
  • A robust and consistent recruitment process that ensures your colleagues are likeminded and comparably capable;
  • An opportunity to be a part of an entrepreneurial, technically skilled team which has established leadership in innovative engineering solutions;
  • A strong value-based philosophy that provides an informal, close-knit team environment, where you and your family feel like a part of our organization, and not just an employee number;
  • Competitive compensation and benefits, including a performance-linked variable pay program;
  • Company-sponsored social events and team sports;
  • Flexible work schedules, half-day Fridays and free parking;
  • An organization that values and encourages diversity;
  • Shareholder opportunities are a long-term potential for exceptional employees.

How to Apply

Please complete the application form below and include a cover letter concisely demonstrating how your skills and experience align with our job posting. By submitting this application, you consent to our Privacy Policy, and you consent to receive transactional electronic messages from Vista and third parties acting on our behalf.

Note: As part of the hiring process there will be a technical testing component that will take up to two hours and can be completed at home on your own timelines. Candidates may be required to complete a security clearance procedure prior to receiving an offer.

title: Engineering Technologist (Civil Drafter) - Intermediate
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

Why Join the IBI Family:

  • Our exhaustive practice covers the full spectrum of engineering services, from traditional projects to emerging technology-driven fields
  • You will be part of an elite team of engineers who are tightly connected to the other architectural, planning and systems experts within IBI Group as part of our “global intelligence/local knowledge” approach
  • You will be valued and given ample of opportunities for further business development within our very own IBI internal career path

Our Values:

  • Integrity – We do what is right
  • Partnerships – We work together
  • Excellence – We pursue design excellence
  • Innovation – We embrace ingenuity
  • Community – We build community
  • Environment – We take action on climate change

Most of the Things You’ll Work on:

  • The primary duty of the Engineering Technologist is to develop complex engineering drawings and be able to prepare designs and estimates from general instruction and/or preliminary sketches, diagrams or schematics, under minimal supervision
  • In addition, the role may recommend modifications and changes for design improvement and simplification and prepare working drawings from conceptual layouts to detailed finished products
  • Coordinate BIM/CADD projects with other discipline personnel, and prepare/assemble project deliverables, as well as, develop basic to mid-level designs/layouts, and prepare basic design calculations
  • This position requires effective time-management and the ability to work well within a team of BIM/CADD technicians and potentially providing technical guidance to less experienced design staff
Qualifications

You'll Need to Have:

  • A Civil Engineering Technology diploma, preferred (or equivalent)
  • Between 3 to 7 years of experience in structural engineering projects within private land development, government, institutional, infrastructure, commercial and/or industrial required
  • LRT/Rail projects and Water & Wastewater experience preferred
  • Current OACETT membership is an asset
  • Must be knowledgeable in basic construction practices for civil/structural fieldwork and have the ability to generate drawings for engineers and make suggestions for further development
  • Must be proficient in both Revit andAutoCAD
  • Must have BIM knowledge
  • MicroStation experience is preferable but not necessary (training will be provided)
  • Should be experienced with Microsoft Office programs
  • Excellent analytical and maths skills are a must
  • Must have effective written, communication, analytical, and interpersonal skills to be able to work well in teams


Additional Information

We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19 but when we do return to the office we're located at 175 Galaxy Boulevard in Toronto. 

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Similar positions/roles: Engineering Technician, Structural Drafter, Civil Technologist, Civil Drafter.  Similar projects: LRT/Rail projects and Water & Wastewater projects.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: CAD Technician
description:
About Houle Electric:

At Houle, we are passionate about building resilient communities. From airports, shipping terminals, and water treatment facilities, to hospitals, universities, and shopping centres, we deliver integrated electrical solutions for our industrial, commercial, institutional and residential customers.

While we are leaders in electrical construction, we also specialize in a wide range of in-house technology solutions, including audio visual, building automation, healthcare systems, network systems, and security and life-safety. As a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, we take pride in our talented people and collaborative culture that bring our client's vision to life.

About the position:

Houle's Project Planning Services department is looking for a CAD Technician to join the team. Our planning department specializes in designing and creating installation drawings from engineering construction documents, to the field stage for installation. This encompasses many electrical systems such as distribution infrastructures, wall elevations, branch power & lighting, fire alarm, and technology systems such as structured cabling, nurse call, and security.

Based out of Kelowna, the Project Planning Services team supports our large Design Build projects across the province, ranging from large residential, office high rises to major hospitals.

As a CAD Technician, your responsibilities would be to support and work closely with our electrical planners to provide CAD assisted drafting. This entails producing a wide range of 2D drawings including, Schematics, build details, templates, technical drawing manipulation, dynamic block design, single line drawings, hand sketches to line layouts, as-builts, dimensioning, equipment layouts, section cuts, process feedback and collaboration.

Not only will you get to operate within CAD, but we also hope that you will take on the challenge of learning some base electrical planning with the close guidance of our planners.

Duties and responsibilities:

The incumbent would be responsible for working with our project planning services team to:

  • Work side by side with our planners to create drawings within CAD, on electrical products, such as Conduit racks, distribution equipment, light fixtures, and in wall devices.
  • Develop drawings using design information provided from hand sketches, Bluebeam and CAD including system line diagrams, floor plans, and elevations

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and attributes:

  • Relevant Education
  • 1+ years of AutoCAD software application experience
  • Revit experience would be an asset
  • Experience with document control
  • Capable of working side by side with planners to adjust detailing
  • Experience in architectural drafting an asset
  • Experience with reviewing and navigating through typical construction drawings
  • Knowledge of Electrical materials and methods is an asset
  • Thorough understanding and efficiency with drafting standards
  • Strong organizational and prioritizing skills with the ability to take initiative
  • Energetic, flexible, problem solving mindset

Culture is important at Houle. You must be collaborative in nature. You are a solution focused team player and always willing to learn. You are a bright, ambitious, honest, and a straight forward professional. Your personable nature will fit well within the friendly working environment.

The compensation for this position will be commensurate with experience. Houle offers an exciting, enjoyable work environment, competitive benefits package as well as a competitive incentive plan and many company sponsored events.

To apply, please visit https://www.houle.ca/current-career-opportunities/ and click on the listing for "CAD Technician". Opportunity will remain open until filled.

For the interview process, please be prepared to showcase your portfolio. Testing may also be required.

*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*
