title: AutoCAD Drafter
description:
Our client in the Burlington area has partnered with Randstad Engineering in search of a Product Detailer/Drafter who will ensure generation of accurate RSO (Rough Stud Opening) and Work Orders for release to the production shop by utilizing Order Drawings in combination with contract specifications and Purchase Orders to determine upgrades, modifications, contract and building code compliance. In addition, the Product Detailer will assist in the review and correction of other team member’s work.

Advantages
- Benefits
- Vacation
- Profit sharing
- Great company culture
- Permanent position

Responsibilities
- Creation of detailed accurate production drawings.
- Review of architectural drawings from customers to determine layout of stairs.
- Interpret blueprints.
- Review and interpretation of Purchase Orders.
- Following up on orders missing information or requiring clarification.
- Generating a bill of materials for custom orders for hardware or wood.
- Process improvement.
- Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
- Post-secondary education with a focus on woodworking preferred.
- Must be able to communicate effectively (both written and oral).
- Must be able to work independently as well as in a group setting.
- Ability to interpret technical drawing correctly.
- 2-3 years of RSO experience preferred.
- Woodworking / Carpentry experience preferred.
- Highly detail oriented and organized.
- Proficiency in AutoCAD, Outlook and MS Office and Excel.
- Strong commitment to project completion with a respect for benchmarks and timelines.
- Adaptable with an emphasis on continued learning.

Summary
Apply online today! Or send your resume to Ommaira Kawshy at ommaira.kawshy@randstad.ca.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Leak Survey Technician - Ottawa
description:
• Full-time permanent position. Monday-Friday
  • Entry-level
  • Competitive hourly rate ($18.58 starting wage) with regularly scheduled opportunities for performance-based raises and bonuses
  • Exceptional health benefits, including for family
  • Defined contribution pension plan and employee assistance program
  • Company cell phone provided
  • Company car provided for work only, which you can park at home
  • Work independently outdoors

Wouldn’t it be great to find a company that will give you a chance to prove yourself, and grow a career quickly?

Look no further. G-Tel is hiring and training new Leak Survey Technicians to complete jobs in and around your area. The G-Tel family includes multiple growing companies providing electrical distribution infrastructure, energy and power generation services.

 

In this role, you will:

  • Receive full 3 - 4 weeks’ training
  • Receive assignments and routes to follow each day
  • Use state of the art equipment (including infra-red and flame ionization) to examine buried gas lines, and detect/report buried gas leaks.
  • Prepare reports and documentation that based on your work
  • From there, your reports will go to the people who repair the leaks, so they can make sure the gas lines stay in good working order.

 

Qualifications

  • Have experience, or would definitely enjoy, working outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Be physically fit and able to walk frequently (up to 20-25km/day), sit in a vehicle, and lift/carry up to 20 lbs
  • Be able to visually distinguish colours
  • Have a valid Ontario “G” class driver’s license and be able to produce a clean drivers abstract
  • Have a high school diploma
  • Be willing to obtain and wear CSA approved steel toe safety boots
  • Be willing to undergo and successfully clear a criminal background check
  • Willingness to work weekends and overtime is an asset, but not required
  • Have general computer knowledge (browser, email, Microsoft Office)

Note: Proof of COVID vaccination is not required.

title: Junior or Intermediate Architectural Designer
description:
Junior or Intermediate Architectural Designer
Calgary, Alberta
Competitive Salary + Benefits
Architecture and Design firm

Other titles: Designer, Design Architect, Architectural Designer, Intermediate Architectural Designer, Intern Architect, Design Specialist

OUR CLIENT
An excellent opportunity exists with a leading Architecture, Design & Planning firm for a talented, creative and motivated Architectural Designer to join their Calgary office. With a focus on collaboration, quality design and excellent service delivery, this firm have a strong reputation and some high profile projects across North America.

THE JOB
As an Architectural Designer, you will be involved in the following:
  • Work with Senior staff to develop a wide range of architectural designs in collaboration with clients and design teams, that meet quality parameters, project timelines and budgetary requirements
  • Gain familiarity with current design trends, building systems and presentation techniques to improve skills and implement them on project work 
  • Prepare drawings, models and renderings, following office standards
  • Prepare and coordinate presentation materials to ensure project documentation is complete and accurate 
  • Perform programming, code research, material and building systems research, site surveys and field reviews, laying out program components and calculating program and building areas 
  • Work collaboratively with design and production team as well as project leads assist the coordination the design through all phases of the project 
  • Other architectural tasks as required
WHAT'S REQUIRED
To be considered for this role, you should have the following skills, qualifications and experience:
  • Have successfully completed an architectural related post-secondary education - a bachelor of Architecture or diploma in Architectural Technology / other. 
  • Possess at least 3 years' experience working with Architectural Design, with at least 2 years coming from within North America
  • Be proficient in design and rendering skills, i.e. Revit, AutoCAD, SketchUp and Photoshop; other programs an asset
  • Have experience in architectural design presentation 
  • Have some familiarity with Mechanical, Electrical, and Structural permits and building codes
  • Possess superior time management, communication and problem solving skills
  • Demonstrate an ability to coordinate with other team members and to collaborate with other professional disciplines
WHAT TO DO NOW
If you believe this position could be the perfect fit for you, click apply/ We thank all candidates for their applications, however, only those who meet the requirements of the position above with be contacted.

Keywords: Architectural Designer, Calgary, Designer, Design Lead, Alberta,  Design Architect

title: CAD Technologist
description:
GeoVerra is in acceleration mode. Our growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your GeoVerra career will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

You GeoVerra

Our leaders at GeoVerra set the standard for our company, and the industry. We look for the bestâ€”adaptable managers and professionals with a deep understanding of surveying with an array of projects, challenges and successes under their belt who are always striving for more.

Our new CAD Technologist will be located at one of the following British Columbia office locations: Langley, Kelowna, Victoria, Cranbrook, Invermere or Fort St. John.  Our new CAD Technologist will lead by example: Professional. Positive. Productive. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with excellent communication skills. New ideas or creative flow is important tooâ€”hit us with the strategies or suggestions that makes our team operate even better. Weâ€™re passionate about learning every day and being impactfulâ€”and our leaders reflects that in their daily work.

Responsibilities:

  • Produce and maintain survey plans, industrial plans, civil plans, photo mosaics, record drawings and the collection, analysis, storage, distribution and application of spatial and three-dimensional data used in land development. 
  • Ensure that assignment requirements are understood and what the time allocations are to complete the assigned tasks. 
  • Self-check assignments prior to drawings being given to the CAD Team Lead for final approval.
  • Adhere to current CAD standards and provide feedback as required.
  • Adhere to the use of current departmental check sheets and work flow procedures.
  • Ensure drawings meet client timelines and deliverables.
  • CAD Technologist additional roles:
  • Assist in the development of CAD standards and procedures.
  • Support the CAD Team Lead in coordinating and mentoring junior staff regarding CAD standards and accuracy requirements.

Qualifications:

  • Diploma or Degree in Geomatics Engineering Technology, Engineering Design & Drafting Technology, Civil Engineering Technology, or related discipline; or certification in related CAD courses.
  • Member in good standing or eligible for registration with local Survey or Technologist Association is preferable.
  • An understanding of CAD requirements on various surveying projects.
  • Intermediate CAD Technologist: 4-6 years direct related experience.
  • Proficient in Windows; MS Word and other Microsoft Office applications. Experienced in the use of the latest versions of AutoCAD, Civil 3D and Coordinate Geometry software.
  • Knowledge of civil engineering design components, alignments, grading, volumes and site construction works.
  • Contribute on an on-going basis toward maintaining a safe working environment both for yourself and for those working with you or in your close vicinity.
  • Ability to work to deadlines and see tasks through to completion.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Good analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Must be able to import data and create plans of survey.
  • Must maintain a strong technological base and be able to maintain a high level of production.
  • Ability to work without supervision; effective time management and strong organizational skills.
  • Adaptable and able to think outside the box.
  • Ability to support and mentor/teach other members of the team.

What GeoVerra can offer you:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Comprehensive benefits coverage, vacation, wellness days, and RRSP matching contributions
  • Tools and services to support your mental wellness
  • Flexible workplace program to suit your needs
  • Work-life balance
  • Growth and advancement opportunities
  • Paid professional dues
  • Continuing education and professional development
  • Use of leading-edge technology and equipment
  • Diverse projects and a fast-paced working environment
  • Support to the communities we live and work in

The Partnership Promise

This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Drafter
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview:

The Drafter will be involved in developing production drawings for various standard and custom concrete products, including pipe and precast components.    

Responsibilities:
  • Prepare shop drawings for various pipe products
  • Work with sales staff and project managers to develop production drawings from tender documents
  • Work with production staff to ensure drawings are interpreted properly
  • Look for ways to save production materials, money, etc. while developing drawings
  • Look for and resolve errors in drawings
  • Deal with and solve problems in an effective manner
  • Carry out scheduled ground maintenance work
  • Perform several types of manual work
  • Handle materials, tools and equipment
  • Property maintenance
  • Operate automotive vehicles when required
  • Operate weed eater
  • Assist with general pit clean up  
Qualifications:
  • High School Diploma
  • Currently enrolled in Engineering or related program
  • Knowledgeable in AutoCAD  
  • Proven experience using AutoCAD to develop production drawings
  • Demonstrates a strong commitment to safety
  • Excellent communication skills and works well in a team environment
  • Ability to work independently

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Field Survey Technician
description:
The Opportunity: 
McElhanney Ltd. has a rewarding opportunity for an individual to join our team as a Field Survey Technician to join our team in Peace River, AB. We are a unique office that provides a wide range of engineering services to clients throughout Northwestern Alberta.

This position requires a motivated, highly productive person to lead a busy survey crew carrying out legal, topographic, and construction layout surveys. The successful candidate will work within a team on a variety of projects including Land Development, municipal infrastructure, and road construction. In this role you will work alongside experienced survey technicians under supervision of an Alberta Land Surveyor. This role is ideal for a coachable individual who is excited to be a part of a growing team in a fast-paced industry.

What You’ll Be Doing
  • Lead a field crew (2 person or independent) for various surveys including legal, land development (subdivisions), topographic, and construction layout.
  • Provide on-site contractor inspections to monitor the quality and progress of the work being performed
  • Perform on-site liaison between Project Manager and client/contractor as required.
  • Perform computations of survey data as required.
  • Manage flow of information between field and office, and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations.
  • Be forward thinking; understand the construction progress and be able to learn the specifications and requirements of the work which they will be inspecting
  • Help prepare monthly progress payments and other associated Contract Administration tasks
  • Provide mentorship and leadership to junior or support staff.
  • Understand, commit to, and fulfill responsibilities under the McElhanney Quality Management System, ISO 9001 and all client quality, safety, and environmental management systems

 What You’ll Bring 
  • 2-year technical diploma in Geomatics with at least 5 years’ previous experience in a similar role
  • Periods of travel will be required for the role
  • Willingness to commit to construction projects for the duration of the project
  • Experience with Municipal, Highways, or Bridge construction projects is an asset
  • Proficiency in computer systems, and survey related software applications (MicroSurvey/StarNet, AutoCAD Civil 3D, and Trimble Business Centre software knowledge an asset)
  • Ability to foresee potential issues and problems so these items can be addressed and resolved
  • Exceptional organization and follow-up skills; ability to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment, meticulous note keeping
  • Clean driving record and the ability to comply with client-driven D&A testing requirements
  • Effective communication skills

Key Characteristics for Best Fit:
  • Desire to work on construction projects in various locations throughout Northwestern Alberta
  • Enjoy working outdoors with willingness to work in adverse weather conditions and at night
  • Ability to work well with contractors and thrive in team environments
  • A curious individual who is eager to learn new skills, including the progression construction from drawings and specifications to a completed product.
  • The flexibility to learn new skills and expand your areas of expertise

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle 
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave 
  • Great benefits, including extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching 
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone 
  • A family-like culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all 
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth 
  • Ability to become a shareholder in an employee-owned company 

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As an employee owned and operated firm with over 1,000 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high level of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation, and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

#onsite  #LI-INTERMEDI #LI-AM3 #LI-onsite #INTERMEDIATE
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney’s Prairies region boasts successful operations in Calgary, Edmonton, Canmore, and Saskatoon. Our clients rely on us for consulting projects in Transportation and Municipal Planning and Design, Structural Design, Landscape Architecture, and Environmental services.
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Intermediate Piping Designer - (Job Number: EDM01B6)
description:
Intermediate Piping Designer

Company: Worley
Primary Location: CAN-AB-Edmonton
Job: Piping<
Schedule: Full-time
Employment Type: Employee
Job Level: Experienced<
Job Posting: Apr 20, 2022
Unposting Date: May 21, 2022
Reporting Manager Title: Piping Department Manager

48,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.
Wersquo;re not just engineers. Wersquo;re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers andinnovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals andresources get one step closer to solving our planetrsquo;s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition.Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?


Whatever your ambition, therersquo;s a path for you here. And therersquo;s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visitWorley.com


Responsibilities

  • Be responsible to have a full understanding of the projectrsquo;s scope, overall schedule, deliverables, milestones, manhour budgets, industry standards, applicable codes, and procedures
  • Develop hour estimates
  • Develop a staffing plan to satisfy budget and schedule
    Determine line count and estimated isometric quantities based on Pamp;IDrsquo;s
  • Establish design areas within the unit/areas of responsibility
  • Monitor and utilize the Master Pamp;ID MOC (Management of Change) log to identify scope change
  • Utilize a 3D model review software to monitor design quality and progress
  • Coordinate the design effort with other engineering and design disciplines
  • Develop general arrangements of plant facilities, structures and equipment considering safe maintenance and construction while interfacing with all engineering and design disciplines
  • Locate and identify pipe support types; input the field data into a 3D model

What you will bring

Technical and Industry Experience:

  • Minimum 8 years of relevant lead piping designer and layout design experience for power, chemical, and industrial facilities
  • Strong background in discipline work and a competent understanding of regulations, codes, manufacturing standards, and industry standard practices
  • Skilled in estimating project costs and writing proposal content
  • MS Office skills (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) required
  • Experience using 3D model design software
  • Experience with the application of Microstation V8i amp; AutoCAD
  • Leadership and project execution experience
  • Experience developing Piping Models, Pipe Supports, Equipment Models, Isometric and Orthographic Drawing extraction is a plus
  • Field design experience with the capability to perform field walk downs using Pamp;IDrsquo;s, locating tie points dimensionally, and routing pipe through existing facilities

Education ndash; Qualifications, Accreditation, Training:


Required:

What we offer you

Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.


Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.

If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it#39;s time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.

title: Jr. Radiation Surveyor
description:
Jr Radiation Surveyor- (3-5 years R.S. field experience) $45.75 /hr CAD (Canadian citizens and permanent residents may elect to have $7.00 /hr of the advertised salary designated as an RRSP contribution).
 Per Diem up to $750.00/week CAD for ALL eligible employees
Retention Bonus
Work week 37.5 hours
For additional details call Lethea Davis at 800-225-0385 ext 1393
Terms of Employment: Temporary, Full Time
 
Work Setting:
Federal government or agency, manufacturing and or industrial plant
 Security & Safety:
Criminal record check, basic security check
 Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities:
Attention to detail, combination of sitting, standing and walking
 Transportation/Travel Information:
Valid driver"s license, own transportation
 
Specific Skills: Abbreviated
Conduct radiation, contamination surveys in compliance with ES&H and RP programs of natural environment, nuclear facilities and or potential nuclear environments, collect samples for analysis, identify, monitor and control of spills of hazardous chemicals and nuclear contamination, survey and inspect work areas for nuclear hazards, construction /deconstruction health hazards, develop and implement health and safety plans, ensure health and safety procedures and regulations are followed, perform worker pre job briefs associated with known or possible hazards. Perform air sampling and data analysis, perform and document log book and computer updates of data collected, perform posting and labeling verification of hazard identification per regulations and site specific procedures.
 
Type of Inspection and Investigation:
Radiation emissions, hazardous products handling and storage work place
Own Tools/Equipment
Steel toed safety boots, cellular phone
Personal Suitability:
Judgement, excellent oral communication, excellent written communication, client focus, team player, flexibility
 

 
How to Apply:
BHI Energy Canada
1200 Bay St., Suite 200
Toronto, ON M5R 2A5
Lethea Davis
Lethea.davis@bhienergy.ca
800-225-0385 x1393

  • Secondary (high) school graduation certificate
  • 3 plus years experience

title: Technician, CAD Processing
description:
Samuel, Son & Co. is growing! If you're looking for a rewarding career opportunity with a family run, industry leading organization, bring your experience and motivated attitude to Samuel, Son & Co.

We are seeking a CAD Programmer to join our team in Delta, BC. 

Here are some of what we have to offer:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Paid vacation and an annual bonus
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Pension plan with company match
  • Opportunity for fast advancement and career growth 

As the CAD Programmer, you will play a key role in plate burning operations. Your contributions will go beyond simply programming CNC machines to include optimizing processes, saving costs and being involved in quoting. Your ability to learn will allow you to learn additional technologies and grow your abilities and effectiveness to the team. 
 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Read and interpret blue prints to understand the specifications for each job
  • Program for CNC plate burning machines using AutoCAD and other related software.
  • Assist sales in the creation of quotes
  • Create effective programs that are time and cost efficient
  • Plan appropriately to optimize the nest (cut the most possible pieces from a plate)

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Post-Secondary Education in Engineering or Engineering Technician preferred
  • Able to read, modify and create drawings in AutoCAD
  • Experience or exposure to CNC programming
  • Experience in ProNest and/or PrimeCut considered an asset
  • Comfortable using Microsoft Office applications
  • Exposure to AS400 or other ERP systems Microsoft Dynamics is an asset
  • Strong aptitude for learning new technologies
  • Clear written and oral communication
  • Keen attention to detail
  • Comfortable working in a team environment with multiple competing priorities

title: Drafter
description:
Your Employer

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and it’s more than 2,600 people, concerned about the environment daily, engaged in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

We offer

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);

  • a telemedicine virtual health care service;

  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage teleworking.

Englobe is currently looking for a Drafter for its Kitchener, Ontario office.

Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.


Your Contribution

 

  • Produce drawings based on engineering and field sketches;
  • Utilize PDFs and CAD drawings from others for use as base drawings in our site and location plans;
  • Set-up and download handheld GPS units;
  • Experience in gINT Software for drafting borehole logs;
  • Prepare logs for boreholes, monitoring wells and test pits;
  • Prepare figures, charts and graphical representations of laboratory and field test results;
  • Prepare geologic cross-sections and isopach mapping;
  • Import borehole locations into Google Earth borehole database;
  • Manage requests from multiple project managers;
  • Other related tasks.

Your Profile

 

  • Diploma in AutoCAD Drafting or in a related field;
  • Approximately 2 years of relevant experience;
  • Excellent knowledge of AutoCAD and Civil 3D, 2014 to latest version;
  • Experience with Geotec software (asset);
  • Experience with gInt 8i (asset)
  • Experience with Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access (asset);
  • Ability to read technical plans;
  • Detail-oriented and organized.

title: Solution Consultant, Applications - CAD/ PLM- Junior
description:
PROFILE

The Applications Solution Consultant for CAD/PLM supports the Adaptive CAD/PLM Team and sales staff to perform consulting services and presales/post sales activities. This role leverages knowledge and technical expertise within the Adaptive CAD/PLM team, our software partners, and industry best practices to perform consulting, software demonstrations, training, and technical support for Adaptive's clients.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Learn the 3DEXPERIENCE CATIA and ENOVIA roles, and able to perform services and customer facing demonstrations using these roles
    • Be well versed in and demonstrate advanced PLM concepts including Change Management, BOM Management, Variant Configurations using the 3DEXPERIENCE Platform
  • Complete 3DEXPERINCE CATIA, ENOVIA and other Dassault Brand/Industry Certifications related to your responsibilities as assigned by your team leader
  • Manage the execution of services projects, ensuring they are completed on schedule and budget
  • Proactively learn and continually develop skills with our software solutions to better provide services to our clients
  • Actively participate in Adaptive, TriMech and Dassault Systemes events, tradeshows, and seminars as required
  • Support the creation of technical content to be used to win customer and/or maintain customer productivity/satisfaction
    • How to Tips/Videos
    • Blog content
    • White papers/tech tips for newsletter
    • Be an ambassador of the TriMech Way and our company culture

REQUIREMENTS

  • Experience: Minimum 1-5 years in Automotive, Aerospace, Industrial Equipment or equivalent engineering field, or experience in a customer facing role supporting sales activities for Dassault Systemes products
  • Education: B.S. degree in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline or equivalent job experience
  • Skills and Knowledge:
    • Ability to work in a high-pressure, deadline-driven environment
    • Exceptional communication and reporting skills
    • 1-3 years of Mechanical CAD experience (CATIA preferred)
    • Outstanding leadership skills and ability to delegate responsibilities effectively
    • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
    • Proficient with Microsoft Office tools
    • Familiarity with engineering and discrete manufacturing processes
  • Willing to learn new software product skills and use them for consulting or technical sales activities
  • Ability to perform in a fast paced, results focused environment
  • Ability to travel on a frequent/as needed basis within the assigned territories
  • Preference will be given to candidates who have one or more of the following skills:
    • Extensive CATIA V5 or 3DEXPERIENCE CATIA knowledge
    • CATIA Electrical experience (V5 or 3DX)
    • CATIA Mechanical or Surfacing experience (V5 or 3DX)
    • Advanced PLM experience (any PLM system)

      Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job.

      Job Duties may change at any time with or without notice.

      TriMech is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex (including gender identity and sexual orientation), disability, age, national origin, or protect veteran status or any other protected status.

title: Cad Detailer
description:
Mechanical Detailer 

itec group Inc. is currently recruiting for a Mechanical Detailer. The successful incumbent will be tasked to provide assistance on maintaining mechanical drawings in Solidworks and company software. This is a great opportunity to improve practical and technical skills to prepare for future career opportunities. At itec group, we provide candidates with a seamless experience to transition into suitable roles as professionals in their desired fields. 

Key Qualifications include but are not limited to: 
  • Valid driver’ s license and experience in a similar role 
  • At least 3 years of experience in Solidworks 
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite 
  • Strong technical, attention to detail, and communication skills
Key Responsibilities include but are not limited to: 
  • Maintain component drawings, drawing layouts, and reworks 
  • Maintain and update project documentation, project notes, and 3D models - Communicate with key personnel and suppliers 
  • Collaborate with staff on manual creations and updates 

If you are interested in learning more about the Mechanical Detailer opportunity and meet the required qualifications, please submit your updated resume directly to lance@itecgroup.ca. 

We are recruitment industry leaders committed to quality service, integrity, respect and equal opportunity. Accommodation is available to all applicants upon request throughout our recruitment process. Please contact us at admin@itecgroup.ca or 1-877-682-8889 x223 if you require accommodation. We will work with all applicants to accommodate their accessibility needs. By applying for this position you are consenting to receive electronic messages related to the consideration of employment through itec group and its clients. title: Draftsperson
description:
Our Design Team works within the Preconstruction Team to create and coordinate Building Information Models for large multi-family projects throughout Western Canada. The Draftsperson is responsible for developing concept plans, drafting permit submission plans, and issuing construction drawing sets. The role will also be accountable for the review and coordination of shop drawings related to their assigned projects.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop and prepare architectural designs and drawings from preliminary concepts, sketches and specifications
  • Create 3-dimensional BIM models for use by various departments and teams
  • Utilize BIM to analyze potential design solutions for building services clashes
  • Produce, organize and distribute all building plans including Development Permit, Building Permits, Issued for Construction and Site Instructions
  • Efficiently operate computer-assisted design and drafting workstations
  • Complete documentation packages and produce drawing sets based on current project and team needs
  • Check and verify design drawings to conform to specifications and design data
  • Ensure clientsâ€™ needs are met in a timely and cost-effective manner
  • Maintain current knowledge of National and Provincial building codes
  • Perform other duties as required

REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum post-secondary diploma in drafting, architecture or equivalent
  • Minimum 1 yearsâ€™ experience working with REVIT
  • Minimum one year of experience with design for residential construction
  • Experience with multifamily wood frame construction preferred
  • Ability to create preliminary designs or conceptualization of design
  • Demonstrated success in project delivery and execution
  • Ability to create presentation drawings with perspectives using REVIT
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills.
  • Exceptional organizational abilities with task prioritization, multi-tasking and time management techniques

Why Seymour Pacific?

Seymour Pacific Developments is an industry leader in building multi-family homes with unparalleled speed and efficiency. We develop and build over 1,500 units a year by leveraging effective teamwork and industry expertise. We offer excellent wages and benefits, as well as a variety of training for employees who are motivated to succeed and want to expand their horizons. Seymour Pacific Developments is an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to following safe and inclusive hiring practices.

title: Industrial Drafting Technician - Structural Steel - Steel Detailer - Canada
description:
POSITION: INDUSTRIAL DRAFTING TECHNICIAN - STRUCTURAL STEEL - STEEL DETAILER

IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR: PROJECT MANAGER

LOCATION: CANADA AND USA

Candidates outside the continental United States and Canada will not be considered

Goal of position:

The person in this will perform as a full-time employee, must be able to create and develop steel models and prepare fabrication drawings. Working hours are from 8:30 am to 4:30 pm with some overtime required occasionally.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Create and develop structural steel models based on the contract documents using SDS/2 steel detailing software;
  • Prepare fabrication (shop) drawings and erection drawings as required;
  • Help to coordinate projects and/or check drawings prepared by others;
  • Maintain a current working knowledge and understanding of the latest version of the AISC/CISC Steel Construction Manual as it relates to connection design, detailing practices, steel member dimensions and properties;
  • Review contract documents to understand project's scope and requirements, identify all potential areas of concern and prepare Request For Information (RFI's) as required;
  • Interpret and incorporate Approval Comments, Contract Changes and other revisions into the scope of the project;
  • Prepare all necessary lists, documents or files (shop & field bolts, galvanized pieces, CNC files, etc.) to the appropriate department in support of the project;
  • Participate in the quality management program.

Qualifications:

  • 5 + years professional experience detailing structural steel using software SDS/2 3D steel detailing software;
  • Certified Engineering Technician or Technologist is an asset;
  • Some schooling or practical experience in reviewing/analyzing/interpreting professional drawings such as architectural, structural or mechanical drawings;
  • Knowledge of AWS/CWB welding practices and procedures as well as a working knowledge of shop and erection equipment and practices;
  • Knowledge and experience working with CISC/AISC codes;
  • Dedicated team player with good interpersonal and communication skills;
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products.

Requirements:

  • Must possess a valid work permit for Canada or USA. Any candidate who does not currently possess a valid work permit will not be considered;
  • Must residing in the continental United States or Canada. Candidates outside the continental United States and Canada will not be considered.

title: Junior Surveyor
description:
The Junior surveyor will work with various types of survey equipment including Trimble GPS, Trimble Machine Control and conventional lasers. The Junior Surveyors will be trained to perform many duties; including the following:
 
  •  Layout for site grading, site servicing, curb and sidewalk
  •  Calculating cuts and fills
  •  Grade checking
  •  Performing topographical surveys
  •  Setting up and taking down GPS base stations and GPS machine-controlled equipment
  •  Calibrating new sites
 
 Kieswetter Excavating Inc. is a leader in excavating, site grading and site servicing activities; Working on many of the areas highest-profile projects. We are a fourth-generation, family-owned company which works primarily in Waterloo Region and surrounding area. Our operation is built around the latest in GPS technologies; from estimating to machine control; and is seen as a North American leader at technology adaptation in the industry. We look forward to hearing from motivated individuals who take interest in these tasks.

title: Civil Engineering Student
description:
Overview:

Your opportunity  

Are you someone with developing leadership and technical capabilities?   Do you enjoy building relationships and working collaboratively in a team environment with both internal and external stakeholders.   As someone with excellent communication skills and business acumen, you will thrive in our fast-paced and agile environment.

 

Dillonâ€™s  Communities and Environment  technical group is looking for an  interim Engineering Student to join our multidisciplinary team of professionals. You will have the opportunity to work on new and exciting projects while providing clients with a fully integrated and superior customer experience.

 

At Dillon, we operate as one team. This position is available in our Dillon  Saint John or Fredericton office.  

Responsibilities:

What your day will look like

  • Contribute technical expertise to multidisciplinary project teams on a variety of projects for both public and private sector clients
  • Assist with related field work (onsite inspections, data collection, monitoring, etc.) for engineering or multi-disciplinary projects
  • Assist with project team activities, and assistance to project managers
  • Business travel upon request
Qualifications:

What you will need to succeed

  1. A degree or diploma in Civil Engineering preferred
Experience:
  1. Strong verbal and written communications skills, and keen attention to detail
  2. Demonstrated abilities in multidisciplinary teamwork
  3. Aptitude to learn
  4. Exceptional communication (verbal and written) skills are essential

Why choose Dillon

Dillon is powered by people who are technically proficient, passionate about socially important projects, and motivated to deliver superior, tangible results. We strive to remain at the forefront of technology and innovation, and are empowered to continually grow and develop.  

 

We live our core values:

  • Reliability: words result in actions that build trust;
  • Achievement: do the work to hit the target;
  • Continuous development: always learning; always adapting; always growing;
  • Creativity: discover new possibilities;
  • Courage: do the things that matter, especially when itâ€™s hard; and
  • Inclusiveness: enabling belonging to draw strength from our differences.

About Dillon

Dillon is a proudly Canadian, employee-owned, professional consulting firm specializing in planning, engineering, environmental science and management. We partner with clients to provide committed, collaborative, and inventive solutions to complex, multi-faceted projects. With over 20 offices and more than 900 employees across Canada, Dillon offers a wide range of services related to building and improving facilities and infrastructure, protecting the environment, and developing communities.

 

Now operating for over 75 years, we continue to strive for excellence in everything we do. Dillon has been listed as one of Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies for the past 15 years and has the distinction of having achieved Platinum Club member status in this program.

 

Employment Equity, Diversity & Inclusion at Dillon:

Dillon is committed to the principles of employment equity, inclusiveness, and diversity within our organization. We strive to achieve a workplace where opportunities are based on skills and abilities and that respects and values differences.  

Inclusion is more than a word to us, it is the way we choose to run our business.  

 

We encourage you to connect with us at

accommodation@dillon.ca

if you require  accommodation in the interview process.  

We would love to hear from you!

title: CAD/IC Integration Engineer
description:
CAD/IC Integration Engineer

  • Front Street West, Toronto
  • Competitive Salary
  • Full-time Permanent

Toronto is known to be the new leader in software development and Engineering. We are working with a public company that is a global leader in 60 GHz and 5G technologies and we are looking to hire CAD/IC Integration Engineer to maintain the analog/RF CAD environment used in the design of mm-wave integrated transceivers.

As a CAD/IC Integration Engineer, you must have experience in the evaluation, customization, and deployment of EDA tools for Full Custom Analog Mixed Signal IC design.

What you will be doing:

  • Be the lead engineer for the integration of analog and digital blocks into an IC
  • Interface with the foundries on DRC/LVS waivers and GDS delivery.
  • Maintain and modify foundry design kits to include user-defined devices, custom device models, and parameterized layout cells.
  • Deployment of new design flows and methodologies that will be used throughout the IC design organization.

Why this is the right job for you:

  • B.Sc. in Electrical Engineering or related field. M.Sc. highly desired.
  • At least 5 years of relevant industry experience.
  • Knowledge of scripting and programming languages (shell scripting, python etc.,) would be an asset.
  • Deep knowledge of analog design methodologies using Cadence, Mentor or Synopsys tools.
  • Knowledge of 2D/3D EM simulator tools (Sonnet, HFSS, ADS) a plus.
  • Ability to take on tasks outside area of expertise

Looking for Meaningful Work? We can help.

If you're a professional, you know that it can be difficult to find fulfilling work that advances your career. At the Ian Martin Workforce, we exist to connect people like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at sarah.fell@ianmartin.com

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Technology Management | Level 2 (CAD)
description:
Technology Analyst Program (TAP) Co-od, Technology & Firm Resilience Montreal

POSITION SUMMARY

The primary focus of the TAP Team is to provide training & development to the incoming campus graduates joining our technology staff globally. We are looking for an individual who will coordinate the Montreal program. The 15 week Technology Analyst Program (TAP) runs throughout the globe for all campus hires into the Technology department. The program is well-regarded internally and on Wall Street. We are responsible for providing technical, professional skills training and access to senior management. The program also provides a network for all trainees as they continue on their career. We partner with the campus recruiting teams to establish pipeline initiatives with local universities. We hire application developers with skills in C++, Java, C#, etc. and platform facing engineers with a focus on operating systems, databases, production plants and more. Though the trainees are hired for all locations in which we have technology staff, the major training locations are New York, London, Mumbai, Bangalore and Shanghai.The Montreal TAP Coordinator will be responsible for facilitating all Montreal TAP operations from Pre-TAP through TAP day-to-day execution and support, in addition to supporting the implementation of Post TAP strategy. The candidate will work closely with the Americas TAP Co-ordinator and other TAP counterparts who will guide and coach the individual in learning and understanding training program management front-to-back. This includes, but is not limited to:

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
-Assisting with the design, development, and execution of the full time Technology Analyst Programs across various Technology silos
-Managing all logistics of training programs, including:
-Facilitating all pre-Program communications and in collaboration with HR Campus Recruitment
-Coordinating all aspects of analyst onboarding and orientation experienceo Fostering and maintaining relationships with conference center staff, multi-media, food/catering and facilities (onsite)
-Overseeing internal/external venue logistics (onsite)
-Overseeing site operations and analyst transitions session-to-session, week-to-week
-Scheduling course dates/times with internal/external vendors
-Tracking candidate travel and housing detailsoMaintaining Program calendars
-Maintaining Jive and Sharepoint sites
-Preparing materials for distribution
-Creating class rosters and tracking classroom attendance
-Addressing trainees ; daily questions and escalating as appropriate
-Generating feedback evaluation criteria, assessing and measuring the effectiveness of the training currently in place and refining existing training programs in conjunction with the Program Manager in order to manage experience, manage cost and improve efficiencies
-Collaborating with regional TAP counterparts on various global program aspects such as analyzing and maintaining centralized feedback collection with the tooling team, engagement events virtual or onsite, internals training with the proprietary tech teams and other SMEs, final project solicitation, TAP Project Fair, and more

EXPERIENCE/SKILLS DESIRED/REQUIRED
-Undergraduate degree (at least)
-2-3 Years experience with a junior talent population in training/HR/related program management-type job
-Personable, good listening skills, able to speak in front of groups
-Excellent attention to detail during busy times whilst processing a high volume of requests?
-Strong communication skills and an ability to liaise with people on all levels
-Highly organised and capable of multi-tasking to meet deadlines
-Strong leadership skills
-Solid proficiency in Microsoft office, especially Excel/PowerPoint & Word
-Understanding of data, metrics, analytics, a plus
-Certain amount of flexibility e.g. a willingness to work overtime when required
-Interested in working with a global team
-Desire to build a career in program management
-Interest in talent development, management and retention
-Interest in technology; knowledge will grow as the candidate becomes increasingly more involved in program management and in demonstrating understanding of the curriculum

*//
EEO Employer
Minorities/ Females/ Disabled/ Veterans/ Gender Identity/ Sexual Orientation
//*

title: CAD Detailer
description:
Come be a part of a fast paced, exciting environment in the plastics welding and automation industry. SPM has assembled a young, talented team of mechanical and electrical designers, project managers, machine builders, millwrights and electricians to work in a collaborative manner. As we lead the way in new technology development, prototyping, plastics joining, finishing and assembly applications we look to expand our team with like minded, driven individuals looking for a challenge. SPM provides a clean, safe environment to work within. Health benefits are provided upon completion of successful probation period.

Join us as we expand our horizons and continue to maintain the highest of standards. All applications will be reviewed and considered. Ask us about our current job incentive program!

 

General Description:

The purpose of this role is to develop detailed drawings that are sent out for production.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Use computer-aided programs to develop drawings and plans for automotive tools and fixtures
  • Draw mechanical devices, equipment, and controls, provide dimensions, calculate specifications for components, and resolve design problems
  • Create machinery diagrams and design parts of machines
  • Create and manage Bills of Materials
  • Create technical handbooks / machine manuals
  • Translate customer CAD data

 

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Bachelors/Diploma in engineering from accredited university/college required
  • Strong computer and math skills
  • Good background in SolidWorks
  • Strong technical writing ability
  • Good working knowledge of industry and engineering standards
  • Must be able to work in fast-paced environment
  • Must have good communication and organizational skills

 

Reporting Subordinates:

  • N/A

Reporting To:

  • Engineering Manager

title: Drafter
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Would you like to work for an industry-leading structural steel provider?We are looking to augment our team with highly motivated individuals strivingfor a career development opportunity, one where they can make an impact andcontribute to the growth and success of the company.Steelcon Fabrication Inc. has an opening for a Drafter, based in BramptonOntario. As a Structural Drafter you will assist with providing drafting designinput and technical support in the production of engineering drawings anddocumentation for small to large scale projects.As a drafter, you will contribute to our team by: * Participate in coordination meetings with other designers and engineers to ensure overall layout and fit up of designed components. * Works with the team to develop drawings and to promote a high-quality high value product. Ensures that all drawings and plans are finalized and coordinated on a timely basis and conform to specifications and scope. * Keep up to date on project specifications, details, and standards to ensure accurate drawings are being produced * Troubleshoot any potential problems with client’s drawings * Work with the field leadership and quality control to ensure drawings produced are easily understood by workers, and work to continually improve error ratio * Collaborate with cross-functional teams to produce "Best for Project" designs that are safe, reflect the client's operability requirements and are constructible. * Produce drawings that effectively and simply communicate the design and that comply with Structural Engineering Standards and conform to job specifications with respect to clearances, tolerances, and applicable codes. * Collaborate with the team lead, project manager and project engineer to develop design criteria and drawing layouts. * Identify risk and opportunities to optimize the scope, schedule, and cost of the project. * Investigate, troubleshoot, and recommend solutions for site and client concerns and suggestions. * Other duties as assigned.What you will bring to this role: * 3+ years of industry experience in drafting * Diploma in Surveying, Geomatics, Civil/Structural drafting, technician/technology, or from accredited Technical College * Technical background in AutoCAD Civil 3D, * Working experience or education background with REVIT * Experience in construction and/or structural consulting services an asset * Strong understanding of structural terminology * Able to read and interpret structural and architectural drawings * Motivated, self-starter who can work well independently or within a team environment * Attention to detail with the ability to recognize discrepancies * Must be able to meet all safety requirements and applicable safety policiesUpon submitting your resume, your application will be reviewed in the evaluationprocess. title: Summer Student - Civil Engineering
description:
Summer Student - Civil Engineering

Join a global professional services leader! We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy, and urbanization.

We are looking for an enthusiastic and eager Civil Engineering Student for the coming summer months.

Job Responsibilities:

In this role you will be involved in the following activities within the Water – Linear Infrastructure team:

  • Working collaboratively with a group of professionals that are active on projects throughout North American, but mainly in your local region 
  • Undertake tasks in a number of different areas of civil engineering and for different managers and teams, driving experiential learning through exposure to various work types and approaches, and working in an inter-disciplinary role. 
  • Field activities will be a component to this position as permitted by health and safety training, that may include supporting inspection of active construction sites.
  • Documentation of field activities, preparing construction observation reports, taking field measurements.
  • Data Management and analysis of analytical results, including reporting duties to senior staff to support desktop and field based project tasks.
  • Assisting with the preparation of various calculations, figures, quotations, and specifications.

Required Skills:

  • Pursuing a related Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering.
  • Previous pertinent experience is an asset.
  • Intermediate level MS Office skills are required.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong organizational, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Valid driver's license.
  • Travel within the Province.

title: Survey Technician
description:
Position:  Survey Technician

Location:  Calgary Branch Office

Organizational Information

TULLOCH Engineering is a progressive consulting firm that provides engineering, land surveying, environmental and mapping services.  We employ over 350 professionals working from fifteen offices throughout Canada.  The TULLOCH team is made up of individuals who love a challenge and are willing to go to remote work environments to get the job done.  If you are looking to try something new, consider joining our great team!

The geomatics team at TULLOCH offers services to private and government sector clients throughout Ontario and across Canada.  We provide a full range of traditional surveying services as well as construction monitoring, precision layout, and high-definition 3D laser scanning.   We are innovative in our approach and whenever possible utilize emerging technologies to improve both the efficiency and quality of deliverables to our clients.

We are currently looking for a full time Survey Technician to join our Calgary team. This is a permanent, full-time position to begin as soon as a successful candidate is found.  We view this position as one with potential for growth.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Organize equipment and supplies
  • Ensure all equipment is accounted for and maintained in good working order
  • Demonstrate the essential skills related to the use of all equipment used to perform job responsibilities
  • Assist in the collection of field data using various survey instruments, calculators, levels and GPS field equipment

Qualifications:

  • A college diploma from a Civil Engineering Technician or Technology program or equivalent experience considered an asset;
  • Minimum of 2 years experience in the survey field considered an asset;
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Excellent problem solving skills;
  • Proficient in the use of various survey instruments, calculators, levels and GPS field equipment or an aptitude to learn;
  • Ability to work in a team environment;
  • Ability to prioritize multiple projects and tasks in a fast paced environment;
  • Valid Alberta Driverâ€™s License; and,
  • Willing to travel for site inspections and field work.

 

Resumes should be sent to the Human Resources Department; submit online at www.tulloch.ca.  Thank you to all applicants for their interest. Only those candidates shortlisted for the position will be contacted. 

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process, or those needing job postings in an alternate format, may email a request to

title: Software Engineer (Canada) - up to CAD $170K
description:
About US Mobile:

US Mobile is on a mission to revolutionize connectivity. Imagine a world where you can go into a single app and buy terabytes of data for your phone, smart devices, car, home broadband, and more. That’s the future that US Mobile is building: a software platform built for the 21st century and the age of 5G and IoT, with world-class engineering, best-in-class user experience, and features that will define the next generation of connectivity. We are one of Forbes’ top 500 best startup employers in the US for 2021.

We’re able to offer superior service because of our people. The team spans diverse backgrounds, cultures, and stories, with employees coming from 20+ countries. We were recently ranked 94th on Inc 5000's fastest-growing private companies in America. We are excited to find more exceptional talent to join our journey.

Job Description:

We're looking for an exceptional backend engineer to help us scale and connect millions of devices to wireless networks.

The projects and potential impact are incredible. We're looking for talented, ambitious, and entrepreneurial team members who are excited to tackle these challenges.

As a backend engineer, you will:

  • Design, implement, and deploy exciting new features
  • Help us scale to 10’s of millions of customers & connected devices
  • Build quality tools and frameworks to ensure a high-quality product
  • Build monitoring and alert systems to support continuous uptime

Remote role based out of our Toronto Office available for Canadians in the eastern time zones, for example: Toronto, Montréal, or Québec city. Candidates who can join without sponsorship requirements are welcome to apply.


Requirements:

    • Strong knowledge of Java and Spring Boot. Other programming languages are acceptable but you will need to learn Java. Experience with Kotlin, JavaScript, Node.js or Python is a bonus.
    • Strong knowledge of RDBMS and NoSQL concepts
    • Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Kubernetes, and Docker
    • Hands-on API design experience
    • Experience with API Gateway like ApiGee, Spring Cloud Gateway, or Express Gateway
    • Have built integration with payment, email, notification etc. service providers like Twilio, Adyen, Stripe, and SendGrid
    • Have knowledge of networking and operating systems. Bash programming for example.
    • Have built tools for application templates, CI/CD, deployment, and Jenkins
    • Have been part of teams building complex distributed cloud systems
    • Self-starter and strong, quick problem-solving skills
    • Experience with scale and high-traffic applications
    • Experience with different nonfunctional conformance aspects like security, reliability, and high availability


    Bonus Points:

    • Experience in Domain-Driven Design, Event Storming techniques to flush out high-level architectural patterns
    • Modern clean code coding practices supported by automated testing
    • Prior fast growth organizational experience

    Benefits:

    • Flexible fully remote role with occasional team meetings
    • Hybrid work possible in Toronto

    Think you’d be a great fit? Apply to learn more!

title: BIM/CAD Technician (Custom Home Design) (FT)
description:
Our family-owned and operated design firm has been a cornerstone in the custom home design and renovation design industry since 1959. We pride ourselves on our attention to detail and high-quality designs to help our clients visualize unique residential and commercial building projects.

We’re looking for a full-time BIM/CAD Technician to join our diverse and growing team. We offer a competitive wage and benefit package, as well as a fun and challenging work environment. We treat each other like family and we value integrity, creativity, accuracy, and quality workmanship.

Requirements:
  • Minimum of a one-year Architectural Drafting Certificate (two-year Diploma or Degree preferred).
  • Minimum of 2-4 years experience as a Drafting or BIM Technician/Technologist in building or engineering.
  • Proficient in Revit, AutoCAD, Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.
  • Full understanding of 2018 BC Building Code including 9.32 and 9.36
  • Ability to visualize 3D objects.

Responsibilities:
  • Creating full working drawings for custom houses, renovations, barns, and shops.
  • Drawing and modeling floor plans, elevations, cross-sections, detailing, joist layouts, truss layouts, site plans, and 3D models using AutoCAD and Revit.
  • Researching, interpreting, analyzing, and fully understanding local and provincial zoning bylaws and building codes.
  • Working independently and together with a team of other Designers and Drafting Technicians to solve complex problems and find creative solutions.
  • Communicating with clients, engineers, project consultants, and building officials with email, phone, and in-person meetings (limited during COVID-19 with safety precautions).
  • Measuring existing residential and commercial buildings and producing as-built drawings based on-site visit.

Why This Job is for You:
Regardless of your experience, we want to meet with you to see where you are at. Although some experience is required, the job description and qualifications may change depending on how muchexperience you have.

If you are already an experienced designer, you will have increased responsibility with limited oversight. If this is something that you’re still working towards, you will still work independently, just with more direction from another designer; let us help and train you to get there.

We can’t wait to meet you and find out more.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent.
Salary: $20.00-$28.00 per hour.
Work Remotely: No.

COVID-19 considerations:
In-person meetings with clients are limited to 2 customers at a time in the office. Every guest is required to sanitize before entering the office. A large clear plexiglass shield is used in the board room for in-person meetings with clients.

title: Technicien / Technicienne en arpentage
description:
Your Employer

Osez Englobe

 

Englobe, c’est plus de 2 600 personnes qui, au quotidien, se préoccupent de l’environnement, contribuent à des projets d’ingénierie durable, traitent les sols et la biomasse, et gèrent la qualité et l’intégrité des actifs.

 

Chez Englobe, nous adoptons une gestion novatrice centrée sur l’humain. Nous accueillons les nouvelles idées et sommes ouverts à la discussion. Nous sommes déterminés à réussir, en partenariat avec nos équipes.

 

Nous offrons

  • une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux (assurances collectives avec coûts partagés dès l’embauche, REER collectif);
  • un service de soins santé virtuels télémédecine;
  • un remboursement annuel des frais d’activités sportives;
  • des occasions de développement des compétences;
  • un horaire flexible et possibilité de comprimer les heures de travail;
  • une politique interne pour encourager le télétravail.

Osez Englobe et menez une carrière marquée par la croissance et les réalisations.


Your Contribution

Englobe recherche un technicien en arpentage pour son bureau de Québec afin de se joindre à l’équipe d’Ingénierie en infrastructure. Englobe offre des services de consultation en génie civil dans le cadre de la conception et la réalisation de projets routiers, de chaussées et d’infrastructure municipales depuis plus de 10 ans. À ce titre, vous serez appelé à participer à la conception et la réalisation de projets routiers, de chaussées et d’infrastructures municipales.

 

En tant que Technicien / Technicienne en arpentage, vous travaillerez en collaboration avec l'équipe de Génie municipal et urbain et vos principales responsabilités seront:

  • Effectuer les levés terrain à l'aide des équipements d'arpentage;
  • Effectuer des calculs de volumétrie;
  • Effectuer des opérations d’implantation sur des chantiers de construction;
  • Effectuer des relevés topographiques;
  • Déterminer des coordonnées géographiques précises au moyen de système de positionnement global (GPS) ;
  • Préparer les notes sur le terrain et les résultats attendus;
  • Vérifier si les différents travaux correspondent à l’implantation et aux plans et devis ;
  • Toutes autres tâches afférentes aux levé terrain et calculs en arpentage.

Your Profile

  • DEP/ AEC ou DEC en arpentage / géomatique ou connexe;
  • Capacité d’analyse de données;
  • Carte ASP Construction;
  • Posséder son permis de conduire et une voiture;
  • Capacité à travailler à l’extérieur en toute saison;
  • Avoir de l’expérience est un atout;
  • Capacité à travailler seul et en équipe;
  • Être méthodique et minutieux.
  • Démontrer un intérêt et une sensibilité envers la santé et la sécurité au travail.

Nous accueillons les nouvelles idées et sommes ouverts à la discussion. Nous sommes déterminés à réussir, en partenariat avec nos équipes.', 'Osez Englobe']

title: CAD Designer
description:
About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts.Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

The Job

The CAD Designer supports development of mechanical and electrical concepts, packaging design or redesign of OSI consoles, racks and IBS systems. The CAD Designer is expected to deliver accurate 3D models and 2D drawings.

Responsibilities:
  • Develop 3D models and 2D drawings suitable for manufacturing
  • Interface with Electrical, Mechanical, Manufacturing and Systems Engineers for design development
  • Level 1 Check of drawings for accuracy and compliance with OSI practices
  • Support preparation of procedures and work instructions for product fabrication
  • Create conceptual drawings and renderings for Sales Proposals
  • Follows workplace operating and environmental, health and safety procedures and guidelines
  • Support preparation, development and sustainment of CAD Operation Team standards, work instruction and operational procedures
You Bring:
Education: 2 or 3 year college diploma with technical training in 3D modeling drafting
Experience: 4 to 7 years of experience
Experience with the following is desirable:
  • Competent with application of Solidworks modeling tools and AutoCAD
  • Familiarity with electrical drawings
  • Working knowledge of ASME Y14 Engineering drawing practices
  • Design for assembly and manufacturing.
  • Manufacturing processes for sheet metal, machined and welded parts.
  • Familiarity with naval platform environment is an asset

Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits:
  • Extended healthcare
  • Dental care
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program

title: Geomatics/CAD Technician - Cadastral
description:
Location: Huntsville, or Toronto Offices

TULLOCH Engineering is a progressive consulting firm that provides engineering, land surveying, environmental and mapping services. We employ over 350 professionals working from fifteen offices throughout Canada. We are innovative in our approach and whenever possible utilize emerging technologies to improve both the efficiency and quality of our work. This approach, along with our extreme work ethic, makes us a service provider of choice for many clients. If you are looking for a challenging role in a supportive environment, made up of dedicated professionals, you may want to consider joining our great team!

The Geomatics team at TULLOCH offers services to private and government sector clients throughout Ontario and across Canada. We provide a full range of traditional surveying services as well as construction monitoring, precision layout, and high-definition 3D laser scanning. We are innovative in our approach and whenever possible utilize emerging technologies to improve both the efficiency and quality of deliverables to our clients.

We are currently looking for a full time CadastralGeomatics Technician/ CAD Operator to join our team. This is a permanent, full-time position to begin as soon as a successful candidate is found.

title: CAD Engineer
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a CAD Engineer for our Saskatoon location.

CAD Engineers are competent technical people who have demonstrated a knowledge of manufacturing concepts and have skills with 2D and 3D CAD. CAD Engineers are responsible for detailing and simple design tasks. This is both a great learning opportunity for young engineers and technologists as well as a place for senior CAD people to deliver value to the customers by creating and maintaining CAD files and CAD Standards.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Use 3D CAD to detail products and make simple design changes.
  • Use a combination of 2D CAD and other tools to document overall system designs.
  • Focus on DFx, i.e. Design For Manufacturability, Serviceability, Reliability, Affordability, etc.
  • Produce engineering deliverables that meet Quality, Cost and Schedule requirements.
  • Seek continuous improvement in engineering activities, and communicate these to your supervisor.
  • Learn and be mentored by some of the best design engineers and technologists in the province.
  • Professional Engineer or Technologist
  • Experience in machine design and 3D CAD
  • Good communication skills — written and verbal
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Excellent work ethic
