title: Drafting Technician
description:
Overview:

Term: 12 Months

 

Reporting to the Manager, Electrical Engineering, the Drafting Technician is responsible for managing CADDDD related archive documentation within Plant Ops. This work includes integration of information for new buildings, changes created by recent renovations, in-house produced/available drawings, and drawings produced by various consultants for this purpose. The incumbent is also responsible for the retrieval of electronic files and print production in timely fashion in support of University activities. The materials stored include all drawings, manuals, agreements, and contracts required either by law or for operational supporting the entirUWUW campus with over eight million square feet of space supporting state of the art teaching and ground breaking research.


Responsibilities will align with the Plant Operations goal of contributing towards providing a safe and accessible, invitingly clean and comfortable, functionally-enriched and well-maintained campus environment through service excellence.

Responsibilities:

Management of As-built CADD infrastructure drawings

  • Proposes, implements, and maintains structure of as-built CADD documentation in support of Design & Construction Services and other organizational units within the Plant Operations
  • Surveys existing site conditions, takes measurements and/or records information related to structures & base building equipment and sets up new drawing sets if no existing drawings exist
  • Evaluates the accuracy of existing information (conflicting historical sets might exist) and integrates information into existing documents
  • Reviews old materials and decides which are obsolete and safely discards old documentation (printed and electronic format). Coordinates directly with engineers and technologists as part of an integrated multidisciplinary project team at all stages, from concept design to final commissioning
  • Supports all divisions within Plant Operations in retrieving CADD documents in support of procurement documents for various projects (consultants/contractors/etc.)
  • Supports all operating team in managing access or retrieving CADD drawings required for projects, maintenance initiative and strategic analysis
  • Maintains proficiency in the use of current versions of Computer Aided Design and Drafting (CADD) software used in the department
  • Serves as the subject area expert and provides CADD support to the Design & Construction team
  • Provides prints of various CADD documents as requested by Senior Administration and various divisions within Plant Operations

CADD & BIM

  • Prepares drawing sets for special projects as directed by the supervising manager
  • Represents Plant Operations as the Building Information Model (BIM) specialist, converts BIM files into CADD drawings as required, and guides the project team in development of BIM LODs as required for contract documentation

Mechanical & Electrical systems

  • Surveys existing site conditions, takes measurements and/or records site information on existing drawings
  • Consolidates site information and old drawings to ensure that record drawings are accurate and available for Plant Ops staff on request
  • Evaluates accuracy of information on existing drawings and ensures that all as-build documentation is accurate
  • Receives, reviews, and integrates drawings prepared by various consultants and integrates materials into record drawings

Other

  • Performs other related duties and responsibilities as assigned and supports departmental initiatives
Qualifications:
  • Post-secondary education, preferably within engineering or architectural technology or equivalent
  • Minimum 3 yearsâ€™ experience working in the building construction industry preparing drawings and managing documentation
  • Experience in institutional projects is preferred
  • Excellent proficiency utilizing AutoCAD
  • Sound understanding of BIM and REVIT
  • Excellent understanding of drawing conventions and industry standards
  • Understanding of the building code, fire code, and ASHRAE is an asset
  • Training in the maintenance of fire extinguishers, fire suppression systems, and fire alarm systems is an asset
  • Experience with various Geographical Information Systems (GIS) is an asset
  • Intermediate proficiency with various MS office applications
  • Exemplary organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Proven ability to effectively manage multiple priorities
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a deep commitment to customer service
  • Ability to exercise prudent judgement and high level of confidentiality
  • Regular working hours, with some evening/weekend work required
  • May be required to travel to satellite campuses
Vaccination Requirement Statement:

Effective May 1, 2022, the University suspended its Vaccination Requirement. Prior to May 1, pursuant to this Requirement, all University employees were required to submit proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 (subject to the Universityâ€™s obligations under the Human Rights Code to accommodate employees who were unable to receive a vaccination). The Universityâ€™s Vaccination Requirement website can be found here: https://uwaterloo.ca/coronavirus/return/vaccination-requirement.    

 

The pandemic is ongoing and public health advice continues to evolve. Accordingly, the University reserves the absolute right to reinstate the Vaccination Requirement on short notice, and upon such reinstatement you will be required to comply. You shall also be required to comply with any new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University from time to time, including new policies/requirements related to mandatory employee vaccination. As the University may need to reinstate the Requirement on short notice, it will continue to collect and maintain up-to-date information on employee vaccination status. Please submit your Covid-19 vaccine status (QR code) to: https://checkin.uwaterloo.ca/    

 

Failure to comply with the Vaccination Requirement if it is reinstated, including failure to comply with any future amendments to the Vaccination Requirement, or failure to comply with new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University, including those related to new mandatory employee vaccination, shall result in discipline up to and including termination of employment.

 

The requirement to be vaccinated, if reinstated, will be subject to the duty to accommodate pursuant to the Human Rights Code. If you are unable to be vaccinated for reasons related to a ground protected under the Human Rights Code, you may submit a written request for accommodation with an explanation of the reasons and/or any supporting documentation. If you request accommodation, the University may follow up with you for further information if necessary.

Equity Statement:

The University of Waterloo is committed to implementing the Calls to Action framed by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. We acknowledge that we live and work on the traditional territory of the Neutral, Anishinaabeg and Haudenosaunee peoples. The University of Waterloo is situated on the Haldimand Tract, the land granted to the Six Nations that includes six miles on each side of the Grand River.

 

The University values the diverse and intersectional identities of its students, faculty, and staff. The University regards equity and diversity as an integral part of academic excellence and is committed to accessibility for all employees. The University of Waterloo seeks applicants who embrace our values of equity, anti-racism and inclusion.   As such, we encourage applications from candidates who have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including applicants who identify as First Nations, MÃ©tis and/or Inuit/Inuk, Black, racialized, a person with a disability, women and/or 2SLGBTQ+.

 

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

 

The University of Waterloo is committed to accessibility for persons with disabilities. If you have any application, interview, or workplace accommodation requests, please contact Human Resources atâ€¯

hrhelp@uwaterloo.ca

â€¯â€¯or 519-888-4567, ext. 45935.

title: Junior Illustrator / AutoCAD Technician
description:
We're seeking a hardworking, eager team member with strong computer, problem solving and multi-tasking skills to join our team as our new Junior Illustrator / AutoCAD Technician. This is an entry-level position for someone who is ready to join an industry leader in photo, video, UAV and laser scanned documentation in the construction industry.

While the role we are looking to fill will start off entirely as a production position, as the successful candidate's knowledge of our products and systems continues to grow, the position will transition into a hybrid production / support role, as you will assist with supporting our franchisees through a support desk ticketing system.

Training will be in-person at our downtown Victoria office. Due to the current situation regarding the potential risks of covid 19, there may be a requirement to work from home, depending on provincial and company mandates. The company appreciates this flexibility, and we will provide all equipment necessary for the role for your home office.

What You Can Do:
•Work in cooperation with a small team.
•You possess the ability to read architectural drawings.
•You possess working knowledge in one or more of the following:

AutoCAD
Adobe Photoshop
Adobe Illustrator

title: Junior CAD Technician
description:
At Fluor, we are proud to design and build projects and careers. This requires teams that are as unique as the projects we execute. We are committed to fostering a work environment that embraces Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DE&I) for all so our employees and stakeholders benefit from the creative solutions derived as a result of embracing differences.



Job Description:

Fluor is one of Canada's top employers and recognized globally as a leader in the Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Fabrication, and Maintenance industry. Our focus on innovation and providing cost effective technology based solutions to address our client's needs is second to none. As we look to the future, we need creative, ambitious, and innovative professionals who can help us achieve our goals.


Fluor team members are at the core of Fluor’s successes and instrumental in executing projects safely, smartly and with the highest quality. If you value teamwork, empowerment in your career and are eager to champion Fluor’s project execution, this opportunity just may be for you!


Position Responsibilities:

• Working closely with the Bridge engineering and construction groups to fill the needs of our internal and external clients in providing engineering design and drafting services

• Preparing key plans, site plans, and structural design drawings including cross-sections, profiles, construction drawings, as-built drawings,

• Performing calculations (such as volume and area estimates using CAD tools) and provide technical assistance to the project design teams

• Preparing civil engineering design drawings

• Being responsible for product quality control with adherence to company standards and procedures

Job ID: 131333BR

City: Windsor

State: Ontario

Country: Canada


We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of a diverse workforce. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by governing law.

title: CAD Technologist
description:
Our client is an seekingtalented and enthusiastic Electrical Engineering Technologist to provide project administration/drafting support to their Engineering team. This is an excellent opportunity to expand your knowledge of electrical utility systems, while working in a great team environment at a reputable company.


RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Supports Junior and Senior Electrical Engineers in a team environment
  • Primarily performs contract administration functions including tender preparation, award, quantity review, completion and assumption work, including “as constructed” documentation
  • Performs subdivision inspections during construction, and for maintenance assumption reviews
  • Attends design and project coordination meetings as required
  • Summarizes parts and materials from available literature and database
  • Reads and interprets engineering drawings and specifications
  • Understands and follows utility and municipal standards
  • Maintains project information, drawings, files, spreadsheets, and records
  • Prepares simple to moderately complex engineering drawings using 2D computer-aided design software and supporting calculations and documentation.
  • Generates drawings in various formats for approval and/or use by project stakeholders
  • Understands electrical distribution systems in order to design and modify drawings
  • Performs project, administration functions including but not limited to drawing distribution and management, coordination and communication with project stakeholders
  • Works occasional evenings or weekends to meet deadlines
  • Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Graduate of college program in Electrical Engineering Technical c/w drafting/CAD training
  • Understanding of electrical distribution systems preferred
  • Familiarity with utility industry construction practices and OHSA regulations preferred
  • Computer literate, with working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite of programs
  • Detailed working knowledge of AutoCAD and MicroStation drafting software
  • Able to read and interpret engineering drawings and specifications
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills – good command of the English language, written and oral
  • Able to work well in a team environment, with minimal supervision
  • Creative and detail oriented independent thinker
  • Must have a valid Ontario driver’s license and own car
  • Experience in the Utility industry preferred.

Demand For HR is an equal opportunity Recruiting Firm. We do not discriminate against gender, race, persons with disabilities or ethnical background. We thank all applicants for your interest in the roles Demand For HR is recruiting for.

title: Engineering CAD Technician
description:
This is a contract position with Honda R&D in the United States.

We are looking for an Engineering CAD Technician to be part of an exciting team.

Job Duties:

- Sectioning and transfer of vehicle data to suppliers

- Collection, validation and cataloging of Cad data and 2D drawing from suppliers

- Coordinate DPM layout checks between supplier models and vehicle layouts

- Track/communicate vehicle change point effecting supplier part designs

- Ability to check part clearances in 3D, and create/edit 2D drawings

- Coordinate installation instructions creation with supplier, graphic illustrator and publications

- Establish and maintain 2D drawing standards and communicate to suppliers

- Ensure 3D data accuracy and support of digital marketing assets

- Support service part BOM/illustration creation


Requirements

- Degree/Certification in Design or Engineering Technology or related field

- CATIA V5 (8+ years experience or 16,000 hours of CATIA)

- Workbenches: GSD, FTA, part design

- Drafting exposure to various technologies as required by the department specialty area (stamping, injection molding, forging, casting, low volume manufacturing) which shall include: forming requirements, tooling requirements, cost drivers

- Ability to communicate daily with suppliers, graphic illustrator and working team verbally and by e-mail

- Organizational skills to manage 50+ parts simultaneously

- Proficient in MS Excel and Powerpoint for project tracking and communication

- Must be able to drive activity forward when step-by-step instructions are not available by considering the overall goal and using logic

Benefits

- Overtime pay (1x base rate)

- Paid Time Off

- Paid Holidays

- Health, Dental, Vision Insurance

- Life and Disability Insurance


- Degree/Certification in Design or Engineering Technology or related field - CATIA V5 (8+ years experience or 16,000 hours of CATIA) - Workbenches: GSD, FTA, part design - Drafting exposure to various technologies as required by the department specialty area (stamping, injection molding, forging, casting, low volume manufacturing) which shall include: forming requirements, tooling requirements, cost drivers - Ability to communicate daily with suppliers, graphic illustrator and working team verbally and by e-mail - Organizational skills to manage 50+ parts simultaneously - Proficient in MS Excel and Powerpoint for project tracking and communication - Must be able to drive activity forward when step-by-step instructions are not available by considering the overall goal and using logic

title: Junior Radiation Surveyor (Vancouver, BC, CA)
description:
BWXT Medical Ltd. provides its customers, who conduct life-saving medical procedures for patients around the world, the benefit of decades of experience in the development, manufacturing, packaging and delivery of medical isotopes and radiopharmaceuticals. Headquartered in Kanata, Ontario, BWXT Medical Ltd. employs over 300 highly-skilled people in Kanata and Vancouver, British Columbia. BWXT Medical Ltd. is part of the BWXT nuclear power segment (NPG) of BWX Technologies, Inc.

 

We are recruiting for a Junior Radiation Surveyorfor our facility in Vancouver, BC.

 

JOB SUMMARY:

 

Under general supervision of the Director, Quality, Safety & Regulatory Affairs, performs the following functions:

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

  • Carry out or monitor occupational health and safety and radiation safety procedures to provide a safe working environment within Vancouver operations and to provide a safe surrounding environment.
  • Perform radiation safety duties that satisfies the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission (CNSC) regulations and associated site license.
  • Provide technical radiation safety advice to staff.
     

QUALIFICATIONS:

 

  • Secondary school graduation with credits in physics and mathematics. 
  • Preference given to community college graduate in a science discipline plus 3 to 5 years experience in an appropriate technical environment plus 1 year in radiation safety. 
  • Must have reasonable knowledge of CNSC and Transportation of Dangerous Goods Regulations. Must be aware of hazards of radionuclides and safety procedure for hot laboratories.
  • Must be able to inspire confidence, communicate clearly, deal harmoniously with others and remain calm and objective in emergency situations.
  • Must be able to select appropriate detection equipment, operate electronic instrumentation and assemble basic monitoring systems.
  • Environmental health and safety education and experience would be considered an asset.

 

We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.

 

BWXT Medical Ltd. embraces diversity of thought, values individuality, encourages new perspectives and provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, a conviction for which a pardon has been granted or a record suspended or any other category protected by federal law.

Headquartered in Kanata, Ontario, BWXT Medical Ltd. employs over 300\xa0highly-skilled people in Kanata and Vancouver, British Columbia. title: Survey Technician
description:
Survey Technician

Who we are

Englobe is distinguished by its wide range of services, its presence across Canada, its client satisfaction, and its customized approach with a wide range of services from consulting, turnkey project implementation and soil treatment facilities. Over the years, Englobe has acquired credibility and a reputation for people-centred values. DST Consulting Engineers Inc., a Division of Englobe, provides expert, innovative environmental and engineering consulting services - without surprises.

We offer
  • Full benefits package (group insurance with cost-sharing upon hiring, group RRSP after 3 months, the possibility of time banking)
  • Annual reimbursement of physical activity costs
  • Skills development opportunities
  • Reimbursement of travel expenses
  • Flextime and the possibility of a compressed schedule

We are currently seeking a Survey Technician to work out of our office in Waterloo, ON.

Responsibilities:
  • Perform job site surveys and instrumentation monitoring of civil engineering structures, building, utilities, roadways, railway tracks, and bridges
  • Install building, surface and in-ground survey monitoring points and other types of structural and geotechnical instrumentation at job sites.
  • Perform high-precision control surveys and baselines.
  • Complete calculations for structure and ground movement in the field and using data collector software.
  • Produce survey reports for Clients and construction project teams
  • Perform all aspects of construction and site surveying including layout, as-built, topographic, quantity, slope staking, grade staking, and various underground utility staking.
  • Work with another crewmate with a team mentality to produce a product and summary reports catered to the client's needs. Ensure crew members are working in a safe environment.
  • Manage and maintain survey equipment and instruments, survey data, and records
  • Perform pre-and post-construction condition surveys and assist with noise & vibration monitoring operations.

Qualifications:
  • Diploma of Collegial Studies or Degree in Surveying and Geomatics / Construction / Civil / Geotechnical / Engineering Geology
  • Minimum 2 years of experience dealing with road/highway construction.
  • In-depth knowledge of highway/structure surveying procedures.
  • Solid geometry/mathematical background.
  • Good knowledge of data collector software - Trimble Access & Survey Pro.
  • Competent with Trimble & Leica total stations and GPS.
  • Valid driver's licence.
  • Valid First Aid Level C-CPR & AED.
  • Ontario Land Surveyors license is considered an asset.

Englobe & DST adheres to employment equity and equal opportunity programs and encourages all women, visible minorities, Aboriginals, and disabled persons to apply.

Only selected candidates will be contacted.

How to apply
Please forward your resume and cover letter to humanresources@dstgroup.com, and please quote Job # 21-1233

title: CAD Technician (3D Modeling)
description:
APS Precast, a Division of C&S Group Operations Ltd., is a manufacturer of architectural and structural precast concrete products. The strength of APS is in the experience and qualifications of its management and employees, its high technology plant, and superior quality control. Our modern plant facility is equipped to produce a variety of shapes and finishes of architectural and structural precast elements.

APS Precast is looking for a CAD Technician with high experience in Revit and 3D Modeling Experience to join our dynamic team in Langley, BC.
As a member of our design team you will have the opportunity to:
  • Quickly develop your professional skills by working with an experienced team on a variety of large projects.
  • Work in an environment that welcomes and encourage suggestions for improvement, and routinely turns into reality.
  • See your ideas put into actions in an environment which exudes entrepreneurial spirit.
  • Further your professional development with education allowances.
  • Build your career in a position with plenty of room to grow.
Qualifications:
  • Minimum two-year drafting Certificate with proficiency in AutoCAD and Revit.
  • Experience with 3D modeling is a must.
  • Good understanding of architectural and structural drawings.
  • Able to prepare and assist engineering designs and drawings.
  • Able to create documentation packages and drawing sets.
  • Able to draw architectural, structural and shop drawings.
  • Previous related work experience always an asset.
  • Strong computer skills in Microsoft Office, especially Word and Excel.
  • Good communication skills, both verbal and written.
Competencies:
  • Has problem-solving work ethic and strong troubleshooting skills.
  • Exhibits flexibility in order to effectively manage an everchanging workflow.
  • Excels in a team environment.
  • Detail-oriented and focused.
  • Motivated by challenges and solving problems.
In addition to becoming part of an exceptional team, we also offer:
  • Competitive Wages.
  • 100% company paid Extended Health and Dental Benefits.
  • Company matching RRSP plan.
While we sincerely appreciate every application, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: CAD Drafting Technician
description:
Position: CAD Drafting Technician
Location of position Situra Inc. 91 Kelfield Street, unit 4, Etobicoke, ON
Hours 8:30am 5pm
Duration 4 to 6 weeks. May be longer should this person work out





This is thew description for the Temp. CAD Drafting Technician

JOB DESCRIPTION RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Review of plans, details and specifications for upcoming projects from plans and specifications focused on roofing and waterproofing details
  • Communicate with the design authority and end user i.e. contractor, as to specifics of the expansion joints configuration
  • Prepare expansion joint layouts on AutoCAD for quoting purposes based on reviewed expansion joints layouts by design authority or customer
  • Create custom expansion joint details for non-standard conditions, on a project-to-project basis
  • Work alongside other drafting technicians to coordinate workload and collaborate on more demanding projects as needed
  • Maintain organized and timely deliverables for sales and production departments
  • Communicate deadlines and timelines clearly and consistently with sales and quotations departments

QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Must be proficient in 2D AutoCAD
  • Knowledge of detailing of Building Envelopes components, with focus on moisture control
  • Knowledge of roofing and waterproofing product in the North American market an asset
  • CET qualification highly desirable
  • Fluency in English a must, second language either French or Spanish if possible
  • Excellent Communication skills required, be able to discuss details at a technical level with customers and design authority

title: Shop Drawing Drafter (FT)
description:
About Stilewood:
Stilewood is a build-to-order manufacturing company based out of Port Coquitlam, B.C., specializing in the manufacturing of custom-made interior and exterior pre-hung door systems for high-end custom homes. As the products produced by Stilewood are all specific to individual client designs, our team is responsible for verifying system conformity to actual job conditions – resulting in properly installed, functioning systems.

About the position:
The successful candidate will be working in the pre-production department and will report directly to the department manager. The successful candidate will be responsible for the production of shop drawings and related bills of materials and part lists.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:
  • Produce a full set of shop drawings in AutoCAD and revise as conditions change.
  • Prepare related documentation such as door schedules, bill of materials, part lists.
  • Coordinate submittal of shop drawings and samples.
  • Site measuring on your own and with sales staff.
  • Support sales staff in the office and on-site.
  • Support shop staff.

Qualifications and Skills:
  • Experience in AutoCAD with proven technical drafting skills. 3D software experience is an asset, but not required.
  • Proficient in reading architectural construction drawings.
  • Able to communicate fluently and professionally in English.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel.

Educational Background in one or more of the following areas:
  • Diploma of Technology in Architectural and Building Engineering or Construction Management.
  • Diploma in Engineering Design and Drafting Technology.
  • Joiner ticket or equivalent.
  • Degree in Architectural and Building Technology.
  • Degree in Wood Processing.
  • Other foreign engineering diplomas (Master in Wood Processing – European) relevant to window and door systems.

Work Experience which would be an asset for this position:
  • Work experience in the preparation of pre-production documentation for manufacturing.
  • Work experience in the woodworking field (joinery, millwork, cabinetmaking, doors and windows, and finish carpentry).
  • Work experience in construction.

Compensation/Benefits:
  • Pay rate is dependent on experience, pay range for this position is between $25-$32 per hour.
  • We offer a Pacific Blue Cross group benefits package to our employees. Dental, extended health, life benefits, and AD&D.




    About Stilewood International Door & Window:

    Stilewood International Door & Window is a build to order manufacturing company based out of Port Coquitlam, B.C., specializing in the manufacturing of custom made interior and exterior pre-hung door systems for high-end custom homes. As the products produced by Stilewood are all specific to individual client designs, Stilewood's team is responsible for verifying system conformity to actual job conditions - resulting in properly installed, functioning door and window systems.Stilewood has been producing custom-built interior and exterior door systems for architecturally controlled projects for over 30 years, supplying some of the finest homes in North America with imaginative designs and quality craftsmanship. Along with their in-house manufactured products, they have also partnered with leading fenestration brands from across the world including Brombal and Oikos from Italy, as well as Unilux from Germany. Stilewood also offers full product installation performed by their dedicated team of in-house installers, ensuring that even their most complex door and window systems are being installed to the highest of standards.

title: Jr Controls / CAD Technician
description:
Control System Designer / CAD Technician

RSE Controls & Automation Inc. is a progressive, innovative, and highly adaptable controls and automation solutions provider. We service many fields and industries throughout Ontario and across Canada providing custom controls systems and integration solutions. Our team provides design and engineering services, custom control panel builds and PLC programming and integration services.

RSE Controls & Automation promotes continuous training and employee development within the company. We are seeking applicants to fulfill the role of Control System Designer / CAD technician to join our growing team.

Opportunity

We are currently looking for a full time Control System Designer / CAD technician. The successful applicant must have experience with AutoCAD & AutoCAD Electrical. The successful applicant will be responsible for generating full electrical panel schematics from sketches and previously configured drawing package components, produce and update general assembly drawings, wiring diagrams, wiring lists and bills of material. The successful applicant will participate in design meetings with RSE staff as well as the customer on occasion and will liaison with the customer to gather site specific design criteria and information. The successful applicant will also assist other RSE team members to support various projects as required from time to time. The position will occasionally involve travel to site.

The ideal applicant will have a minimum 3 years experience in a similar role or will be a new grad from a college diploma program with relevant educational experience. They will have experience with AutoCAD and AutoCAD Electrical, designing and drafting electrical control systems and processes. The successful candidate must have excellent communication skills with a strong command of the English language, both written and verbal. The successful candidate will be expected to complete assigned work as directed in a timely fashion and work independently while functioning well within RSE’s team environment. Excellent organization and time management skills are beneficial. A valid Ontario Driver’s License is required. There is also potential for growth in this position through project management, business development, and leadership opportunities. We are looking for a goal-oriented self-starter that is looking for a new opportunity

Compensation

·         Compensation will be based on qualifications and experience.

·         RSE offers a competitive full benefits package after three month review period.

Experience

·         Previous experience in a similar design/engineering CAD Tech role preferred.

·         Recent College Graduates or current Co-Op students will be considered

Start Date

·         Immediate

We thank all applicants, but only those invited for an interview will be contacted.

title: Drafter I
description:
At Golder, we thrive on challenges.

Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture.

Do you have the desire to learn? The drive to excel and thrive in an engaged, collaborative environment?

Golder has a new opportunity for a Junior CAD Technician (Drafter I) to join our team on a full-time basis based in Kelowna, British Columbia.

An overview of your role will include:

  • Working closely with the various engineering and environmental groups to fill the needs of our internal and external clients in providing engineering design and drafting services
  • Producing maps from topographic data and survey field notes
  • Preparing key plans, site plans, and site design drawings including cross-sections, profiles, details, construction drawings, as-built drawings, tender documents, figures, sketches, and charts for presentation in reports and proposals
  • Performing calculations (such as volume and area estimates using CAD tools) and provide technical assistance to the project design teams
  • Preparing civil engineering design drawings
  • Input of test hole log data into specialized database software
  • Being responsible for product quality control with adherence to company standards and procedures
You will have a background in:
  • A technical diploma, CAD certificate or equivalent
  • A working knowledge of AutoCAD is required, and experience with Civil 3D is preferred
  • A commitment to CAD standards and procedures is essential to this function
  • Good problem solver with the ability to identify alternative solutions
  • Ability to perform various calculations and data manipulation in Excel
  • The ability to work with multiple people and prioritize tasks is a must
  • The ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
  • This role may require infrequent travel
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong organizational skills
  • The ability to learn and work with any of the following software would be considered an asset: AutoCAD, Civil3D, AutoCAD Map, Raster Design, Surfer, gINT

Your benefits at Golder will include:
  • Competitive benefits and remuneration packages
  • Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
  • Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
  • On the job training, mentoring, and coaching
  • Global projects and travel opportunities

Please note - As part of the hiring process, you may be requested to participate in a one-way video interview.

One of Canada's Best Managed Companies, Platinum member status 15 consecutive years

Health and Safety is a core paramount value of Golder ( member of WSP). Given the importance of keeping one another safe and the growing list of our clients including vaccination status as part of their mandated health and safety requirements to work with them, you will be required to provide proof of full COVID-19 vaccination to Golder (member of WSP) as a condition of employment. You may also be required to undergo additional immunization to maintain a fully vaccinated status against COVID-19 whenever local Public Health Authorities recommend additional immunization.

Renowned for technical excellence, Golder, now a member of WSP, is a leading, global consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices in over 30 countries, Golder's 6,500 professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.

Golder Associates Ltd. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of persons with disabilities in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), and all other applicable legislation. Golder will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities upon request.

To learn more about our company and culture click here to view The Promise of Golder video.

title: Technology Management | Level 4 (CAD)
description:
“This role is currently work-from-home and will move to the office environment after the COVID-19 restrictions are lifted.”

JOB DESCRIPTION - Cloud Kanban Delivery Manager - ISG Architecture & Governance



Position Description

The ISG Architecture & Governance team is seeking a Kanban Agile Delivery Manager who possesses a general familiarity of architecture processes. The successful candidate will lead the team?s stand up with superior Jira Kanban skills, track progress against key milestones, proactively work with team leads to ensure prioritization of stories through delivery, and independently clear blockers and close follow ups. Additional responsibilities will include Metrics Adoption, develop processes utilizing Visio or similar tools, and road mapping.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

?Strong mastery of Jira and Kanban best practices
?Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with demonstrated experience working with senior leaders
?Experience in building roadmaps and tracking progress against key milestones
?Possesses a strategic flexibility to implement project management approaches to ensure project success?Interdisciplinary background with a focus or demonstration of success in engineering, science, or finance/economics
?Practice over theory. Active utilization of core Agile framework, successfully managing scrum teams
?Proven ability to take ownership and challenge status-quo, improve process and drive results
?Strong team spirit and relationship management skills
?Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate large amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
?Highly motivated, flexible, proactive, and adaptable to change
?Experience working in a global financial services firm and/or management consulting is strongly preferred
?Experience with python and cloud technologies is a plus

Company Profile

At Brokerage, we advise, originate, trade, manage and distribute capital for governments, institutions and individuals, and always do so with a standard of excellence. We are a leading global financial services firm that conducts its business through three principal business segments. Institutional Securities, Wealth Management (WM), and Investment Management. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence, and strong team ethic. Brokerage can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture. Institutional Securities Group Architecture & Governance Institutional Securities Group (ISG) Architecture Governance is responsible for development, communication and implementation of the Technology Architecture principles, standards, design patterns and governance that inform the development and engineering of the ISG Technology platform in support of the ISG business. The newly established organization will establish the architectural priorities and initiate architectural design work as appropriate; leveraging ISG platform technical leadership / CoEs and firm resources as required.

title: Architecture CADD Technician
description:
We have an excellent opportunity with our highly esteemed client- a multi disciplinary Engineering firm - in Vancouver and Surrey,  BC,  for an Architecture CADD Technician who would be passionate about working on a wide range of challenging and diverse projects. 

Who you are 

  • Must have post-secondary education equivalent to a 2 year college diploma in Drafting Technology with additional courses in AutoCAD and preferably Revit
  • You pride yourself on your interpersonal, communication, and problem solving skills
  • Must demonstrate an understanding of quality standards relative to specification design, planning, and engineering fundamentals and principles
  • You have strong computer skills to produce effective drawings, develop concepts, and prepare reports and presentations
  • You are proficient in AutoCAD and Microsoft Office
  • Must have knowledge of engineering design principles and procedures

What you will be doing

  • Develop and prepare drawings from preliminary concepts, sketches, engineering calculations, and other data
  • Ensure that errors and/or omissions are minimized by examining drawings and making required alterations as required
  • Print drawing sets for review and approval to produce complete packages
  • Coordinate project drawings with Managers and other CAD staff
  • Maintain familiarity with current drafting techniques and developments to sustain and improve technical skills
  • Contribute to the set up and maintenance of departmental CAD standards

What's in it for you

  • Competitive Salary and Benefits and Wellness program 
  • Yearly company Bonus 
  • Personal and Professional Development support

Interviews are happening now! curious to learn more? for a confidential chat, send all inquiries to Shiva@aceit.work

Know someone who is a fit for this opportunity? Inquire about our $$attractive$$ Referral Bonus

title: Analyst, AutoCAD & Revit Design (Montreal, QC, CA, H3B 4T9)
description:
Job Type: Permanent 
Primary Location: Montreal, Quebec, Canada 
All Available Locations: Montreal 

Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality

Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office

Be part of a firm where you are valued for your unique strengths and where everyone feels a sense of belonging

 

Join our Supply Chain- Logistics & Distribution practice! Named a leader in Supply Chain and Operations Consulting by both Gartner and Kennedy Consulting Research & Advisory.

What will your typical day look like?

The Deloitte Supply Chain & Network Operations Consulting practice is the largest in the Canadian market and part of the largest consulting firm in the world and growing. We work hand-in-hand with our clients from virtually every industry to improve business performance, drive shareholder value and create competitive advantage. Our work involves developing innovative recommendations to address client issues and present the findings to senior executives. Depending on the project, we evolve this storyline into a strategic roadmap and detailed project plan for execution. Ensuring client success does not stop there. We also collaborate with clients through the implementation to see the vision become a reality.

The focus does not stop with the client. There are endless options for internal projects that individuals might be passionate about leading or joinin market research, proposals, recruiting, innovation labs, strategy development, AI joint-ventures, and career coaching/mentorship just to name a few.

About the team

Our Deloitte Supply Chain & Network Operations Consulting practice is the largest in the Canadian market and part of the largest consulting firm in the world. We have 150+ practitioners in our team and we are still growing. We have offices across Canada: Toronto, Montreal Vancouver, and Calgary to name only a few. We value diversity, which is why our team members come from diverse backgrounds and countries.

We work hand-in-hand with our clients across industries to improve business performance, drive shareholder value and create a competitive advantage. Our work involves developing innovative recommendations to address client issues and help senior executives through strategic decision-making. We leverage our ability to bring an end-to-end approach from a strategic roadmap through implementation and execution.

Enough about us, let’s talk about you

As an Intermediate REVIT and AutoCAD Designer, you will be contributing to all stages of project development and working with our internal consulting team and external clients in completing project deliverables. You will develop 2D & 3D models of material handling equipment, facility floor plans, site plans as well as developing elevations, sections, and architectural details for projects, as well as all other technical documentation required to carry out logistics and distribution warehouse projects.

 

Requirements:

  • Technical school graduate with minimum of 3 years of related design experience
  • Intermediate to advanced proficiency in REVIT 2016 (or greater) and AutoCad 2017 (or greater)
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Work on multiple projects simultaneously and be able to prioritize workload accordingly
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills
  • Is able to travel up to 25% of the time in Canada and the USA, and globally when required
  • French & English (Preferred)

 

Why Deloitte?

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is The One Firm for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:

  • You will lead at every level: We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.
  • You can work your way: We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.
  • You will feel included and inspired: We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.


The next step is yours

Sound like The One Firm. For You?

At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities!  We encourage you to connect with us at

accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca

if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

title: Survey Crew Chief
description:
At GeoVerra, itâ€™s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means youâ€™ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If youâ€™re most at home in the outdoorsâ€”where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkersâ€”then our Crew Chief position might be the perfect fit.

Our company is in acceleration mode. GeoVerraâ€™s growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your career here will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

The most important thing to know? Weâ€™re a team of experienced and professional employees who genuinely believe in the work we do. We support each other in a safe and positive working environment. At GeoVerra, you never go at it alone. Dig deeper. Broaden your horizons. Weâ€™re here for it all. And with fantastic benefits, work-life balance, and professional development options, we make it easier to chase your dreams.

The Partnership Promise

This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You GeoVerra

Our new Crew Chief must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

What GV Provides

  • Full time, flexible benefits program, RRSP match, wellness days, and paid vacation time
  • Paid training for all safety tickets required

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and perform field survey work with the help of Survey Assistants;
  • Liaise with Project Managers to coordinate field survey work, to review and manage project budgets, timeline requirements, priorities and survey methodology;
  • Act as a company representative, liaising directly with client field representatives and land owners;
  • Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Survey Assistants working with you;
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of industry best practices, more efficient field processes and procedures and the innovative use of new technology; 
  • Actively participate in and proactively support the advancement of the GeoVerra safety program;
  • Some office technical survey work may be required in this position; and
  • Other duties as assigned/required.

Required Skills, Experience, & Behaviours

  • Our successful candidate will be a graduate of a recognized post-secondary program related to surveying and geomatics or have an equivalent amount of related experience;
  • Strong working knowledge of survey equipment and software such as GPS and Total Stations (Including Robotic);
  • Knowledge and experience of Trimble equipment and software, laser scanning and line locating would be considered an asset;
  • Strong problem solving skills in a field environment;
  • Effective communication skills - verbal and written; ability to produce accurate and legible field notes;
  • The ability to develop and motivate survey staff and work well in a team environment;
  • An aptitude for delivering projects on time and budget;
  • A valid driverâ€™s license and can provide a clean driverâ€™s abstract; and
  • Pre Employment Drug and Alcohol Testing;
  • All employment offers for Safety Sensitive positions are conditional upon the successful completion of a Negative Drug Screen and Passing Alcohol Screen. 

Working Conditions

Out of town work and frequent travel required;
Ability to carry, lift and push 50lbs on a regular basis;
Ability to work outside in all weather conditions;

 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Architectural Lead
description:
Minimum Clearance Required to Start:

Not Applicable/None

Job Description:

Manager Architecture - working in the one of our GTA offices, must be a generalist, creative experienced and flexible in terms of building design. The individual must have a minimum of fifteen (15) years of experience in leading building designs for any or several of the following transit facilities including Subway & LRT stations, transit maintenance facilities, transit centers, bus terminal & depots or airports.

Job Description

  • Ensures unflinching customer focus – passionate about solving clients’ problems and exploring new opportunities with them, supports market-focused solutions.
  • Strategic thinker – demonstrates thorough understanding of Parsons’ market position, opportunities, capabilities and competitive threats, stays informed of local, national and international trends that could impact the operation, skillfully navigates rapidly changing business climates.
  • Leverages networks – knows how to get things done in a complex, multilevel organization, effectively balances geography/local capabilities and resources, acts in the best interest of Parsons, drives continuous improvement in all process and capacity enhancements.
  • Business Acumen – integrates world-class business practices across function and organization, demonstrates cross-cultural business savvy.
  • Communicates with Impact –builds networks to exchange ideas and build support, uses a full range of available communication mediums to engage others, demonstrates empathy, understanding and active listening skills, elicits feedback and encourages others to speak up.
  • Ensures industry leadership, builds high performance organizations, is a champion of change, aligns resources, systems and processes, manages execution.
  • Directs the development, coordination, and execution of the programming, planning design and/or construction administrative activities and personnel under his/her direction on a day-today basis
  • Active participant in business development activities through early client interaction including development of proposals or “scope of work” development for larger pursuits, interviews, and on-going client maintenance interface
  • Manage, mentor and develop the architectural team
  • Manage large/multi-disciplined project /consultant teams
  • Interface with clients on schedules, meetings and issues (manage client expectations)

Minimum Requirements

  • Nice to have  licensed with Ontario Association of Architects (OAA) or any other Canadian Province.
  • A thorough understanding of integrated design and delivery methods
  • Understanding of building science, applicable structural concepts, basic physics and chemistry of building materials.
  • Previous managerial experience.
  • An understanding of Transit in terms of bus, rail and LRT operations and technical requirements.
  • An understanding of underground rail stations and the life safety considerations related to that.
  • Ability to mentor and guide junior staff
  • Ability to resolve complex technical issues with other disciplines
  • Ability to lead a multi-disciplinary design team through initial stages to a complete and functional design
  • Ability to manage internal project budgets and staffing
  • Ability to undertake assessments of existing buildings for condition, code compliance, and functions.
  • Excellent English language skills with the ability to provide reports, guidelines, assessments, and other documents that are clear, concise and complete.
  • Ability to provide technical guidance in written and graphic form for internal and external reports as well as acting as an expert consultant for legal matters
  • Ability to understand technical documents and guidelines to produce summary reports and three dimensional representations of the results.
  • Knowledge of CPTED principles, Security systems and Wayfinding with specific application to transit facilities.
  • Working knowledge of life safety best practices for various transit facilities.
  • Understanding of scheduling documents and scheduling software systems
  • Competence in supervising production of construction contract drawings using Microstation,  AutoCAD, and/or Revit
  • Competence in Sketch-up and other three dimensional graphic imaging and design software
  • Knowledgeable in MS Office programs including Word, Excel and PowerPoint


Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Architecture (or equivalent) is required and typically 15+ years of related experience, including supervisory/managerial experience. Professional registration is required.


Proven ability to perform in a managerial capacity, excellent written and oral communications skills (including strong presentation skills), and a thorough knowledge of industry practices and regulations are required. Must also possess a thorough knowledge of current technology and the capabilities and efficiencies of specific software for use in completing architectural design assignments.

The position may require a COVID vaccination or an approved accommodation/exemption for a disability/medical condition or religious belief as required by federal, state, provincial or local mandates or customer requirements.

title: Senior Silicon CAD Engineer
description:
Untether AI is building the world’s highest performance pure-digital AI inference chip.  We’re a rapidly growing Toronto-based startup, with employees across Canada and the US, building next generation hardware AI accelerators for neural net inference.  We are investing in software in a big way in order to make it as seamless as possible for researchers and developers to successfully deploy neural networks on our hardware. 

We’re looking for best in class engineers  to join our existing top-notch team.  When you join Untether AI, you will be part of the team that creates innovative hardware and delivers industry leading AI performance and efficiency. Utilizing non Von Neumann techniques, you will help propel sustainable AI inference.
As part of this talented team of engineers, you are able to - and are excited to - architect, implement, verify and productize custom hardware designs.  Being on our team means collaborating with an extremely bright group of people while tackling tough and interesting problems at the intersection of AI and hardware.

***Please note: While our engineering HQ is in Toronto, this is a remote opportunity and we welcome applicants from anywhere in North America.***

We are looking for an experienced silicon CAD engineer to develop and maintain a world-class set of EDA tools and CAD flows, supporting both the digital design and custom circuits design teams. The successful candidate will have experience with both digital and custom design flows and industry standard EDA tools.

Requirements & Responsibilities

  • Computer Science, Engineering or related degree
  • 10+ years of experience
  • Developing flows and scripts to support EDA tools and design effort
  • Install new releases, evaluate and tune EDA tools for quality of results including accuracy and runtime
  • Improving and maintaining tool flow infrastructure and automation
  • Manage databases for all hardware related , IP and tools; OA, .lib, testbenches, scripts, EDA tools, std cell libraries
  • Manage PDK data from foundry, keep files up to date, qualifying results for each EDA tool
  • Work with IT for optimal compute infrastructure and job management system

Preferred Skills & Experience

  • Excellent UNIX and scripting programming skills (Perl, Python, TCL and Skill)
  • Strong understanding of digital circuits and analog circuits
  • Experience with software build automation
  • Good knowledge of at digital design flow; synthesis, place and route, static timing analysis (Synopsys IC Compiler II and Primetime)
  • Good knowledge of analog and custom circuit simulation (finesim, hspice or spectre)
  • Experience with custom layout and physical design
  • Experience with version control software (perforce, git)

What are some of the perks that you will receive being part of Untether AI?

  • Aligned to Untether’s philosophy, our employees enjoy the same perks, regardless of role or level.  In part, these include:

  • 20 vacation days
  • Strong health and extended health benefits
  • Unlimited sick days
  • Stock options
  • Building chips and software that will change the world

Thinking about applying?

  • We’re a pretty welcoming bunch of people.  If we’ve piqued your interest, you’re passionate about the same things we are but you aren’t sure if you check all the boxes, please apply anyway.  We’re a great place to work, an even better place to learn and we focus on both capability and potential!
  • Besides being a pretty friendly group, we’re also pretty diverse - ethnically, experientially and in our physical and mental abilities.  If you are someone who needs accommodation during the interview process and/or in the workplace, please send a note along with your resume to

    careers@untether.ai

    and we’ll be in touch. 
About Untether AI:
Untether AI has developed a groundbreaking new architecture that brings neural net inference to new levels of performance and efficiency.  We’ve already sold our product to smart clients who want to get in at ground zero.  We’ve done this while continuing to improve our technology creating ultra-efficient, high performance AI chips that eliminates the data movement bottleneck that costs energy and performance in traditional architectures.  We’re a team made up of scientists, engineers and entrepreneurs and have the support of tier one investors. We recently received $125 million in our series B funding round which enables us to expand our customer engagements, enhance our software offering, and build the next generation of industry leading AI inference products. Join us to be part of something big - a chance to create the future of AI.

title: Field Surveyor
description:
ROLE
Working in conjunction with the SMJV Engineering Team, the Field Surveyor will be responsible for data collection and note taking, staking ditchline and grade cuts, managing of machine control equipment and drone flights. The Field Surveyor will be involved with the project from the start of scouting to the end of clean-up, capturing the necessary data for the construction and restoration of the pipeline and right of way.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Field Surveyors usually work as a single person crew and are required to self-manage their duties for the day.Primary instruction is provided by the Lead Surveyor but may also be given directly in the field from time to time by Foreman and Superintendents.
  • Provide detailed topographic surveys with clear and concise notes for submittal to the office
  • Staking ditch centerlines and other features within client design drawings/files
  • Verify/confirm depths of cover, excavation depths, etc.
  • Layout designed excavations via cut stakes for mainline construction as well as bell holes for trenchless crossings and open cut crossings
  • Layout designed reclamation features (diversion berms, ditch plugs, subdrains, etc.) per client location specific designs and/or typical drawings
  • As-built surveys (civil surfaces, pipe/weld/mechanical details/features, etc.)
  • Facility pile layouts, marking cut off elevations, placing caps, etc.
  • Manage machine control equipment, loading files, checking and calibrating equipment, troubleshooting problems and the basic mechanical ability to perform small repairs (replace cables)
  • Gather pipe bending data in the field for transmittal to the office for evaluation and design
  • Check designed surfaces for accuracy before implementing for construction, having the ability to detect any errors that need to be corrected
  • Safe driving of a company truck on various surfaces including forestry logging roads and pipeline right of ways
  • Carry out drone missions for progress video updates and photogrammetry interpretation of the terrain
  • Establish and promote best practice in health, safety, and environmental matters in conjunction with the HSE department
Note: In addition to these duties personnel are required to carry out such other duties as may be reasonably required in order to support the objectives of the company.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS
Qualifications (preferred but not mandatory)
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering (Geomatics or Civil preferred) or
  • Technological Graduate in Geomatics or Civil Engineering Tech

Experience
  • Minimum 3 years surveying experience in the field
  • RTK GPS and Total Station experience
  • Civil Grading considered an asset
  • Machine Control experience an asset
  • Pipeline construction an asset
  • AutoCAD Civil 3D an asset
  • Drone experience with a Small Advanced License an asset

Skills and Knowledge
  • A valid driver’s license and can provide a clean driver’s abstract
  • Understanding of the oil and gas pipeline construction industry
  • Basic understanding of the concepts behind data management in a relational database
  • Ability to think analytically and solve problems
  • Strong written oral communication skills, having the ability to listen and ask questions to clarify understanding as necessary
  • High level of attention to detail
  • Strong problem-solving skills in a field environment
  • Appreciate the time, cost, and quality implications of the role
  • Ability to use own initiative, self-manage, and prioritize tasks each day
  • Ability to take direction, work in a team environment, and contribute to the success of the project
  • Capable of completing work to deadlines
  • Complete training and required valid safety tickets is a requirement prior to employment
  • Must be physically fit and able to walk on uneven terrain for sustained periods of time

WORKING CONDITIONS
This position is field based and often works within remote project locations. Travel and/or living in temporary accommodations is required. This position works 6 days on 1 day off Monday – Saturday, 12 hours per day.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS
The Field Surveyor reports to the Survey Lead.
 We thank all applicants in advance. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

description:

Work for Sureway and enjoy being home with your family/friends every night!

Job Type: Full Time, Seasonal

Schedule: 10 + Hours/day 6 & 1 Rotation, Schedule as per Operational Requirements, OT after 8hr/day or 44hr/week

Location: Edmonton and Surrounding Areaâ€™s (non-camp position, required to live in the area)

title: Surveyor
description:
Surveyor









Location: Edmonton, AB, Canada Job ID: R9801 Job Status: Full-Time



Share:











Apply Now



Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.













Description





Job Summary:

You are an experienced Surveyor seeking a great wage, extensive benefits, and want to work for a company who prides themselves on safety. You have previously worked alongside crews within an industrial environment.


Apply to join the Ledcor team today!







Essential Responsibilities:



+ Complete field survey requests, measurements, and setup / configuring survey instruments.


+ Comfortable working with crews and proficient at communication.


+ Establish secondary control from primary site control networks.


+ Interpret and extrapolate surveying data from construction and design drawings.


+ Install survey stake locations, such as Right of Way limits, pile locations and cut-offs, and site grading.


+ Prepare surveying notes, level notes, grade sheets, and calculate coordinates.





Qualifications:



+ Minimum 3 years of field Surveying experience


+ Preferred to have completed diploma in Surveying, Geomatics, Civil Engineering, or a related field


+ Technical background in surveying, using conventional & digital levels, robotic total stations (Leica), and Trimble GPS equipment


+ Proficient with Trimble Access and Leica Captivate


+ Attention to detail with the ability to recognize & communicate discrepancies


+ Must be able to complete pre-access Drug and Alcohol testing





Work Conditions:



+ Shift based role of 14/7, camp and travel provided


+ Work will be primarily outdoors in various weather conditions


+ Benefits provided by CLAC - extended health plan (prescription drugs, dental, and other coverage)





Additional Information:


Company Description


Ledcor Industrial offers an integrated range of services from construction, engineering, and maintenance to pipe fabrication and module assembly. We offer turnkey solutions to our oil and gas clients and have built some of the continent’s largest oil and gas projects.




But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!




Employment Equity


At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.



Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.




View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here (https://www.ledcor.com/who-we-are/inclusion-and-diversity) .



Date Posted

May 5, 2022



7008 Roper Road NW, Edmonton, AB, Canada

title: Architectural & Design Representative (Greater Vancouver)
description:
Company Profile

Click to see how you can paint your future!

The color of pride: Benjamin Moore is proud to be a part of Berkshire Hathaway, which was recognized by Fortune magazine as the world's third most admired company. And for more than 130 years we've been a respected leader in the architectural coatings and home décor landscape; creating the products and tools that enrich and beautify thousands of communities each day. We recognize that our associates are the driving force behind our success and we strive to provide a work environment where hard work, creativity and purposeful collaboration are fostered and encouraged. Join a company where innovation is constantly recognized as we look for individuals who produce world-class products, best-in-class services and customer experiences, design pioneering paints using the latest technologies and deliver unparalleled value and brand experiences for our customers and retail network.

Job Summary
Benjamin Moore & Co. is currently looking for an ambitious and self-motivated individual to join our sales team. You will be accountable for engaging architects, designers and specifying professionals to grow market share and strengthen Benjamin Moore's position of product and color leadership within a defined territory. You will be responsible for managing the project specification and linking the planning stages to successful completion, resulting in paint sales and for providing expertise, education and brand awareness to the key purchase influencer segments including the Independent Retailer, Architects, Designers and Color Consultants while adhering to the Benjamin Moore core values.

This is a great opportunity to develop your sales experience with a high-energy team and become part of an iconic and growing Berkshire Hathaway family brand. Benjamin Moore offers a company car, as well as a competitive compensation & benefits package designed to attract the very best sales professionals.

Required Skills:

* BA/BS degree preferred
* Two to five years of experience directly with the architectural and design communities
* Thorough understanding of specification and finish schedule writing
* Working knowledge of required software programs (Microsoft Office, CRM)
* Excellent communication, listening and public speaking skills
* Effective training and motivational skills
* Effective time management skills
* High sales aptitude, self-motivated
* Ability to analyze situation and identify opportunities for success
* Effective decision making and problem solving skills
* Effective team interaction skills with high aptitude for collaboration with colleagues
* Valid driver's license and a good driving record a must
* Ability to work evenings & weekends when necessary
* Ability to travel overnight up to 40%
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Surveyor in Fort McMurray, Alberta | Careers at North American Construction Group
description:
Position Scope

NACG is looking for a Surveyor to work at our Syncrude - Aurora location. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Location: Syncrude - Aurora

Schedule: 14x7 - 11.5hrs

Accomodations: No accommodations provided

Transportation: To and from site, plus an additional $33/day Travel Incentive Pay

 

The successful candidate will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955. 

 

Responsibilities

  • 3 years of experience in survey party chief role
  • Must be skilled in unsupervised use of RTK GPS and Total station, and 3D scanners
  • Must be proficient with construction staking (roads, corridors, piping, slopes, etc) and as-built/topographic surveys
  • Experience with Trimble survey equipment considered an asset
  • Experience with volume calculation and design calculations in AutoCAD considered an asset.
  • Transport Canada RPAS (Drone) license along with experience flying multi-rotor drones will be considered an asset

 

Summary

All successful candidates must:

  • Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  • Have a valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  • Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  • Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

    Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

     

    All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  • CSO or BSO Certification
  • Copy of Valid Class 5 Driver’s License
  • Copy of recent Driver’s Abstract
  • VOID cheque/direct deposit form

  • Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  • Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  • An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  • After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

  • Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

     

    NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

     

    Overview

    North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.  In that time, we’ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. We’ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers. 

     

    In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

    • Significant Growth – As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
    • Long Term Contracts – With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
    • Commitment To Safety – With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
    • Competitive Compensation – NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

    North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

     

    Become a member of the North American family today!
