title: Party Chief
description:
Role Overview
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Party Chief to join our team around Alberta! Reporting to the Division Manager – Construction, or Regulatory, or the project manager on site, you will direct the field crew to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. Within this role, you will be involved in surveying resource industry related facilities and pipelines and local construction and legal work around Edmonton. There is also a significant opportunity to work on major pipeline construction projects around Edmonton and throughout Western Canada. This is a great opportunity for an individual that is looking to grow their career in Geomatics Engineering with a well-established company.
 

  • The ability to travel and work out of town in remote areas for extended periods of time is required
  • Pre-employment drug and alcohol testing will be on-going and unscheduled as required.

Responsibilities
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Field completion of various types of surveys focusing on legal surveys for the oil and gas industry as well as boundary surveys around Edmonton
  • Work with the Project Manager, client, and other McElhanney staff to develop solutions and move projects forward.
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise, and accurate field notes, records, and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

Requirements
  • Two-year technical diploma in Geomatics or Civil Engineering with at least 2 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Experience working in remote environments
  • Capable of working independently and solving problems on the job
  • Physical ability to work in mountainous and forested terrain and ability to lift heavy equipment.
  • Willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas, and willing to work in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours
  • Line locating training and comfort locating on a variety of sites
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset
  • Experience with Underground Utility Locating is an asset
  • Valid driver’s license required
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.
#
 What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle
  • Involvement with long-term clients in a variety of markets and industries
  • Opportunity to work with a multi-disciplinary team of Surveyors, Engineers and Environmental Professionals
  • The opportunity to be involved in one of Canada's largest private RPAS/drone programs
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching
  • Employee & Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support online or over the phone
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Competitive salary, participation in our generous performance bonus plan, and opportunity to join an employee-owned firm with potential share ownership
  • Continuous support for your growth through professional development reimbursement, mentorship programs, and opportunity to join numerous internal committees.

This role is designated as a safety sensitive position

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio:https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

Vaccination Requirement
In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others.  This position requires that the successful candidate become fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in the future, and as such, proof of vaccination will likely be required at some point. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.


About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
 

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

#LI-AM3  #Intermediate #Hybrid
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Underground Surveyor
description:
Company Profile

Minto Metals, a producing underground copper mine has exciting opportunities to become part of our team and live by our Company values – Be Safe, Be Honest, Be Responsible, Be Respectful and Be Great!

Position

We are seeking anUnderground Surveyorfor a full-time/regular position. The role will be based at the Minto mine, 250km north of Whitehorse, YT. This is a camp-based operation with a two-week on/two weeks off rotation. Travel to/from Whitehorse and the mine site is paid for by the company.

The Ideal Candidate

You will have:

  • Technical school diploma or related equivalent;
  • Minimum of 5 years of progressive experience in a survey role;
  • Knowledge of Deswik, AutoCad, word processing and spreadsheet programs;
  • Experience with the operation of drones, or capacity to adapt this skillset;
  • Experience with latest technology;
  • GPS / GIS experience;
  • Strong sense of integrity, ethics and desire to positively impact the environment;
  • Ability to develop and foster strong working relationships;
  • Ability to work with a diverse cross-cultural workforce;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities;
  • Valid driver's license;
  • Physically fit to perform the duties of the position.

Responsibilities

  • Monitor underground mining progress and establish survey control points as required;
  • Calculate month end tonnage reconciliation by survey;
  • Maintain up-to-date plans and as-builts;
  • Preparation of technical memos, reports, mining specifications;
  • Perform pre-operational checks, operate equipment and perform all job functions per Safe Operating Procedures;
  • Provide technical and mentoring support for Underground Mine and Surface Operations;
  • Ensure equipment deficiencies and operational issues are communicated clearly;
  • Accomplish other tasks within his/her area of expertise as requested;
  • Work independently, but also be effective within a team environment;
  • Ensure that safety issues are reported and promptly remedied;
  • Demonstrate safety leadership within a team environment and promote environmental awareness in all work or task related duties;
  • Maintain a high standard of performance in your duties;
  • Be an effective communicator in English (verbal and written) at all levels, including keeping your cross-shift and other team members fully informed at all times
  • Participate in site specific training;
  • Comply with company standards, as well as Yukon Territory and Canadian federal standards;
  • Other duties may be assigned from time to time as required by the Company.

Priority consideration will be given to Selkirk First Nation citizens, Northern Tutchone citizens, Yukon First Nations and residents of Yukon Territory.

title: BIM Modeler
description:
Reporting directly to the BIM Project Leader, the BIM/Revit Modeler is a key team member of the BIM team, and you will combine your strong technical knowledge with best practice with best practice industry trends.
 
What It Takes to Join the Toro BIM Team
The technical skills discussions will come after. What we want to know first is what does exceed internal client’s customer service expectation and owning a project mean to you? How do you do this?
 
What Your Dynamic Day at Toro Will Look like and the Environment / Working Conditions
• Work within an agile environment
• Collaborative team approach for white board idea generation and contribute to the team with your ideas and views. Your feedback and viewpoint are always welcomed
• Results driven, flexible and enjoys variety in your work

We are seeking candidates that share and exemplify our Core Values:

•Do What You Say:  Act with integrity so our customers trust us to deliver results.  
•Get It Done (Right):  Find solutions to ensure the job gets done right.  
•Be Better Every Day:  Passionate about improving our business, safety and quality; strives to be the best.  
•Think Big Picture:  Think big picture and long-term; investment in our business is critical to our success. 
•Develop Strong Relationships:  Values our employees, customers and advisors as essential part of our business  

RESPONSIBILITIES:

•Support the BIM Manager and Project Delivery Team(s) in day-to-day BIM/Revit activities.
•Develop and maintain Revit Families as required for clash reporting and presentation aligned with the project LOD requirements and modeling standards.
•Ensure coordination of all Model interfaces with designers
•Ensure all Models/Families deliverables are checked to comply with project and company quality standards and BIM requirements.
•Ensure BIM package submissions in accordance with project standards and requirements.
•Conduct clash detection and visual walkthroughs of complex areas
•Prepare models and reports for constructability analysis
•Create Standard Operating Procedures and Manuals on for specific teams
•Coordinate work with BIM Manager, including taking responsibility for timely completion of deliverables.
Software knowledge: 
•Highly proficient in Autodesk Revit Architecture
•Working knowledge of AutoCAD
•Working knowledge of Autodesk Vault
•Beneficial software skills:
•Autodesk Inventor, Navisworks, Dynamo

REQUIREMENTS:

•Diploma in Engineering, Architecture, or similar field.
•3-5 years of experience in Revit.
•Knowledge of the manufacturing process
•Ability to be engaged in multiple projects at one time is essential.
•Strong organizational, time and project management skills.
•Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills.
•Resourceful, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
•Map existing workflows and recommend technology solutions to support or improve these workflows
•Exceptional skills in Family Creation
•Experience in Revit Dynamo is a strong asset

title: Architectural Representative (FT)
description:
Dal-Tile is seeking a dynamic Architectural Sales Rep to increase the market. The Architectural Sales Rep is responsible for all sales activities from lead generation to sales closure through a framework of both specified and unspecified projects. They will develop and implement an approved marketing Plan which will meet both personal and business goals.

Primary Objective:
Increases commercial sales in designated sales territory by calling on Architects, Designers and National Accounts for the purpose of obtaining proprietary specifications for Dal-Tile.

Major Function and Scope:
  • Travels throughout assigned region to call on regular and prospective customers including Architects, Designers, Developers, General Contractors and National Accounts.
  • Identifies and establishes relationships with the Top 20 architectural firms and the Top 20 design firms.
  • Pursues new and maintains existing National Accounts. Follows up and reports information.
  • Emphasizes new product promotion during sales calls.
  • Schedules regular product knowledge seminars with architectural and design firms.
  • Develops in-depth knowledge and expertise with regard to all Daltile products, allied products, and installation methods.
  • Tracks meeting results consistently and effectively.
  • Maintains frequent communication with SSC staff to advise of future orders and obtain samples.
  • Schedules timely Large Project Tracking meetings.
  • Replenishes and updates products with the local A&D firms.
  • Performs other assigned duties as required.
Experience and Knowledge Required:
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent working experience.
  • Five or more years of sales or industry experience within the A&D community
Competencies:
  • Self-Starter
  • Strong communication skills
  • Exercises independent judgment and initiative
  • Basic computer skills
Other Pertinent Job Information
  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, use hands and reach with hands and arms.
  • The associate is required to walk, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl.
  • The associate may sit, climb or balance, talk or hear.
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions

title: Architecte d'affaires - Bilingue
description:
Client ID: 5111

Architecte d’affaires - Bilingue

Dans le cadre de ses ententes avec ses différents clients, Procom est actuellement à la recherche d’un Architecte d’affaires - Bilingue pour une entreprise dans le domaine financier. Notre client est situé à Québec.


Description des tâches et responsabilités – Architecte d’affaires - Bilingue

Les responsabilités du poste incluent :

- Assurer le consensus sur la vision d’affaires au sein de la vice-présidence, en faciliter la compréhension et en vulgariser la complexité;
- Éduquer les collègues sur la pratique d’architecture d’affaires afin de mobiliser les ressources à la réalisation des objectifs;
- Collaborer au développement d’une communauté de pratique de l’architecture (d’affaires et TI) pour l’entreprise dans son ensemble;
- Proposer un point de vue d’ensemble sur :
    - Les besoins d’affaires à rencontrer;
    - Les activités impactées;
    - Les produits et services offerts;
    - La clientèle cible;
    - La représentation actuelle, de transition et cible;
    - Le diagramme de contexte illustrant les besoins d’affaires des intégrations avant d’impliquer les équipes de réalisation.
- Encadrer la définition des besoins d’affaires et la livraison de valeurs pour la clientèle sur des aspects tels que :
    - La livraison de valeurs alignée avec la proposition de valeurs;
    - La définition des besoins des clients;
    - L’adéquation des besoins fonctionnels avec les besoins des clients;
    - La clarification des orientations d’affaires en amont des intégrations et des processus;
    - L’élaboration des solutions à haut niveau en collaboration avec les architectes TI;
    - La cohérence entre les processus, les besoins d’affaires et les intégrations.
- Encadrer l’amélioration de nos capacités à livrer des services de qualité par des moyens tels que :
    - L’association des capacités avec nos value streams;
    - L’identification des écarts entre la stratégie et les plans d’exécution;
    - L’évaluation des capacités quant à l’organisation, le savoir-faire, les informations, les processus et la technologie requise;
    - La définition d’un plan d’amélioration des capacités;
    - L’identification les parties prenantes;
    - L’évaluation et le contrôle des améliorations.


Exigences du poste – Architecte d’affaires - Bilingue

- Baccalauréat en informatique ou administration (ou tout autre expertise pertinente);
- 5 à 10 ans d’expérience en architecture d’affaires, gestion de projets ou technologie de l’information;
- Avoir une capacité analytique avancée et posséder un excellent jugement d’affaires;
- Posséder un esprit de collaboration et se démarquer au niveau des habiletés relationnelles et de communication;
- Posséder de fortes capacités d’organisation, priorisation et de résolution de problèmes;
- Capacité à travailler dans l’incertitude et l’ambiguïté d’un contexte de transformation;
- Niveau d’anglais écrit et oral avancé;
- Excellente communication verbale et écrite;
- Connaissance des bonnes pratiques en analyse d’affaires, ex : BPMN, BABOK, certification CBAP ou CCBA, etc. (un atout);
- Connaissance du secteur de l’assurance et de l’épargne collectives (un atout).


Type de poste
Contractuel 12 mois avec de fortes possibilités de renouvellement.

Date de début
Immédiatement

Numéro de référence
BH334670

title: Surveyor Manager
description:
Broadway Subway Project (BSP), Vancouver, B.C.
Position Summary:
Surveyors Manager manages and coordinates surveys and investigations of land surfaces. Ensures compliance to all applicable regulations and requirements including boundary calculations and legal issues. Being a Surveyors Manager ensures projects are completed on time and within budget. Is responsible for overseeing a site and directing crews on survey plans associated with engineering and construction projects. Additional duties include preparing proposals, contracts and reports; consulting with clients; preparing right-of-way plans; performing field work; and drawing/drafting maps.

Advantages
This will allow you the opportunity to work on a large scale project that has a real impact on the way the city commutes. Also a join a large General Contractor who has projects all over the world.

Responsibilities
Responsible of the surveying including the preparation of the baseline and its approval, the update of the plan and coordination of the site activities to overview the progress of the phases of the project: engineering, designers, construction, and commissioning.
Coordinate the surveying in terms of create the overall structure of the controlling system, coding of the activities/resources and create the structure to monitor the progress of the works, evaluate the deviations from the original plan and discuss with the management the actions to take to get back on schedule.
Assist all the department to have a precise picture of the progress of the works, dive the deadlines to achieve and coordinate the various phases of the project to get the final result of respecting the milestones of the project.
Manage the time evaluation in case of deviation from the original scope and assess the correct time impact analysis when needed:
Responsible of the survey department in terms of revenue progresses, develop criteria for survey methods and procedures, performance job-analysis and assist the design management to find the technical solution.
Preparation of the budget and its update
Coordination with the team and develop criteria for the design and modification of survey instruments.
Search legal records, survey records, and land titles to obtain information about property boundaries.
Getting Information - Observing, receiving, and otherwise obtaining information from all relevant sources.
Updating and Using Relevant Knowledge - Keeping up-to-date technically and applying new knowledge to our job.
Communicating with Persons Outside Organization - Communicating with people outside the organization, representing the organization to customers, the public, government, and other external sources. This information can be exchanged in person, in writing, or by telephone or e-mail.
Guiding, Directing, and Motivating Subordinates - Providing guidance and direction to subordinates, including setting performance standards and monitoring performance.
Training and Teaching Others - Identifying the educational needs of others, developing formal educational or training programs or classes, and teaching or instructing other
Estimating the Quantifiable Characteristics of Products, Events, or Information - Estimating sizes, distances, and quantities; or determining time, costs, resources, or materials needed to perform a work activity.
Repairing and Maintaining Electronic Equipment - Servicing, repairing, calibrating, regulating, fine-tuning, or testing machines, devices, and equipment that operate primarily on the basis of electrical or electronic (not mechanical) principles.
Documenting/Recording Information - Entering, transcribing, recording, storing, or maintaining information in written or electronic/magnetic form.
Performing Administrative Activities - Performing day-to-day administrative tasks such as maintaining information files and processing paperwork.



Essential Functions
Oversight of project work during the various phases of the project, in terms of controlling cost and time, coordinating the planning, control team.
Supervising and managing the work of survey.
Report to top management regarding the status of the project giving information to allow take technical decisions to achieve targets.
Maintain the relationships and coordination with the stakeholders including the members of the JV, Client and third parties involved in the project.

Qualifications
Graduation in civil engineering or similar with skills in survey and technical design.
More of 15 years of experience in surveying, scheduling and management.
At least 15 years of relevant experience in a similar role.
Significant experience in civil works projects with a focus on transportation infrastructure, metro projects, railway, motorways, damps, tunneling and surfacing, TBM guide system, BIM management, GPS and TPS rules implantation of coordinate system and compensation, projections, 3D modelling, coordination between design and field, technical office collaboration, UAV license APRS, surveyor software knowledge TBC, C3D, Leica products, drone software’s, 3DReshaper, Cyclone, Infinity, etc..
Experience cloud points management, technology systems LIDAR and TLS scanners, cloud point interpretation, classification, 3d analysis, mobile mapping, underground RPS technology.
Monitory systems, technology, developments, post-processing, valuations, interpretation, and final analysis.
Significant experience in long tunnel traverse (more of 8 km), implantation network, observation correction, post-processing and analyzing; Gyroscope calibration, observation, valuation and determination of the “local gyro deviation E-value”.
Post as-build and updating of the BIM.
Experience in Railway System on ballast and concrete slab, Amberg GRP technology, calibration, implantation of the final traverse, fix-point and leveling for the permanent way installation, post-processing final data’s and reports.



Summary
If this sounds like an opportunity you would be interested in, please send a copy of your resume to patrick.stegner@ranstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Surveyor
description:
Job Description

Why join us?                      

TransitNEXT is a wholly owned subsidiary of SNC-Lavalin. As the sole proponent in the TransitNEXT team, SNC-Lavalin is awarded the design, build, finance and maintenance of the new extension, and will also assume responsibility for the long-term maintenance of the existing Trillium Line.

Join TransitNEXT and become part of The Trillium Line Extension project, expanding and enhancing transit services in Ottawa.

As part of the Trillium project based in Ottawa, we are looking for a Surveyor to perform survey work as part of a field survey crew.
 

How will you contribute to the team?

  • Maintain and verify provided control network

  • Ensure equipment is maintained and calibrated

  • Read and interpret construction drawings.

  • Lay-out critical structures for projects.

  • Verify the accuracy of survey data including measurements and calculations conducted at survey sites.

  • Calculate heights, depths, relative positions, property lines, and other characteristics of terrain.

  • Determine longitudes and latitudes of important features and boundaries in survey areas using theodolites, transits, levels, and satellite-based global positioning systems (GPS) & Total Station (Leica).

  • Interact with project managers and project coordinators and survey team to provide on-time information and solve problems to site-related issues.

  • Provide As-Builts for project payments.

  • Complete quantity comparisons between models and As-Built conditions.

  • Complete quantity takeoffs from computer models.

  • Coordinate and undertake planning and implementation of survey requirements to facilitate construction activities

  • Maintain accurate survey records, documentation and stamped submittals

What will you contribute?

  • Post-secondary education in Surveying or Geomatics

  • Knowledge of survey practices and standards

  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in the construction surveying industry

  • Strong computer skills and proficient in the use of office, data, surveying and engineering-based software

  • Excellent oral and written communication skills and organizational skill

  • Knowledge of engineering design and survey methods

  • Ability to conceptualize 2D and 3D information.

  • GPS and total station experience required

  • Ability to work outdoors in various weather conditions

  • Ability to lift 50lbs

  • Driver’s license (Class G).

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin:

  • Opportunity to work on various projects of various sizes

  • Competitive salary

  • Motivational financial package & flexible benefits

  • Defined contribution pension plan in which SNC-Lavalin contributes

  • Work equipment provided according to the season (boot, bib, helmet, gloves, etc.);

  • Employee Share Ownership Plan (ESOP)

  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

  • 3 weeks of vacation time

  • Learning and development programs, training, career opportunities

You wish to leverage your experience and contribute to this position? Apply now!

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a global fully integrated professional services and project management company and a major player in the ownership of infrastructure. From offices around the world, SNC-Lavalin's employees are proud to build what matters. Our teams provide comprehensive end-to-end project solutions – including capital investment, consulting, design, engineering, construction, sustaining capital and operations and maintenance – to clients in oil and gas, mining and metallurgy, infrastructure and power. On July 3, 2017, SNC-Lavalin acquired Atkins, one of the world's most respected design, engineering and project management consultancies. http://www.snclavalin.com

Worker Type

Employee

Job Type

Regular

We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

Please consult our Privacy Notice  on our Careers siteto know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

title: Surveyor
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

The successful candidate will become part of a construction team in Saskatoon focused on Municipal and Commercial projects such as Roadbuilding, Concrete Restoration, Asphalt Resurfacing and Parking Lot Construction.

Responsibilities:

Safety Responsibilities:

  • Daily safety documentation  
  • Participate in tool box talks
  • Safety Training as needed  

Daily Responsibilities:

  • Work directly with superintendents, estimators, project managers and foremen ensuring all are informed of project requirements, timelines, and obligations regarding GPS performance
  • Use of AutoCad, Civil 3D, and Topcon software to build surfaces for use in 3D Machine Control
  • Interim and final quantities
  • Attain and compile data for use of machine control GPS
  • Monthly project progressing
  • Monitor quantities using GPS
  • Upload, maintain and troubleshoot GPS systems in Graders, Dozers, and Skidsteers
  • Checking grades and survey layout    
  • Aid field staff using 3D machine control
  • Utilize transit level to layout elevation data
  • File Management
  • Monitor and track project costs
  • Preliminary Survey

 

Qualifications:
  • 2-3 years experience in surveying
  • Education in Geomatics Technology is an asset

Daily Work Details:

  • Work locations are in and around Saskatoon and will vary during the construction season
  • Start dates vary depending on spring conditions and work usually concludes in mid-November.

Pay & Benefits:

  • Offering competitive wages as well as health and dental.   RRSP matching available after probation period.

 

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Construction Surveyor
description:
We are currently searching for a Construction Surveyor to join our team. If you have previous experience in the civil construction field or a similar industry we want to hear from you today!

This position will travel on rotational schedule to various construction sites throughout Alberta.

Morgan Construction and Environmental Ltd. is an oilfield construction company based out of Edmonton, Alberta with over 50 years of experience working for resource corporations throughout Western and Northern Canada. We supply solutions for Civil Earthworks & Infrastructure, Oilfield & Oil sands Construction, Environmental Remediation, Environmental Reclamation, Decommissioning & Demolition and Geo-Environmental Construction.

Responsibilities

The successful candidate will communicate with relevant parties to obtain plans, specifications and electronic documents to provide the layout information. This person will interpret plans, specifications and electronic documents to provide direction to construction crews either verbally or by installing construction staking.

  • Day to day field staking in accordance with project design.
  • Quantity pick-up and calculation.
  • Effectively communicates proper layout information to relevant parties in a timely manner.
  • Troubleshoot survey layout and machine control data onsite; ensure data is correct and updated.
  • Troubleshoot and repair all survey equipment.
  • Communicate with Design Engineers regarding project design.

Requirements

  • Extensive GPS Construction layout experience using Trimble or Topcon equipment with a minimum of 2 years’ experience.
  • Post-Secondary Education in a surveyor program from an accredited technical school would be an asset. High School Diploma is required.
  • Valid Class 5 Driver’s License.
  • Safety tickets - Standard First Aid, H2S Alive, Ground Disturbance level 2, CST/PST would be considered an asset.
  • Flexibility/ Adaptability - Proven ability to manage and thrive in an environment of constant change overcoming obstacles and seeing opportunities instead of roadblocks
  • Communication – Able to express oneself (verbally and in writing) in a clear, concise and professional manner that encourages open expression of ideas and opinions.
  • Teamwork - Proven ability establishing and maintaining harmonious working relationships with internal and external clients that promotes good morale, cooperation and a sense of belonging within the team.
  • Attention to detail with a high level of accuracy.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills.
  • Edmonton based would be an asset.

Benefits

  • Competitive pay and comprehensive benefits package.
  • The chance to work with a great team where Safety is an integral part of our culture.
  • The opportunity to learn new skills and advance your career.

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest in Morgan but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Senior Structural Steel Detailer/Drafter
description:
About us:
Our team is growing, and Marcon Metalfab (www.marconmetal.com) is hiring an experienced Senior Structural Steel Detailer/Drafter to join our dynamic team based in Delta’s Tilbury Park.

For over 30 years, Marcon Metalfab has supplied custom fabricated steel and rubber products required for infrastructure, and other projects in the transportation, building construction, utilities, mining, marine, oil, and gas sectors. Equipped with leading manufacturing technologies that allow for efficient handling and processing of materials, Marcon’s 22,000 square foot facility can support even the largest fabrication projects.

Coupled with an unconditional commitment to providing expert customer service and a rigorous quality management system, Marcon consistently delivers better quality products within tight time frames at prices that are competitive within any industry.

We have many long-serving employees here, competitive wages, and excellent benefits. Some places say they have a family atmosphere, but it is truly the case here at Marcon.

We are located in Tilbury Industrial Park in Delta BC, with four ways to get here – the Massey Tunnel, Alex Fraser Bridge, South Fraser Perimeter Rd., and Hwy 99.

About the Position:

Responsibilities:
  • Your job responsibilities would include working alongside and assisting Project Managers on current projects and performing high-level reviews of shop drawings and erection drawings as per Marcon Detailing standards;
  • You will gain broad exposure to projects at various stages of the project lifecycle;
  • You will help to control information flow and assist with managing change orders (EWO), schedules, Site Instructions (SI), Back From Approvals (BFA), and RFI’s;
  • You will issue shop drawings and Erection drawings to the fabrication department and support the fabrication to make assemblies ready in different stages of projects;

General Responsibilities:
  • Maintaining the Project Folder & all relevant information;
  • Reviewing, understanding, and ensuring Customer Standards are followed;
  • Assisting with detailing and checking operations;
  • Responsible for ensuring that ABM, connecting duties have been completed for each deliverable;
  • Responsible for releasing shop and field drawing lists for editing;
  • Assisting Project Managers and the Team when and if required to help maintain the schedule;
  • Performing quality inspections and control on all drawings;
  • Reviewing Site Instructions (SI) and Managing SI Log;
  • Monitoring and tracking Extra Work Order’s (EWO’s);
  • Managing Project Data such as the Rev IFC, IFA, RFA, etc;
  • Responsible for issuing shop and field packages.

The Ideal Candidate will have/be:
  • Seven to twelve years of experience as a Steel Detailer;
  • Familiar with Checking or Detailing/Drafting Quality Control;
  • Successful completion of relevant technical education (eg. a Diploma in Steel Detailing or Engineering);
  • Knowledge of both AISC and CISC standards;
  • Spatial visualization awareness and a decent understanding of industry business practices in detailing engineering, and fabrication;
  • Organized with a high level of communication both written and verbal;
  • A proactive and logical thinker and problem solver;
  • Capable of performing your duties with a minimal amount of supervision.

Skills and Abilities:
  • Knowledge of Computer-assisted design software (including AutoCAD, and Tekla);
  • Being familiar with Advance Steel is an asset;
  • Intermediate skills with office software including Microsoft Office, Adobe, and Bluebeam;
  • Able to read Structural, Engineering, and Architectural drawings;
  • Detail-oriented, precise, and organized;
  • Able to organize multiple jobs;
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills;
  • Diligent checking and editing work prior to release;
  • Asking questions when in doubt or if further information is needed.

What We Offer:
  • Competitive wages based on experience;
  • Amazing Extended Health and Dental benefits - no out-of-pocket cost;
  • Relocation assistance is available for outstanding candidates from other parts of Canada;
  • Mentorship and training for professional growth and career advancement;
  • Excellent family culture and a supportive team;
  • An organization with a trusted reputation and stability within the manufacturing community;
  • Overtime opportunities.

Our Vision, Mission, and Values:
Our vision is to partner with like-minded companies to develop leading infrastructure solutions, and in the process, contribute to building strong communities.

Our mission is to be North America’s leading supplier of joints, bearings, railing systems, custom–fabricated steel, and rubber products for the transportation sector and beyond.

To achieve this, we must embody Marcon’s four values:
Service, provided at the highest level to our clients
Excellence, in the quality of products we manufacture
Innovation, in our products, technologies, and skills
Integrity, in our responsibility to clients and fellow employees

Marcon Metalfab is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination based on age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other legally protected class in accordance with applicable federal, provincial, and local laws. We are also committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace. We would like to thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected will be contacted.

title: Senior Piping Design Lead
description:
Fluor is one of Canada's top employers and recognized globally as a leader in the Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Fabrication, and Maintenance industry. Our focus on innovation and providing cost effective technology-based solutions to address our client's needs is second to none. As we look to the future, we need creative, ambitious, and innovative professionals who can help us achieve our goals.

Fluor’s Mining and Metals Business line provides these engineering services to the mining industry globally with a focus on the engineering, procurement, and construction of processing and infrastructure facilities associated with the recovery of metals and minerals.

This position is responsible for working within Fluor’s environment utilizing Fluor’s standards and procedures to design safe and efficient layouts in a 2D and 3D CAD software platforms. The candidate will be expected to understand detailed engineering drawings and flow sheets from both clients and vendors, and work closely with other disciplines to design various areas related to Mining and Metals. The ideal candidate will have experience with all phases of a project from Scoping Study to Detailed Design, and will know what level of detail is required for each phase.

The candidate will need to be a strong communicator and have a solid understanding of the value to work in a team environment.

Day to day activities and responsibilities include:
• Prepare 3D layouts and/or schematics for conceptual and detailed designs of advanced complexity in 2D Computer Aided Design (CAD) drawings;
• Create 3D models in Intergraph Smartplant environment;
• Participate in model review sessions;
• Review drawings and vendor equipment documentation of moderate to advanced complexity within the discipline and from other disciplines for compliance with project requirements, and actively seek discrepancy resolution;
• Assign work to and check work done by other designers;
• Incorporate health, safety, and environmental factors in design;
• Analyze and make independent recommendations regarding solutions to problems with varying complexity in accordance with organization and/or project objectives and guidelines;
• Organize and prioritize a variety of projects and multiple tasks in an effective and timely manner, set priorities, and meet deadlines;
• Adhere to industry codes and standards as well as department practices and procedures;
• Other duties as assigned

title: Architectural Precast Drafter
description:
Architectural Precast Drafter Mitrex/Cladify (part of GCAT Group), developers of unique cladding and Building Integrated Photo Voltaic solutions for the construction industry, is looking for a full-time Architectural Precast Drafter with AutoCAD experience to design facades and architectural cladding systems for high-rise buildings and other large structures
For more on Mitrex and Cladify, please see https://www
mitrex
com/mitrex-resources/ (under Mitrex Media), and https://www
cladify
com/
YOU


have completed university/college degree in Architecture or Structure have working knowledge and experience in Precast design-drafting and engineering for architectural building systems
have strong hands-on experience with 2D/3D AutoCAD and Revit BIM (Building Information Modelling) software Knowledge in Precast drafting standards
NICE TO HAVE (but not mandatory) Experience with Rhino 3D, Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign Software Experience with multi-residential/commercial buildings Familiarity with Ontario building codes WHAT YOU WILL DO Prepare construction drawings of varying complexity on high-rise residential, commercial, and institutional projects Prepare shop drawings and shop tickets of facades for the production line Communicate with clients, project managers, and installation teams Preparation of the BOM and materials WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US Comprehensive training on new and innovative products, and our industry Compensation of $50,000-$80,000+/year, plus an annual performance bonus Extended medical and health coverage (including vision, dental, and life) Wellness program including free healthy foods, medicinal provisions, and discounted gym and fitness class memberships Competitive RRSP Matching for tenured employees Free charging and reserved parking for electric vehicles Collaborative and diverse culture, open concept modern office space Unlimited room for rapid advancement and growth Backed by 20 years of experience through our parent company, GCAT Group Full-time and permanent position AODA Considerations Mitrex Inc
welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities
Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process
PROCESS: We are an equal opportunity employer that welcomes candidates from diverse backgrounds
Candidates who are legally entitled to work in Canada (without employer sponsorship) and can commute to the office every day are welcome to apply
Please attach your portfolio in a PDF format or a link to your portfolio
Applicants without portfolios will not be considered
We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in our company
However, due to the number of applications we receive, only qualified candidates will be contacted

title: Marine Surveyor
description:
Company Description

We are SGS the world’s leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. Our 96,000 employees operate a network of 2,600 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world.

Job Description

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform surveys on board sea going vessels, i.e., full inspection of ships’ hold for suitability with respect to cleanliness, Draft Surveys, On/Off-hire surveys, Bunker Surveys, Damage Inspections.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES
•    Ship’s draft survey
•    Barge draft survey
•    Ship’s on/off hire survey
•    Pre-purchase survey on ocean going vessels
•    Bunker surveys
•    Ships hold cleaning consultant
•    Inspection of any ship’s compartments
•    Supervision of load and stowing of cargos
•    Loading and lashing of deck cargos
•    Grain stability survey
•    Dead freight survey
•    Draft limitation calculations
•    Stevedore damage survey
•    Dock damage survey
•    Vessel damage survey
•    P & I surveys
•    Owner’s, Shipper’s Charter’s representative at loading/discharge
•    Inspection of refrigerated compartments
•    General cargo damage survey
•    Marine consultant for Agents, Shippers or Terminals
•    Any other related duties as required as assigned by the Company

    Qualifications

    PROFILE

    • Must have a minimum of 5 -10 years experience in conducting Marine surveys
    • A minimum of post secondary education (College diploma or University degree)
    • Must possess Canadian Foreign Going Master’s Certificate

    REQUIRED SKILLS

    • Capable of operating without being under close supervision
    • Superior organizational, communication and interpersonal skills are essential
    • Must be able to read, understand and follow work instructions in a safe, accurate and timely manner.
    • Candidates must be proficient in using various types of computer software (Word, Excel. PowerPoint & Outlook).
    • Proven ability to manage and coordinate multiple projects in a fast-paced, highly professional environment.
    • Candidates must demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills including grammar and composition.
    • Extended hours and shift work are required.
    • Proven ability to manage and coordinate multiple projects in a fast-paced, highly professional environment.
    • Candidates must demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills including grammar and composition.
    • Ability to work well with others & independently.
    • Proven time management skills and a strong attention to detail.
    • Works well under pressure.
    • Extended hours and shift work may be required from time to time.
    • Travel to other SGS locations or client location may be required from time to time.
    • Ensures full compliance with the company’s Health & Safety, Code of Integrity, and Professional Conduct policies.

     



      Additional Information

      SGS Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process. Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

      Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings should be authorized to work in Canada.

title: Architectural CAD Technologist
description:
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented drafting professional with experience in commercial construction?
Agilus is recruiting for an Architectural CAD Technologist in the construction sector in in Headingley, Manitoba.
Are you someone who is good at construction design and wants to develop your personal and technical skillset in a highly dynamic and innovative company? Agilus Winnipeg is recruiting an Architectural CAD Technologist for one of our reputable clients here in Manitoba, 5 mins away from Unicity. If this is you, we definitely want to hear from you!
Responsibilities:
  • Drafting and design of quality blueprints for commercial construction from conceptual information through project completion utilizing AutoCAD
  • Detail building designs (Structural, Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing) of all complexities utilizing the design output using AutoCAD
  • Review & verify shop drawings from all disciplines including architectural, structural, mechanical, electrical
  • Review and interpret National Building Code and local jurisdiction by-laws and apply them to specific projects
  • Conduct site visits as required for documentation of existing site conditions, as well as meetings required during the course of construction
  • Prepare proposal documents, presentation slides and participate in company project meetings
  • Assist in the development of standards, templates, and procedures.
  • Support Project Managers to perform other duties as required

Successful candidates will have:
  • Degree or diploma in Architectural Technology or related subject required. Certification in CTTAM and/or ABTAM is considered an asset.
  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience in commercial projects from various sectors (i.e. engineering, architecture, or construction firms) is an asset
  • Previous experience in the commercial construction industry is definitely a strong asset.Familiar with commercial construction process & applicable building codes/standards
  • Proven ability in using and managing the current industry versions of AutoCAD. A Portfolio of previous AutoCAD projects is an asset. Experience in Sketchup, Revit, Adobe Creative Suite, Microsoft Office, Bluebeam Revu is an asset
  • Proficiency in reading and interpreting blueprints, schematics, and various other construction documentation;
  • Significant experience in the preparation or development of architectural and structural drawings for all major building components in commercial projects is highly preferred. Experience and knowledge in developing mechanical, and electrical drawings is an asset
  • Must have strong attention to detail; ability to create clear well laid out drawings. Must have strong organizational skills; especially in the management of drawing files and drawing lists. Must have excellent communication and presentation skills (written and verbal). Must have the ability to work well in a fast-paced environment, ability to work to deadlines under pressure.
  • Must have a valid driver's license, required.

What's in it for you:
  • Competitive Salary
  • Shared-cost health/dental benefit plan
  • Paid time off
  • Career growth and development
  • Work life balance

We want to connect with you!
Please apply directly online by email cpadaoan@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Architectural CAD Drafter
description:
Architectural CAD Drafter


Position Description


Job Summary


We are looking for an Architectural CAD Designer to work withinour Decoustics product brand within the CertainTeed Architectural Products portfolio.


This is a great chance to join a Top Employer and contribute to our growth and success!


Here’s what we do…


Since 1975, Decoustics has excelled in the custom-engineering and manufacturing of acoustical ceiling panel and wall systems. Custom-engineered ceilings showpieces in metal, felt, fiberglass, and wood. Backed by a team of collaborative professionals, CertainTeed Architectural Products provides expertise in acoustics, engineering, and innovation.


CertainTeed is a subsidiary of Saint-Gobain -- the world’s largest building materials company with a 350-year legacy of innovation and growth. Saint-Gobain group is leader in sustainable product development and environmental stewardship. We’re proud to that Saint-Gobain North America was recognized by Top Employers institute as on the best workplaces in North America & Canada.


For 113 years, CertainTeed has been synonymous with quality, trust, innovation, and service. Our team designs, manufactures and distributes materials and solutions in the construction and building materials market. CertainTeed’s broad product offering includes insulation, ceilings, roofing, siding, fence, railing, deck, exterior trim and gypsum board products. We provide comfort, performance and safety while addressing the challenges of sustainable construction, resource efficiency and climate change. Our offerings incorporate and promote the wellbeing for each of us and we are building a future where we collectively work together towards our core purpose to Make the World a Better Home.


What’s the Job


+ Execute engineering related tasks on multiple projects from bid to project close out.

+ Produce & revise production drawings using AutoCAD and other software tools as required, consistently ensuring standards and controls are adhered to.

+ Carry out material take offs and submit orders for production, continuously working with internal departments to ensure no production delays.

+ Issue RFPs accurately from all necessary information received (architectural/shop drawings/field dimensions) from customer to plant for production. Set up transfer meetings as needed with production staff to ensure clear and optimized directions are included to improve the results of the RFP’s.

+ Collaborate & coordinate with Sales, Project Managers, R&D, and Production to understand initial job requirements, manage change orders/adds and provide a clearly defined path of construction.

+ Review and maintain assigned project files to ensure all details pertaining to the project are filed accordingly.


Required Qualifications


Required


+ Post-Secondary education in Architecture or Design and minimum 3-5 years of experience within related field.

+ Working knowledge of developing 2D architectural drawings using AutoCAD.

+ Ability to read architectural drawings (blueprints) and other construction documents.

+ Knowledge of building industry standards and practices and effective written and oral communication skills.

+ Ability to work effectively manage varying priorities according to tight deadlines and in a rapidly changing environment.

+ Strong organizational skills


Preferred


+ Extensive experience with AutoCAD, 2D

+ Experience with 3D architectural drawings using AutoCAD definite asset, but not required.


Company Summary


We provide unique options to fit your unique lives! Our Total Rewards Program is customizable to accommodate your needs. Our menu of flexible options (https://bit.ly/2RZtfYI) includes, but is not limited to:


+ Hybrid work environment - work up to 60% from home!

+ Excellent healthcare benefits package.

+ Family Focus & Balance: Parental leave, paid time-off and Employee Assistance Program.

+ Financial Security: Competitive RRSP, Company-funded DPSP (Deferred Profit-Sharing Plan) and Employee Stock Purchase Program (PEG).

+ Volunteer Day off: Give back to the community – each employee has one paid day a year that they can use towards volunteering their time and effort with a registered charity.

+ LiveWell Program: Rewarding you for living a healthy lifestyle.

+ And more!


_Why work for us?_


At Saint-Gobain, our employees have pride in belonging to an organization whose culture is made up of these core values: Trust, Empowerment, & Collaboration. Our company encourages diversity and inclusion in all its forms while our productsmake the world a more beautiful, safer, and sustainable home (http://bit.ly/purpose-sgna) .


To learn more about us visit www.certainteed.ca


We look forward to hearing from everyone but please note that due to the volume of resumes submitted, only those selected for next steps will be contacted. To stay in touch with CertainTeed, follow us on _LinkedIn, Facebook_ and _Instagram._


Legal Statement


Saint-Gobain is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process to applicants upon their request. This commitment is in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).


Architectural CAD Drafter


Location: Woodbridge, CA-ON


Posting Date: 04/13/2022


Job Code: CAN00095


See yourself here (https://maps.google.com/?q=CT+Decoustics+Canada Woodbridge CA-ON)

title: Surveyor (Aurora)
description:
Position Scope:

NACG is looking for a Surveyor to work at our Syncrude - Aurora location. You must be well-organized and favor safety above everything else.

 

Location: Syncrude - Aurora

Schedule: 14x7 - 11.5hrs

Accomodations: No accommodations provided

Transportation: To and from site, plus an additional $33/day Travel Incentive Pay

 

The successful candidate  will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955.  

 

Responsibilities:
  • 3 years of experience in survey party chief role
  • Must be skilled in unsupervised use of RTK GPS and Total station, and 3D scanners
  • Must be proficient with construction staking (roads, corridors, piping, slopes, etc) and as-built/topographic surveys
  • Experience with Trimble survey equipment considered an asset
  • Experience with volume calculation and design calculations in AutoCAD considered an asset.
  • Transport Canada RPAS (Drone) license along with experience flying multi-rotor drones will be considered an asset

 

Summary:

All successful candidates must:

  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  4. Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  5. Disclose COVID-19 vaccination status:
    • Fully immunized individuals must provide government issued proof of vaccination to be exempt from site testing requirements
    • Individuals not fully immunized may be subject to site COVID-19 testing requirements and associated costs
  7. Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

 

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  1. CSO or BSO Certification
  2. Copy of Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Copy of recent Driverâ€™s Abstract
  4. VOID cheque/direct deposit form

Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  1. Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  2. An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  3. After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

 

Overview:

North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.   In that time, weâ€™ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. Weâ€™ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers.  

 

In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

  • Significant Growth â€“ As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
  • Long Term Contracts â€“ With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
  • Commitment To Safety â€“ With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
  • Competitive Compensation â€“ NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

 

Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Surveyor
description:
Your Employer

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and its more than 2,600 people concerned about the environment daily, engage in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centered management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

We offer

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage telecommuting.

Dare Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.


Your Contribution

 

As a Surveyor, you will work in collaboration with the Instrumentation & Monitoring team.

 

Your main responsibilities will be:

  • Apply and promote Englobe’s health and safety rules.
  • Assist the Surveying team in carrying out daily monitoring/surveying activities.
  • Understanding of geomatics and surveying basics utilizing a total station
  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures, safe work practices and work plans in a safe, efficient manner under all applicable regulatory requirements and contract specifications.
  • Coordinate and undertake planning and implementation of survey requirements to facilitate construction activities.
  • Maintain accurate survey records, documentation, and stamped submittal.
  • Generating deliverable documentation including technical reports and letters, summaries, data sheets, graphs, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Work with field staff project needs to develop project specific plans and documents.
  • Produce work plans in which objectives are clearly defined and steps for achieving them are well detailed for project crews to follow.
  • Provide clients (internal and external) with efficient responses to inquiries.
  • Anticipate client needs and respond within a timely manner to each inquiry. 
  • Monitor project and team performance. Forecast project outcomes and adjust where necessary to deliver successful project outcomes.
  • Manage client expectations and scope changes through active communication.
  • Identify and resolve client, project and/or team issues.
  • Performs various tasks, including analyzing proposed project solutions to ensure structural reliability, resource efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

Your Profile

 

  • Diploma or Degree in Geomatics Engineering Technology, B.Sc. in Geomatics, or related discipline.
  • 3+ years of previous surveying experience, specifically with utilizing a total station or similar equipment
  • Ability to work effectively and competently with people at all levels in the organization; is a great team member.
  • Ability to work without supervision, effective time management and strong organizational skills.
  • Contribute on an on-going culture of safety in all work environments.
  • Ability to work to deadlines and see tasks through to completion.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Previous consulting experience is an asset.
  • Valid provincial driver’s license required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

title: Surveyor
description:
Overview:

ALERT: This role is CRAFT in the US and Non-Craft Hourly in Canada per the Davis Bacon Act.  

 

Conducts topographic and cross-section surveys to support planning and design of the project site using prescribed methods.

What you will be doing:
  • Provides work control lines and elevations that are required for accurate measurement and correct installation of materials.
  • Assists in the evaluation of potential dimensions and other field problems.
  • Performs layout work competently and accurately as specified by survey management.
  • Checks as-built conditions that require the use of surveying techniques.
  • Provides topographic and cross-section surveys as required for planning and payment quantities.
  • Assists with conducting quantity calculations as required.
  • Maintains knowledge of Companyâ€™s values and strategic plan.
  • Support published corporate policies.
  • Perform additional assignments per managementâ€™s direction.
What we are looking for:
  • High School Diploma / GED required.
  • 2+ yearsâ€™ experience in survey or land mapping required.
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree preferred.
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License
  • Knowledge of and proven practical use of survey instruments and practices.
  • Developing knowledge and technical use of survey programs and site layout techniques.
  • Team working skills.
  • Developing communication and technical understanding.
Why work for us:

Some of the benefits you may be eligible for as an employee are:

  • Comprehensive compensation package and paid time off program
  • Industry leading 401(k)/RRSP
  • Medical/Extended Health Care, Dental, Vison and/or Provincial Medical
  • Wellness benefits & Employee Assistance Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement Program

We are an EEO/AA/ADA/Veterans employer.

title: BIM/VDC Coordinator
description:
Company Summary:

Operating in the Canadian construction industry since 1908, Alberici has served countless communities through the development of infrastructure, food manufactories and energy centers amongst others. At Alberici, we are proud of the quality of life our buildings bring to families throughout North America.  Working at Alberici means satisfaction in knowing the work we do improves the lives of others. In turn, we continually invest in the development of our employees to provide them with fulfilling careers. Alberici Constructors, Ltd. is part of Alberici Corporation, a $2.6-billion North American construction firm recently ranked 31st largest General Contractor in Engineering News Record.

Come build your career with Alberici -- where tomorrow gets built today.

Connect with us LinkedIn,Instagram, Facebook, Twitter

Position Summary:

The BIM/VDC Coordinator to perform site surveying and layout for various projects. This position is project site based in a variety of market-segments including, but not limited to, water treatment, heavy industrial, industrial process, food and beverage, and civil. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following; however, other duties may be assigned.  To perform in this position successfully, an individual must be able to perform each of these essential duties satisfactorily.  

  • Operates robotic total stations, scanners, and general surveying instruments.
  • Provides vertical and horizontal control points, elevations and offset lines from benchmarks and boundary lines established by others. 
  • Establishes control and measurements for land-based and marine work.
  • Conducts standard calculations to identify areas, elevations and volumes required to facilitate field work.
  • Transfers elevation and control lines from floor to floor with no line of sight.
  • Creates and uses 3-D scans to facilitate equipment setting, modular framing and field construction.
  • Creates and maintains project-specific files accessible by the project team.
  • Keeps supervisor informed of their schedule and project needs on a regular basis.
  • Interfaces and coordinates with self-perform tradespeople, subcontractors, supervision, and project management staff. 
  • Translates field layouts into 3D modelling programs such as NavisWorks or AutoCAD
  • Utilize point cloud data to translate construction coordinates
  • Perform Design coordination and assist in identifying constructability issues with the project team and subcontractors.
  • Assist with updating, maintaining, and distributing documents to the field and subcontractors.
  • Facilitate, in conjunction with the site team, the site logistics plan in a model environment and assist the site team in the development of schedule visualization models
  • Potential to be responsible for Project Coordinators and other coordinators including third party, as well as skilled craft to assist in layout on large projects.

What you bring:

  • Post-secondary degree/diploma in Engineering, Architecture, Surveying Technology, Construction Management or Technical school background (trade school or vocational training) plus 3- 5 years of construction layout experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Possesses working knowledge of industry standard surveying and BIM software, as well as all elements of survey and layout.  Must be able to read and understand intent of drawings, specifications and submittals
  • Exceptional ability to prioritize, manage multiple activities and work under pressure
  • Adaptable; able to constructively and resourcefully work well under pressure, demonstrating flexibility and resilience
  • Detail oriented
  • Advanced MS Office skills (Excel, Word and Outlook), project controls systems, AutoCAD, Revit
  • Experience preferred in multi-discipline installations – i.e. civil, mechanical and structural
  • Practices effective written and oral communication skills
  • Reads, analyzes, and interprets documents such as operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals
  • Writes routine reports and correspondence
  • Effectively presents information in one-on-one and small group situations to clients, consultants, subcontractors, suppliers, trades, and other employees of the organization
  • Interprets a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form
  • Applies concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations
  • Defines problems, collects data, establishes facts, and draws valid conclusions
  • Interprets an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deals with several abstract and concrete variables
  • Intermediate knowledge of building, construction details and relevant rules, regulations, and quality standards

**We thank you for your interest. Only successful candidates will be contacted for an interview**

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

See job description

title: Architectural Representative - Montreal, Quebec
description:
Architectural Representative, Montreal

To cover province of Quebec, with a home base location of Montreal

ARDEX Americas (www.ArdexAmericas.com), is the Global industry leader in the manufacturing and development of high-performance specialty building materials.

We are immediately hiring for an experienced Architectural Representative, to secure ARDEX product specifications for key construction projects with Architects, Specifiers, Designers, Engineers, National Accounts and other end-users. This is a field based position with approximately 30% travel including occasional overnight. Must be fluent in English and French. Industry experience is essential.

Key responsibilities

  • Source leads, obtain appointments and conduct meetings/presentations to various persons or firms with the goal of driving sales opportunity through successful specification acquisition.
    Call on and support the Preferred Partner, Choice Distributor network. This includes product training, sales training and working with their dedicated Architectural Sales group on a regular basis.
  • Support the Global Project Services team (GPS). Identify GPS project opportunities through new and existing architectural, design, and engineering accounts. Provide presentations and miscellaneous support for the GPS team when required.
  • Attend & Participate at regional and national Architectural and industry related tradeshows when required. Help develop effective tradeshow displays, promotional flyers, print advertisements and direct mail pieces with support from Marketing.
  • Develop, implement and execute field action plans and specification strategies, to deliver territory goals and budgets
  • Work closely with the territory Sales Team by providing necessary product training, sales training, distributor training, specification sales and marketing support.
  • Effectively utilize lead provision software and ARDEX A4C system to identify, communicate, and track account and project opportunities


Keyword: Architectural, Specifications, Specifier, Construction, Engineering, Building Materials, Architects, Sales, Business Development
Required Experience:

  • Must be fluent in English and French
  • Minimum five (5) years architectural and specifications experience is essential
  • Familiar with architectural specifications and construction design elements is essential
  • Experience with building products or flooring installation products is essential
  • Ability to effectively present in front of large groups
  • Strong interpersonal and persuasive skills
  • High level of energy and enthusiasm for the business and be customer driven and professional
  • Excellent communication, writing and attention to detail
  • Ability to work independently and in a fast-paced environment
  • Must be able to travel throughout assigned territory up to 70% including some overnight
  • Demonstrates ARDEX Growth Mindset competencies: Innovation, Open Mindedness, Collaboration, Agility, Initiating Action and Execution, Ownership
  • Must be able to undertake periodic travel to the U.S.

Education

  • Four (4) year college degree preferred, or minimum High School Diploma with relevant work experience



Benefits:

  • Industry competitive compensation (salary, bonus, commission)
  • Company phone and laptop
  • Car allowance
  • Competitive compensation packages, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Holidays (11 paid), Paid Time Off (PTO), Vision Insurance, Dental Insurance, Extended Health Care Insurance, Discount Programs, Registered Retirement Savings Plan and more!

From: ARDEX Americas
