title: Surveyor
description:
Come build with a BC Top Employer 2022 winner!

Jacob Bros Construction is immediately hiring a Surveyor (or Grademan)forthe Highway 91-17 Upgrade Project in Delta, BC.

Your ​Rewards:

  • Full-time, permanentemployment
  • Work 10-12/h days, 5-6 days per week
  • Earn overtime after8 hours per day, and double time after 12 hours per day
  • Group Medical, Extended Health and Dental Plan
  • Group RRSP contribution
  • Vacation pay
  • 5 Year Service Award (Trip for twoanywhere in North America)
  • Eligibility for up to $2000.00 Referral Bonus Program
Responsibilities:
  • Sets-up and operates Topcon survey and GPS equipment; directs and conducts a broad range of field surveys for construction purposes
  • Accurately calculates heights, depths, positions, property lines, and other characteristics of worksite terrain
  • Prepares accurate field data, notes, charts, plots, maps, records and documents related to surveys for construction purposes
  • Verifies quality and accuracy of survey data, including measurements and calculations, coordinates findings with construction site management
  • Accurately reads, interprets and analyzes engineering drawings; produces accurate as-built drawings
  • Sets elevations and grades for roads, utilities construction and concrete works
  • Prepares and maintains maps, reports and legal descriptions of surveys to describe work performed
  • Cleans, adjusts and maintains surveying instruments to maintain accuracy
  • Other labour duties as assigned
Requirements:
  • Two (2) years proven Surveyor experience fora privately held or family-owned general contracting business is preferred
  • Must be legally eligible to work for any employer in Canada
About Jacob Bros:

At Jacob Bros, our team of talented construction professionals is taking on some the most challenging projects in British Columbia's construction industry.

We are one of BC’s largest and most respected construction organizations, offering construction services in a variety of markets including heavy civil construction, major public infrastructure, and industrial, commercial, institutional and residential projects.

Jacob Bros has proudly served every major sector of Western Canada’s construction industry since 2008, and has been consistently recognized as a BC Top Employer.

Jacob Bros employs over 300 construction professionals, including staff and craft employees.

title: Architectural Designer II
description:
CannonDesign has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Architectural Designer II based in our Toronto, ON office. Look at the description below. If you think your skills and experience, make you a good match for this position, we'd love to hear from you. We're looking for creative, curious, empathetic people to join our Living-Centered Design movement.
 
ABOUT OUR FIRM
CannonDesign is an integrated design solutions firm focused on helping people continuously flourish. Whether designing for innovations in health, new scientific discoveries, equity in education or the next big idea in business, we use our Living-Centered Design approach to help organizations realize widespread change. Our ability to design transformational places, plans and strategies is why Fast Company named us a World Changing Company and one of the most innovative design firms in the world.
 
ABOUT THE ROLE
This intermediate-level position will be a member of our multi-disciplinary team and will collaborate with design and technical leadership and be an integral part of project teams. Under the direct supervision of a Licensed Architect and project leadership the primary responsibilities will include the following:
 
WHAT YOU WILL DO 
  • Independently and under limited direction, contribute as part of a multi-disciplinary team; design, selection, coordination and architectural detailing.
  • Prepare and contribute to design and presentation efforts utilizing Illustrator, Photoshop, Sketch-Up, and other programs as required.
  • Independently develop and manage the REVIT model to produce plans, elevations, and sections. With limited direction, produce REVIT section and plan details within all architectural phases.
  • Prepare preliminary design sketches of small to moderate-sized site plans.
  • Communicate with other disciplines to ensure coordination of project documents.
  • Assist in the development of design and concept drawings.
  • Assist in coordination of engineering systems with engineers.
  • May take on a leadership role within the team on a particular project issue or topic.
  • Review shop drawing submittals with some guidance from the Project Architect.
  • May attend field site inspections, which frequently involves a physical walk-through of the site.
  • Attend and actively participate in project team meetings
  • Perform other duties as assigned.
 
ABOUT YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
  • Bachelor's degree in Architecture required. Bachelor's or Master's degree in Architecture from an accredited program preferred.
  • Minimum 4 years of related professional experience.
  • Actively pursing Architectural Registration in Canada preferred.
  • LEED accreditation preferred.
  • Strong creative design portfolio is essential as are strong communication, teamwork, presentation, graphics, organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple projects.
  • Proficiency in Revit, SketchUp, Bluebeam, Microsoft Office, Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign.
 
ABOUT WORKING HERE
  • We are relentless in our pursuit of client adoration (not simply satisfaction). Consistent delivery of the best service is what we are about.
  • We are committed to ensuring our practice is equitable for all employees, representative of the communities around us – and focused on the future of design. We advocate for equity, diversity, and inclusion efforts through the leadership of our DEI Council, Employee Resource Groups and other community advocacy initiatives.
  • We're about communication and transparency here. If you want to talk to someone about an idea you have, or a challenge that needs addressing, we're ready for you.
 
Please note that candidates can only apply to our positions on our company Careers site. It's not uncommon for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites; never enter your information or apply for CannonDesign positions on any platform. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us. Please provide your resume and portfolio when applying.
 
As a condition of employment, all employees are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required timeframes and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.
 
CannonDesign recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce and is committed to Employment Equity and the Federal Contractors Program. We encourage applications from qualified aboriginal Canadians, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities and women. CannonDesign is committed to providing accommodation for people with accessibility needs due to disabilities in all aspects of the hiring process. If contacted, please advise Human Resources if you require disability-related accommodation.

title: Construction Surveyor
description:
Company Description

We are a global team of dedicated and experienced architects, engineers, planners, designers and technology professionals who share a common desire – to help our clients create livable, sustainable, and advanced urban environments.

Job Description

As a result of progressive growth, our Calgary office is seeking a Construction Surveyor who is looking to grow their career. We are seeking someone who is a quick learner and a team player who is interested in being an integral member of our land engineering group. We are following the provincial procedures before considering returning to the office. We continue to emphasize wellness for all our team members and have added to our comprehensive list of benefits to support this further.

Responsibilities:

Most of the things you’ll work on:

Generally, working independently on project sites, you will complete topographic surveys and construction layouts for earthworks, underground and surface works construction. This work is primarily located in and around the Calgary region and our clients tend to be private developers. 

Key responsibilities/tasks could include:

  • Performing various types of surveys that may include legal, topographic, right of ways, construction layouts, as-builts and engineering surveys
  • Coordinating survey work, recording measurements, preparing clear and accurate field notes, sketches, construction layouts and as-builts related to the specific project
  • Liaise with client reps in setting priorities, requesting and dispensing of project information and discussing deliverables
  • Demonstrating excellent interpersonal skills required in client discussions, meetings and with other stakeholders with the goal of building relationships
  • Ensuring that quality assurance/controls and safety protocols are meeting IBI Group’s standards of practice
  • When required, coordinating with and mentoring of surveying assistants and engineering students
Qualifications

You'll Need To Have:

  • A degree/diploma from a technical college in Geomatics
  • 2-4 years of post-graduation civil construction/surveying related experience
  • Experience using software and surveying related equipment:  Trimble RTK, Total stations, GPS
  • Experience using Civil 3D and the operation of drones are definite assets
  • The ability to liaise effectively with clients
  • Must have a Valid Class 5 Driver’s license for day trips; own reliable vehicle is also required
  • Ability to work in a variety of outdoor situations and weather conditions and carry/lift survey equipment


Additional Information

Why you should work for IBI Group:

Our employees will find a design environment where collaboration is at the core of the business. We proudly support our team members through continuing education, completion of licenses and certifications, memberships in professional societies, seminar and conference attendance.

  • Competitive Base Salary based on industry standards
  • Robust Extended Medical Benefits
  • Participation in Incentives Program
  • Coverage of Licensing Fees and Annual Dues to Professional Organizations
  • Professional Development & Self-Directed Learning Resources

We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. IBI Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include:  work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Surveyor - Eggometer Coordinator (trice)
description:
Come make a difference in a modern city, in full expansion, which is committed to its citizens. An environment where your creativity contributes to the realization of great stimulating projects favoring the well-being of the Lavallois. In addition to providing you with career opportunities, you will be part of a large public organization with human dimension. The Center of Excellence in Geomatics is looking for a:

Surveyor - Geometre Coordinator

Temporary mandate (1 year )

The challenges await you:

Under the authority of the immediate superior, you plan, Organize and direct the execution of landscaping activities including the location of property limits. In addition, you coordinate the mandates entrusted to surveyor-surveyor firms, expand the technical quotations and you ensure the quality of services rendered in this area. You bring your expertise to the development of geomatics.

More specifically You:

  • Participate in the coordination and monitoring of planning and analytical mandates entrusted to the consultants.
  • Direct the implementation activities of works to be built and the statements of the current construction (X, Y and Z) with a view to determining the correct alignments before the books Under construction.
  • Analyze the received documents dealing with survey or geomatics, determines their acceptances, interpret the results and make recommendations to the officials of the different divisions involved.
  • Prepare and / or supervise the preparation of plans, the technical descriptions, the location certifications and all other documents that fall within your area of ​​expertise and sign and seal the related documents according to the requirements of your professional order.

  • experience of construction sites;
  • Experience of distribution networks of drinking water and sewers, an asset;
  • Certification Asp- Construction;
  • Driver's license (class 5) valid.

title: Senior Land Surveyor
description:
Are you a Registered Land Surveyor that is motivated to be an entrepreneur and community leader that would like to grow and become a partner of an Engineering and Surveying firm? Do you live in Alberta and are ALS Certified and would like to make a move to Brockville, Ontario? Brockville is located near Ottawa and Kingston and a few hours from Toronto.

Our client is currently looking to fill a Senior Land Surveying position based in Brockville, Ontario. The successful candidate would be responsible for all surveying operations as well as coordinating with the engineering and planning teams.

The company is a multi-disciplinary professional firm offering state of the art services by integrating Surveying, Planning, Engineering and Architectural Design. They specialize in small to mid sized residential, commercial, industrial, and institutional construction and development projects. A vibrant and modern company, they stand on decades of experience and reliability.

Key Responsibilities
· Manage all surveying operations.
· Supervise and mentor surveying crews, office, staff, and supervisors.
· All responsibilities under the AOLS Certificate of Authorization.
· Certify all cadastral surveying operations.
· Work with multi-disciplinary team such as planners, engineers, and architects.
· Build and maintain client relationships and pursue business development opportunities.
· Interact with governing bodies, planners, landowners, real estate agents and other interested parties.

Minimum Requirements
· Registered as an Ontario Land Surveyor (OLS) with AOLS.
· 5 years of experience as an OLS.
· Experienced in Cadastral Surveying and Geodetic Surveying.
· Experienced with Total Station, GNSS, and other current software.
· Entrepreneurial and business experience considered an asset.

title: Survey Technologist
description:
Position Overview:

Challenger is looking to hire an experienced Survey Technologist to join our Edmonton team. Challenger Geomatics is an employee-owned firm with a strong track record for recognizing and retaining talent. We offer our employees competitive compensation along with health and dental benefits.

The Survey Technologist will be based out of our Sherwood Park location. The Survey Technologist is responsible for processing field data including digital and hard copy field returns; as well as quality control and review of data pertaining to the various published products of the Geomatics department as directed by the Project Manager. The successful candidate will analyze field data using various software including COGO, GPS, and CADD. This person will liaise with the project manager and also with clients as required for project execution. The Survey Technologist ensures all published products meet company standards and professional regularity requirements.

Duties / Responsibilities:

  • Receives, downloads and processes data from field returns.
  • Inputs field data into an electronic database for future reference.
  • Performs calculations for piles, anchor bolts, foundations, and prepares field layout files.
  • Works with 3d surfaces and does volume calculations.
  • Identifies and informs the project manager as to deficiencies with field procedures or field returns.
  • Monitors technical and field procedures, ensuring adherence to professional practices and company procedures.
  • Publishes plans and documents for registration, processing or filing with Government or regulatory agencies.
  • Keeps abreast of technical, professional or regulatory developments affecting technical design or processing procedures.
  • Identifies and recommends process or technical improvements.

Skills:

  • Solid working knowledge of Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Leica software.
  • Ability to interpret field returns and processed data.
  • Ability to read and understand Construction IFC and Engineering plans.
  • Availability to work overtime during some evenings and weekends in order to help service emergency client requests.
  • Attention to detail and the ability to provide exceptional customer service.
  • Ability to work effectively under deadlines as well as manage time and prioritize tasks.
  • Previous field experience, an asset.

Qualifications:

  • Graduate geomatics technologist with a professional designation, an asset.
  • Proficient with Leica Software, an asset.
  • 3+ years of experience performing survey calculations using Civil 3D.
  • Previous experience with legal survey practices, including Crown Disposition Surveys, Right of Ways, Oil & Gas, an asset.

title: Surveyor - Heavy Civil
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for Surveyor(s) with large earthworks and construction projects experience.
 
Nuna is the largest Inuit-owned heavy civil construction, earthworks and mine construction contractor in Canada. 
 
We offer: 
  • 2 week on / 2 week off rotations; 12-hour days 
  • Competitive hourly rate with Overtime pay (1.5x)
  • Extensive benefits including company matching RRSPs
  • Employee recognition program
  • Rotation allowances paid out every rotation.
  • Commercial flights and accommodations are covered
  • Annual bonus system

The Surveyor is responsible for the layout and as-built of all earthwork's activities on site, as well as processing and management of all received design data, and collected as-built data.  This position utilizes industry standard survey equipment, such and Topcon or Trimble GPS and Total Stations in conjunction with AutoCAD Civil 3d and Carlson Civil Software to provide project engineers and managers with a clear understanding of site topography, geology, and obstacles, and conducts regular surveys during the life of the project to ensure design parameters are maintained and up to date.
 
Duties:
  • Maintain grade elevations and set grade stakes to guide equipment operators.
  • Observe excavating activities to verify conformance to construction design.
  • Perform topographic surveys to determine volume quantities.
  • Calculate elevations and measurements from drawings and specifications.
  • Assist with exploration programs by laying out survey grids, drill hole locations, and claims boundaries.
  • Performs reconnaissance of the site prior to commencing work to identify the most suitable locations, establishing reference locations for the foreman, superintendents and trades to build from.
  • Reviews and updates all drawings that relate to the survey for completeness, consistency, and feasibility of layout to ensure that all dimensions between corresponding drawings agree.
  • Operates and maintains surveying equipment and ensures there is a supply of all surveying materials available on site.
  • Prepares documentation of all surveying activities performed.
  • Provides quality control by checking for accuracy at all control points, benchmarks, gridlines, survey marks, elevations and stakeout points. Will also monitor the site for correct elevations and locations.
  • Assist with conducting quantity calculations as required.
  • Proficient with RTK GPS and Robotic Total Station, AutoCAD Civil 3d programs, rod and level, laser level. 
  • Experience with Topcon and Carson Civil are considered assets. 
  • Clear understanding of survey, blueprint reading, and GPS equipment and troubleshooting.
  • Finish grade experience to standard specification tolerances with sub-grade and aggregate placement


Qualifications:
  • Geomatics/Survey Technology Diploma from a recognized post-secondary institution;
  • Certified Engineering Technician (CET) or Certified Survey Technician (CST) preferred.
  • 2-5 years of survey experience in high-end construction layout services, boundary surveys, topographic surveys, control surveys, and monitoring surveys.
  • Proficiency with the various Microsoft Office applications.
  • Able to work at our remote worksites on a rotational basis.
  • Previous experience working on site in Northern Canada is considered an Asset.
 
All successful candidates must:
  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written.
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driver's License.
  3. Eligible to work for any employer in Canada.
  4. Resides within Canada.
  5. Have experience as requested in the job description above.
 
Interested applicants can apply at: https://nunalogistics.com/join-our-team/ You can also apply by email: hr@nunalogistics.com.
 
Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.   
 
We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
  
Nuna is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective and innovative operator in the north.

title: Survey Crew Chief (Technologist)
description:
Location:  GTA Office â€“ Toronto â€“ Liberty Village

Who We Are

TULLOCH Engineering is a progressive, multi-disciplinary firm that believes in maintaining a family-oriented feel. We seek out opportunities to work on unique projects and thrive under the most challenging conditions where we bring a passion for finding solutions and a fierce enthusiasm in implementing them. Our employees are dedicated to quality and often go the extra mile to fulfill client requests. We are excited about our work in the fields of engineering, land surveying, environmental and mapping services. We employ over 350 professionals working from fifteen offices throughout Canada.

Our Geomatics team at TULLOCH offers services to clients in all major sectors across Canada. We often find ourselves working in locations that offer logistical challenges, but also impressive opportunities for success and learning. In addition to conventional surveying services, we also offer construction monitoring, precision layout, 3D laser scanning and bathymetry surveys. We are constantly thinking of innovative solutions and ideas and will utilize emerging technologies to improve both the efficiency and quality of deliverables to our clients.

About The Position

We are currently looking for a full-time Survey Crew Chief (Technologist) to join our growing Toronto team supporting transportation, transit, and rail infrastructure development in Southern Ontario. Our office is in the vibrant area of Liberty Village located just North of Exhibition GO, one stop from Union Station.

The ideal candidate will be:

  • Hard working with an innovative attitude and be adamant about honing their technical skillset in both field and office environments.
  • Committed to helping achieve our goal of expanding and winning work in the Greater Toronto Area.
  • Enthusiastic about the opportunity to work on flagship infrastructure projects in Toronto.
  • Adaptable and willing to travel out of town and do what it takes to get the job done! 

This is a permanent, full time position to begin as soon as a successful candidate is found.

Working under the supervision of a Project Manager,

the primary responsibilities will include:

  • Assessment of field and documentary evidence to perform cadastral surveys
  • Performing pre-engineering, topographic surveys while overseeing field activities
  • Performing high-precision surveys such as: layout, deformation monitoring, levelling, static control network surveys
  • Collecting field data using various survey instruments and GPS field equipment
  • Overseeing QC of data collection ensuring that field notes and daily downloads are complete
  • Collecting of terrestrial scanning data or aptitude and willingness to learn
  • Client interaction while on-site
  • Mentoring and training new field staff
  • Opportunities to work on proposals, reports and producing deliverables

Qualifications

  • Preferred candidate will have a minimum five (5) years practical related experience
  • Completion of a two (2) year minimum college program in geomatics technology or equivalent
  • Must be proficient in setting up, operating and troubleshooting Trimble survey equipment (or similar).
  • Must be comfortable with static control surveys, high-precision layout work and 1st order levelling techniques, or willing to learn
  • Knowledge of Ontario survey evidence assessment, Acts, Standards and Regulations as they relate to performing cadastral surveys
  • Willingness to pursue articling process towards becoming an OLS (optional)
  • Be well organized and have a career mindset
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Unwavering commitment to environmental health and safety in the workplace
  • Proficient in the operation of ATVs/UTVs/Snowmobiles
  • Willing to travel for site inspections and field work on occasion, sometimes on short notice and for long periods of time
  • Willing to mentor and train other colleagues
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License

If this seems like a great fit for you, please submit your application online at www.tulloch.ca. Thank you to all applicants for their interest. Only those candidates shortlisted for the position will be contacted. Please indicate your legal eligibility to work in Canada in your application.

Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the recruitment and selection process, or those needing job postings in an alternate format, please advise Human Resources when contacted for an interview.

â€œWe want to build an organization where everyone loves their job and their leaders care for themâ€

title: Survey Field Crew Chief (Technologist)
description:
SBM Geomatics is currently seeking a full time Survey Field Crew Chief (Technologist) in our London office. Reporting to the OLS, the successful candidate will perform survey fieldwork for Cadastral Surveys for boundary retracement and establishing new boundaries on various legal survey projects including topographic, construction layout, site control, differential leveling, as-built verification, quantity verification, and control networks. The ideal candidate will be hard working with a desire to expand and master their technical skillset in both field and office environment and will be committed to helping achieve our goal of expanding and winning work in the London area. Utilize new technologies to improve the quality and efficiency of deliverables to our clients. This position will be primarily field based out of London, ON/surrounding area and will require travel.

Company Summary:

SBM is an established multi-disciplinary Planning, Civil, Structural, Mechanical and Electrical Engineering firm that utilizes a team first, collaborative approach to building engineering. SBMG operates as a sister company of SBM. We are a fast growing, energetic company that encourages personal growth and forward thinking. We are looking to add like-minded individuals to our team. SBM has offices in London and Kitchener, providing engineering services to a variety of private and public sector clients across Southwestern Ontario. The firm employs over 100 engineers, engineers-in-training, technologists, technicians, planners, and administrative personnel.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Take direction from OLS and /or Project Manager to understand the scope of work and critical data items to complete the survey correctly.
  • Use and maintain GNSS equipment, robotic total stations, data collectors, and a variety of levelling equipment.
  • Collecting field data using various survey instruments, and GPS field equipment.
  • Field work to perform high precision surveys such as boundary retracement, SRPRs, Reference Plans, Subdivisions, Condos as well as pre-engineering topographic surveys and construction layout.
  • Adhere to strict quality control practices and safety policies.
  • Daily download of data and prepare extensive field notes and sketches.
  • Field layout of stake points including pins, monuments, stakes, hub, and nails.
  • Client interaction while on-site.
  • Communicate errors, problems, and questions to the Project Manager and OLS immediately.
  • Interpret a variety of plans, deeds, sketches, construction and architectural drawings and maps.
  • Coordinate with and support office drafting department when required.
  • Mentoring and training new field staff
  • Clearly correspond daily with the Project Manager and OLS to ensure smooth operations in the field and office.
  • May be required to use personal vehicle (disbursements to be reimbursed)
  • This role will be primarily site based; some office work may be required.

Skills / Qualifications:

  • Diploma in Geomatics Technology, Civil Engineering Technology, or Survey Engineering Technology or equivalent preferred,
  • 3 years practical related experience.
  • Must be proficient in setting up, operating, and troubleshooting Topcon survey equipment (or similar).
  • Must be comfortable in performing high precision layout work and related checking procedures.
  • Knowledge of Ontario survey evidence assessment, Acts, Standards and Regulations as they relate to cadastral surveys
  • Willingness to pursue articling process towards becoming an OLS (optional).
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong organizational, mathematical, and analytical skills. 
  • Ability to learn and implement problem-solving skills in areas such as survey boundary retracement under the direction of the OLS.
  • Ability to adhere to AOLS regulations, knowledge of field survey methods and calculations in the collecting boundary evidence in the field.
  • Eagerness to become familiar with industry standards and methods to approach required solutions. 
  • Strong attention to detail and expertise in building client relationships.
  • Proficiency in all manner of professional land surveying.
  • Ability to work in a variety of weather conditions in a physical manner for 8 hours/day.
  • Ability to move approximately 50 lbs.
  • Commitment to health and safety in the workplace.
  • Respect and professionalism when dealing with the public, clients, and fellow employees.
  • A valid driverâ€™s license, insurance, and access to reliable transportation.
  • Qualified Ontario Land Surveyor in Training (OLSIT) considered an asset.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and AutoCAD considered an asset.
  • Experience with surveying field equipment considered an asset.
  • Commitment to ongoing professional and personal growth; willingness to learn and develop new skills.
  • Ability to work both independently with little supervision and in a team environment.

Compensation:

This is a full-time position with a competitive salary and annual performance bonus. SBMG offers a positive working environment and a good relationship with our employees translates directly to better customer service and a superior finished product for our clients. The successful candidate will typically work 8am-5pm Monday-Thursday and 8am-2:30pm on Fridays.

What We Offer:

  • Health Benefits Plan
  • RRSP Matching (4%) Program
  • Paid Overtime
  • Performance Bonuses
  • Banked Time Options
  • Regular Social and Team Buildings Events
  • Opportunity to build great relationships
  • Career Growth and Development
  • Professional Dues and Training Coverage
  • Paid Vacation
  • Paid Sick Time
  • Reimbursement for Travel

To Apply:

All qualified applicants should apply through our online application system.

References are to be made available upon our request.

SBM Geomatics Ltd. is an equal opportunity employer. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment in accordance with relevant governing laws. We thank all applicants but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Surveyor
description:
Company

IDL Projects Inc. (IDL) is a dynamic, rapidly expanding company focused on providing a broad array of construction services in Canada and internationally. We have established ourselves as a go-to solutions provider in the construction areas of civil and infrastructure, commercial, residential, public and institutional, industrial, energy, mining and safety services.

 

Position Summary

This role is a mixture of construction field surveying during the construction season, typically May to October. During the slower parts of the year, this role will be working with our estimating groups doing quantity take-offs, taking historical survey data and applying it to future hard bid estimates.

 

Location

IDL Projectâ€™s head office is located in Prince George, British Columbia with satellite offices in Terrace, Vancouver and Vancouver Island.  This position is based out of Prince George, with the possibility of out of town work that may involve working out of one of our satellite offices or depending on the project have the option of traveling in and out on a rotational basis.

 

Responsibilities

  • Provide work control lines and elevations that are required for accurate measurement and construction
  • Assist in the evaluation of potential dimensions and other field problems
  • Provides topographic and cross-section surveys as required for planning and payment quantities
  • Assists with conducting quantity calculations as required
  • Setup and operate total station and GPS instruments for layout and as-built capture of road, pipes, excavation, utilities, conduits
  • Collect, organize and record geographic information
  • Help prepare drawings, charts, maps, plans, records, and documents
  • Organize records, measurements, and other survey information
  • Competently calculate layout from digital design files
  • Perform quantity survey as required
  • Generate and maintain as constructed drawings by tracking and capturing as-built data (inverts, lengths, coordinates, work type)
  • Maintain site benchmarks as required
  • Perform layout work competently, accurately and efficiently and ensure construction work complies with all engineering standards, codes, specifications and design instruction
  • Provide technical engineering information and interpretation of plans, detail sheets and specifications
  • Report accurate quantities for labour cost reports and accurately monitor material ledgers to ensure quantities in estimate are sufficient to complete the project
  • Use historical survey information to assist estimators to create hard bid estimates

 

Qualifications

  • Post-secondary technical education or an equivalent combination of technical training and experience or
  • Competent in reading and interrupting design engineering drawings
  • The ability to interpret and use information from maps, graphic drawings and measurements taken in the field
  • Experience with GPS systems and total stations
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Computer skills and the ability to use MS Office suite etc.
  • Superior time-management skills to meet deadlines handling multiple tasks simultaneously
  • You have a strong working knowledge of surveying techniques, surveying equipment standards and procedures, and ability to work autonomously on the job

 

 

Position Benefits

At IDL we strive to ensure a positive and safe work environment. Our employees are part of a work family built on respect, friendship and latitude for personal time. We live our core purpose of â€œThink Different, Build Betterâ€ and our core values of â€œTake Care of Each Otherâ€, â€œBe Innovativeâ€, â€œBuild Great Thingsâ€ and â€œHave Funâ€.

 

Compensation

  • Competitive wages commensurate with experience
  • Health and dental benefits
  • Training opportunities
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Excellent work/life balance

title: Senior CAD Technician
description:
Job Title: Senior CAD Technician

Department: Finance

Are you looking for a new opportunity? Let’s shape our future together!

WE'RE ON A JOURNEY TO CREATE A WORLD OF LOVE, CONFIDENCE AND BELONGING

The ALDO Group has been on this journey for over 40 years. We believe that our passionate associates are at the heart of our success, and that with them we will lead into our future with kindness. 

The ALDO Group is committed to diversity and inclusion, not only now, but for the long term. We strongly encourage people who are Aboriginal, racialized, have disabilities, come from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or have intersectional identities to apply for employment with us. At ALDO Group, we will always strive to take steps to create a diverse and inclusive work environment that promotes equal opportunity and accountability.#WeAreALDO

 

ALDO GROUP ASSOCIATE PERKS

  • Recognition programs to showcase your talent!   
  • To be part of a company that takes a stand on issues affecting people, the environment, and our partners    
  • Summer Fridays (because Summer is for fun) 
  • Purchase discount on merchandise sold in all our divisions. 
  • Family & Friends events with discounts on our products    
  • Subsidized cafeteria & daycare   
  • Subsidized public transportation, carpooling network and free parking   
  • On campus gym with access to a trainer
  • Flex schedules and telecommuting 
  • Sick days 
  • Attractive total compensation! 

YOUR ROLE

Reporting directly to the CAD Team manager, the CAD Technician’s main responsibility is to work closely with the Project Managers, Designers and Store Planner to produce CAD drawings, from preliminary layouts to full construction sets for all store types (new, renovation and retrofit), for all brands of the Aldo Group (Aldo, Aldo Accessories, Aldo Outlet, Call it spring & Globo), worldwide (North America & International markets). The CAD technician role is to provide construction drawings and technical solutions that demonstrate design sensibility and a strong understanding of the store concept, site conditions and building code requirements. 

 

Strategic:10% 

  • Work in close collaboration with the Project Managers, Store Planner and Designers to produce technical drawings, full construction drawings set, and documentation aligned with the store concept, site conditions and building code requirements (when applicable), for AGNA & AGI markets. 
  • Provide technical solutions that demonstrate design sensibility and a strong understanding of the store concepts, for all banners,   
  • Ensure proper preparation and execution of each project drawing production. 
  • Act as technical Designer and support Store Planner in peak periods. 

 

 

Operational:75% 

  • Based on the parameters given by the Project Managers & Store Planner, complete the preparation of preliminary store layouts, specifications and construction drawing sets, for all brands: (Aldo, Aldo Flagships, Aldo SIB (Small Is Beautiful), Aldo Acc., Aldo Acc. Elevated, Aldo Outlet, Aldo Shop-in-Shop, CIS, CIS Shop-in-Shop, CIS pop-up, Globo).  
  • Produce plans for new, renovation, minor and retrofit projects 
  • Prepare preliminary 3d model for designers when required. 
  • Ensure strong execution on all project coordination, ensure company standard are maintained. 

 

Leadership:15% 

  • Act as a subject matter expert for all technical aspect of construction and fabrication.  
  • Lead the technical phase for all projects in roll-out. 
  • Maintain and up-date software skills to gain accuracy, efficiency, agility & speed in project delivery (CAD, SketchUp). 
  • Promote store design and store planning structure, vision & spirit 
  • Actively participate at implementing uniform working protocols between DESIGN & CAD teams 
  • Develop & maintain solid business relationships with internal stakeholders & team members.  
  • Participate to one on one & team meetings to discuss key projects progress, goals, and other opportunities. 

 

DO YOU HAVE THE PROFILE WE'RE LOOKING FOR?

  • College degree in Architecture 
  • 5+ years in a commercial Design and or Architecture 
  • Experience in technical concept application in retail design 
  • Knowledge in commercial retail architecture and design 
  • IT skill and experience using computer aided design software 
  • Brand awareness and understanding of the retail market & assets 
  • Familiarity with all construction methodology 
  • Experience in construction is a plus.
  • Good team player, essential to be able to work in a team environment 
  • Capacity to undertake additional responsibilities pertaining to the work environment 
  • Excellent organizational and workload management skills. 
  • A blend of strong technical skills & artistic sensibility to ensure solutions are well engineered and in accordance with the design intent 
  • Strong decision-making skills. 

 

Don't wait any longer, apply now, we want to meet you!

WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT US? HERE ARE SOME FUN FACTS.

Present in more than 100 countries, the ALDO Group has established itself with strong brands: ALDO/ALDO Accessories, Call it Spring and Globo. Guided every day by its purpose “A journey to create a world of love, trust and belonging”, the organization is simply unique. What makes our culture so one of a kind is our people’s passion for innovation, excellence, craftsmanship, entrepreneurship and diversity, as well as their empathy and friendliness. In addition, our associates all have an insatiable curiosity!

 

Reporting directly to the CAD Team manager, the CAD Technician’s main responsibility is to work closely with the Project Managers, Designers and Store Planner to produce CAD drawings, from preliminary layouts to full construction sets for all store types (new, renovation and retrofit), for all brands of the Aldo Group (Aldo, Aldo Accessories, Aldo Outlet, Call it spring & Globo), worldwide (North America & International markets). The CAD technician role is to provide construction drawings and technical solutions that demonstrate design sensibility and a strong understanding of the store concept, site conditions and building code requirements.

  • Work in close collaboration with the Project Managers, Store Planner and Designers to produce technical drawings, full construction drawings set, and documentation aligned with the store concept, site conditions and building code requirements (when applicable), for AGNA & AGI markets. 
  • Provide technical solutions that demonstrate design sensibility and a strong understanding of the store concepts, for all banners,   
  • Ensure proper preparation and execution of each project drawing production. 
  • Act as technical Designer and support Store Planner in peak periods.

Elevated, Aldo Outlet, Aldo Shop-in-Shop, CIS, CIS Shop-in-Shop, CIS pop-up, Globo).  
  • Produce plans for new, renovation, minor and retrofit projects 
  • Prepare preliminary 3d model for designers when required. 
  • Ensure strong execution on all project coordination, ensure company standard are maintained.

  • Act as a subject matter expert for all technical aspect of construction and fabrication.  
  • Lead the technical phase for all projects in roll-out. 
  • Maintain and up-date software skills to gain accuracy, efficiency, agility & speed in project delivery (CAD, SketchUp). 
  • Promote store design and store planning structure, vision & spirit 
  • Actively participate at implementing uniform working protocols between DESIGN & CAD teams 
  • Develop & maintain solid business relationships with internal stakeholders & team members.  
  • Participate to one on one & team meetings to discuss key projects progress, goals, and other opportunities.

  • 5+ years in a commercial Design and or Architecture 
  • Experience in technical concept application in retail design 
  • Knowledge in commercial retail architecture and design 
  • IT skill and experience using computer aided design software 
  • Brand awareness and understanding of the retail market & assets 
  • Familiarity with all construction methodology 
  • Experience in construction is a plus.
  • Good team player, essential to be able to work in a team environment

title: Surveyor
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Surveyor is responsible for the management of all field site-specific surveying activities including providing layout and elevations so that all construction activity can be properly built with in the desired locations.

 

  • Prepare and maintain sketches, maps, reports, and legal descriptions of surveys in order to describe, certify, and assume liability for work performed
  • Plan and conduct ground surveys designed to establish baselines, elevations, and other geodetic measurements
  • Search legal records, survey records, and land titles in order to obtain information about property boundaries in areas to be surveyed
  • Verify the accuracy of survey data, including measurements and calculations conducted at survey sites
  • Direct or conduct surveys in order to establish legal boundaries for properties, based on legal deeds and titles
  • Calculate heights, depths, relative positions, property lines, and other characteristics of terrain
  • Prepare or supervise preparation of all data, charts, plots, maps, records, and documents related to surveys
  • Establish fixed points for use in making maps, using geodetic and engineering instruments
  • Determine longitudes and latitudes of important features and boundaries in survey areas, using theodolites, transits, levels, and satellite-based global positioning systems (GPS)
  • Compute geodetic measurements and interpret survey data in order to determine positions, shapes, and elevations of geomorphic and topographic features
Qualifications

  • Technical diploma or equivalent experience in geomatics
  • A minimum of 3 years experience in commercial building survey
  • Leadership training and safety certificates
  • Experience with Revit and Navisworks is an asset
  • Experience doing surveying for formwork company an asset
  • Technical diploma and/or Gold Seal certification are considered assets
  • Able to read and interpret drawings, schematics and plans
  • Experience using AutoCAD, Civil3D or Micro survey.
  • An advanced understanding of all construction trades and techniques
  • Travel to sites is required


Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, and work environment in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

title: Independent Field Surveyor
description:
Zip Code: L5N 2R5

Job ID: 3728

Standard Hours: 10-15

Compensation Range: 15

RetailData partners with the largest retailers in the world to provide competitive intelligence solutions. With consumers dynamically shifting their purchasing patterns between the various in-store and e-commerce sales channels, we are perpetually innovating new solutions and products to meet client needs. Our industry-leading expertise in price, assortment and promotional data sets, in conjunction with our expansive technology and analytics platforms, has positioned us perfectly to help retailers navigate these unprecedented retail changes.

Description:

Are you tired of being unsure how much your delivery/driver job will pay? Will the customer tip? We have a great side hustle job for you! Our jobs are preplanned with a flexible schedule, and the faster you get at the job the quicker you are in and out! Flexible when you go in and collect the work!

We provide detailed training to ensure you will achieve maximum efficiency in each store you will collect. You will control how much money you are able to collect per hour!

Great gig to earn extra money by working independently, good for anyone with flexible time to spare!

As a Store Scanning Specialist, you can enjoy the flexibility of choosing when and how much you earn. All you need is reliable transportation to start making money.



Why scan with RetailData?



Choose your own hours! When you work is totally up to you within our clients window

Easy to get started! We will provide detailed training

Earn extra money! Achieve your short-term goals or long-term collecting with RetailData

Make a guaranteed hourly minimum! (only for areas with wage floor)



Benefits:
  • Training to build speed and increase pay.
  • Ability to control what you earn.
  • Advanced notice of work schedule.
  • $400 referral bonus program.
  • As a part-time team member, you are offered identity theft protection, pet insurance, and 401k with match after 6 months and 750 hours worked.
  • Employee stock purchase after 1 year of service.
  • Independent, flexible work schedules that enable a healthy work-life balance.
  • Travel opportunities, locally and out of state.
  • Extra hours available in many areas.
  • Paid drive time and mileage reimbursement.

Come work for an essential business! We put an emphasis on A.R.T = A ccountability, R espect, T rust!

Requirements:
  • At least 18 years of age.
  • High school diploma, or equivalent.
  • Valid driver's license, clean driving record, reliable transportation, and valid automobile insurance.
  • Ability to work approximately 10 - 25 hours per week with scheduling flexibility.
  • Reliability to start and finish assignments on time with the detail needed to satisfy the project criteria.
  • Ability to stand throughout the work shift and lift up to 40 pounds intermittently.
  • Willingness to work in cold temperatures associated with grocery store refrigerator and freezer cases as some projects required collection of items in these store aisles.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: RetailData is committed to a policy of nondiscrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, or sexual orientation.

title: Intermediate /Senior Piping Designer
description:
Position Responsibilities:

We have an exciting opportunity for an Intermediate /Senior Piping Designer interested in joining our growing industry leading team. Join us and youâ€™ll carry out conceptual and detailed design of piping systems based on project specifications and engineering requirements for our various pharmaceutical clients and their facilities, where they develop life-saving products including Biologic, Vaccine, API (organic synthesis), oral (OSD) and parenteral (Aseptic) drug products. Our designs shape breakthrough strategies that yield the advantageous solutions to support each client's specific applications and business objectives. We identify opportunities to streamline production and maximize efficiency of facility operations using the latest in 3D & BIM modeling and virtual reality combined with our deep knowledge of industry trends, regulatory environments, and manufacturing processes.

 

You will prepare piping and equipment 3D models and 2D layouts and will apply in-depth knowledge in selection of piping components such as valves, flanges, piping supports, etc. You will produce piping plans, equipment layout, section views and other 2D drawings. You will prepare MTO and other project deliverables; will collaborate with other piping group team members effectively; will liaise with project engineers and disciplines leads for direction, coordination and feedback, and will participate in design review meetings and coordinate with other disciplines to resolve clashes and apply comments. Last, but not least you will use your great communication skills and technical expertise to mentor your team members, while also learning from those around you.

 

Come be part of a dynamic team that delivers world class designs for our pharmaceutical clients and take your career to new heights.

 

You will be working mainly from home (unless you prefer to work in our Vaughan office), but youâ€™ll have to be available to travel for occasional team meetings and site visits (around 5% of your time).

Qualifications & Requirements:
  • Technical or associate degree from an accredited college /university in engineering design (Mechanical preferred)
  • Excellent understanding of design principles related to piping and mechanical systems
  • Minimum 10 years of piping design experience; Pharmaceutical experience an asset
  • Proven experience with Plant 3D or other piping design software
  • In-depth knowledge of the design of piping systems for process and utility systems
  • Experience with piping iso drawings production
  • Excellent command of AutoCAD and drafting skills
  • Experience with Autodesk Navisworks and BIM 360
  • Proven team player, details oriented, able to work with minimum supervision and with strong time management skills; must be able to manage multiple projects at a time
  • Entrepreneurial spirit, displaying creativity and innovation by continually working to improve solutions, tools, methods and service delivery system

#li-gs1

Company Overview:

About Us

 

IPS-Integrated Project Services is a global leader in developing innovative and cost effective solutions for the engineering, construction, commissioning and qualification of complex pharmaceutical and biotech research and manufacturing facilities. With technical expertise spanning R&D to pilot-scale to large-scale production, our team specializes in the technology, trends and regulatory environment to successfully deliver capital projects and improve operations. For over thirty years, we have applied unique LEAN methodologies throughout the project life cycle, continually finding ways to do things better and more efficiently, delivering higher quality and controlling costs. Headquartered in Blue Bell, PA, IPS is a multi-national company with over 2,700 professionals worldwide and offices in United Stated, Brazil, Canada, China, Ireland, Singapore, Switzerland, Germany, United Kingdom and India. Visit our website at www.ipsdb.com.

 

Specialties

 

Process Architecture, Process Design, Engineering, Construction, Commissioning, Qualification, LEAN Project Delivery, Strategic Master Planning, Energy Conservation Management, Project Controls, Program/Project Management, Operations/Logistics Strategy and Planning, EPCMV and Staffing Services.

 

IPS is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer of protected veterans (M/F/D/V).

 

Attention Search Firms / Third Party Recruiters:   IPS is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for employment opportunities with IPS. Regardless of past practice, all resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at IPS via-email, the Internet or directly to hiring managers at IPS in any form without a valid written search agreement in place for a specific position will be deemed the sole property of IPS, and no fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by IPS as a result of the referral or through other means.

title: Chief Surveyor
description:
Chief Surveyor

Who we are

Englobe is distinguished by its wide range of services, its presence across Canada, its client satisfaction, and its customized approach with a wide range of services from consulting, turnkey project implementation and soil treatment facilities. Over the years, Englobe has acquired credibility and a reputation for people-centred values. DST Consulting Engineers Inc., a Division of Englobe, provides expert, innovative environmental and engineering consulting services - without surprises.

We offer
  • Full benefits package (group insurance with cost-sharing upon hiring, group RRSP after 3 months, the possibility of time banking)
  • Annual reimbursement of physical activity costs
  • Skills development opportunities
  • Reimbursement of travel expenses

As a Chief Surveyor, you will work in collaboration with the Instrumentation & Monitoring team.
Your main responsibilities will be:

  • Apply and promote Englobe’s health and safety rules.
  • Leading the Surveying team in carrying out daily monitoring/surveying activities.
  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures, safe work practices and work plans in a safe, efficient manner under all applicable regulatory requirements and contract specifications.
  • Coordinate and undertake planning and implementation of survey requirements to facilitate construction activities.
  • Maintain accurate survey records, documentation, and stamped submittal.
  • Generating deliverable documentation, including technical reports and letters, summaries, data sheets, graphs, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Work with field staff project needs to develop project-specific plans and documents.
  • Produce work plans in which objectives are clearly defined, and steps for achieving them are well detailed for project crews to follow.
  • Provide clients (internal and external) with efficient responses to inquiries.
  • Anticipate client needs and respond within a timely manner to each inquiry.
  • Monitor project and team performance. Forecast project outcomes and adjust where necessary to deliver successful project outcomes.
  • Manage client expectations and scope changes through active communication.
  • Identify and resolve client, project and/or team issues.
  • Performs various tasks, including analyzing proposed project solutions to ensure structural reliability, resource efficiency and cost-effectiveness.

Qualifications:

  • Diploma or Degree in Geomatics Engineering Technology, B.Sc. in Geomatics, or related discipline.
  • Must be an Ontario Land Surveyor (OLS) in good standing with the Association of Ontario Land Surveyors (AOLS).
  • 5+ years of previous project management experience, ideally within the engineering industry.
  • Active participation in the Ontario legal survey industry.
  • Ability to work effectively and competently with people at all levels in the organization; is a great team member.
  • Ability to work without supervision, effective time management and strong organizational skills.
  • Contribute to an ongoing culture of safety in all work environments.
  • Ability to work to deadlines and see tasks through to completion.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Previous consulting experience is an asset.
  • Valid provincial driver’s license required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

Englobe & DST adheres to employment equity and equal opportunity programs and encourages all women, visible minorities, Aboriginals, and disabled persons to apply.

Only selected candidates will be contacted.

How to apply
Please forward your resume and cover letter to humanresources@dstgroup.com, and please quote Job # 21-1207

title: Field Survey Technologist
description:
The opportunity

As a Field Survey Tech you will primarily work in the field under the direction of a Project Manager working on a wide range of projects from land development, topographic and rights-of-way surveys for infrastructure and capital works projects, construction and monitoring surveys, surveys on First Nation lands and many other diverse types of surveys.

Qualification & Requirements

Applicants should have experience in data collection in the field using a variety of tools including Data Collectors, Robotic Total Stations, GNSS rovers, and Drones in a land surveying business. Understanding of diligent legal survey evidence, searching and accurate, neat Field Notes is required.

  • Survey or Geomatics technology diploma;
  • Minimum 3 years work experience in a legal survey office environment;
  • Valid BC driverâ€™s license;
  • Familiarity with Civil 3D, Microsurvey, StarNet and Leica Infinity is an asset.

What we offer

  • Competitive compensation package (salary, bonus program, benefits package);
  • Ownership opportunity in the company
  • Diverse and interesting projects, working on talented multi-discipline teams;
  • Support for professional development;
  • Mentorship and collaboration with a great project management team;
  • Environment of continual improvement on processes;
  • Up-to-date equipment and software with new Drone program and interest in new technologies;

 

Interviews are happening now.

title: Project Technician/Construction Surveyor
description:
Location: Various Locations
Rotation: Various Rotations
Department: Operations

Key Areas of Responsibility:

In coordination with other crew members, the primary task of the Project Technician/Construction Surveyor will include the following during rehab, construction within an existing Transfer Station, and conveyor installation in the Conveyor Ramp:

  • Construction layouts for anchor bolt locations, grid lines, formwork, concrete piers, and footings in an underground environment
  • Surveying and checking for column plumbness with a total station during structural steel erection in an underground environment
  • Layout hanger locations
  • Layout and assist with alignment of overhead crane rails during installation
  • Mark up headings for rehab portion of scope
  • Perform routine check surveys to ensure precision and accuracy are maintained in mine survey data, control points, and survey stations are properly tied in
  • Establish new survey stations as required
  • Assist with creating red line mark ups during construction
  • Conduct routine survey reporting for underground construction and rehab
  • Prepare and implement processes and procedures
  • Assist QA/QC personnel when required
  • Assist in generating daily and weekly reports when required
  • Specify and order materials and supplies required for surveying
  • Other such duties as may be assigned

General Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Ensure full understanding and compliance with company policies and work in accordance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act and other local regulatory requirements
  • Have the authority and responsibility to maintain a safe and efficient working environment
  • Fully supports and actively participates in the team safety program based on culture and innovation
  • Ensure that any equipment deemed damaged or unsafe by virtue of a defect, or a machine of which any protection system is inoperative, is not used and communicated to the supervisor
  • Work closely with other crew members to create and maintain a synergy required to accomplish the shift line-up in the cycle
  • Ensure applicable procedures and work standards for all tasks are understood, adhered to and complied at all times for all such work
  • Maintain a high standard of housekeeping in the workplace
  • Utilize all safety systems as specified within the site safety management system

Pre-Employment Qualifications:

  • Pre-employment drug, alcohol and medical testing
  • Criminal Record Check
  • Mining Technician Diploma and experience with technical aspects of underground construction, mine surveying
  • Full Basic Underground Common Core
  • Minimum 3 years related underground mine surveying experience
  • Proficient with mine engineering programs such Mine Cad Software, AutoCAD, Total Station, and MOSS

Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:

  • WHMIS
  • Fall Arrest
  • Lifesaver TM-60 (self-rescuer)
  • High level of personal integrity
  • Knowledgeable of innovative technologies, such as Mine CAD Software, AutoCAD, Total Station and MOSS
  • Demonstrate organizational skills with strong oral and written communication abilities
  • Underground construction survey experience
  • Attention to detail
  • Must be able to work with little supervision in a remote environment; must be self-directed
  • Excellent written and verbal communication, organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Able to effectively prioritize workload to ensure deadlines are met
  • Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook

Supporting a Diverse and Inclusive Workforce

At Cementation Americas, we believe in diversity and inclusion. We recognize the benefits of a diverse and inclusive workforce and we strive to provide a work environment that is respectful to all employees. One of our core values as a company is giving employees every opportunity to succeed - this starts with treating everyone with dignity and respect and valuing the unique contribution of every employee.

We encourage applications from people of diverse backgrounds and candidates for employment will be assessed in a non-discriminatory manner. In addition to career development training, all employees are provided with diversity and inclusion training. As a team, we will continue to grow and learn together.

We offer a competitive compensation package for our employees, including a generous group benefits plan, and we are committed to providing training and development for all employees.


How to Apply:

Start your application today by following this link https://cementationjobs.applicantpool.com/jobs/. Alternatively resumes can be emailed to hrdepartment@cementation.com or faxed to 705-472-0078. When submitting your resume, please include relevant qualifications including, but not limited to, Ontario Common Core.

title: Summer Student, Architecture
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood is seeking a currently enrolled Summer Studentin Architecture from a recognized University. In this position you will be required to work within our Architectural team, remotely from home. The Student will plan, schedule and conduct technically architectural assignments under the supervision of senior architects and technologist.

 

We are looking for an enthusiastic student who enjoys working in an open and collaborative environment, with a team spread across geographical regions in Canada.

 

Key Responsibilities: 

  • Work closely with architects and senior technologist producing deliverables for a wide range of project types
  • Assist with coordinating design documents, proposals and reports with civil, architectural, structural, mechanical and electrical team
  • Assist architects and senior technologies in producing drawing packages in Revit BIM environment for conceptual, schematic, detailed design, and construction drawings that include, site plans, floor plans, demolition plans, renovation plans, roof plans, exterior elevations, interior sections, wall sections, details, schedules, etc.
  • Be self-starting, organized and deadline oriented
  • Ability to shift between projects
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities
  • Flexible to work on other duties that may be assigned

 

Skills / Qualifications

  • Student ofArchitectural Technology coupled with a minimum of 10 years relevant experience
  • Good understanding of the Canadian Building Codes and By-Laws
  • Proficiency in REVIT, AutoCAD and Microstation required
  • Working knowledge of MS Office packages, Projectwise, BIM 360 and Bluebeam will be an asset.
  • Good communication skills and fluent in English
  • Ability to work in design development, construction document and contract administration phases
  • Ability to read and interpret architectural, civil, structural, mechanical, electrical consultant’s documents and coordinate with minimal supervision
  • Strong organizational skills along with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and demonstrate a flexible approach to work assignments
  • Strong communication skills along with excellent interpersonal and organizational abilities
  • A willingness to work in a team environment with members located in different geographical regions
  • 2nd Year Bachelor of Architecture Student
  • ***This is a Summer Position, relocation assistance or living allowances will not be provided for this position.
  • ***Candidate is expected to work from home. 

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

The Student will plan, schedule and conduct technically architectural assignments under the supervision of senior architects and technologist.', 'Assist architects and senior technologies in producing drawing packages in Revit BIM environment for conceptual, schematic, detailed design, and construction drawings that include, site plans, floor plans, demolition plans, renovation plans, roof plans, exterior elevations, interior sections, wall sections, details, schedules, etc.', 'Flexible to work on other duties that may be assigned', 'Good communication skills and fluent in English', 'Strong organizational skills along with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and demonstrate a flexible approach to work assignments', 'Work closely with architects and senior technologist producing deliverables for a wide range of project types', 'Student ofArchitectural Technology coupled with a minimum of 10 years relevant experience', 'Working knowledge of MS Office packages, Projectwise, BIM 360 and Bluebeam will be an asset.', 'Strong communication skills along with excellent interpersonal and organizational abilities', '2nd Year Bachelor of Architecture Student', 'Good understanding of the Canadian Building Codes and By-Laws', '***Candidate is expected to work from home.', 'Be self-starting, organized and deadline oriented']

title: GIS CAD Technician
description:
JOB POSTING #:  2022-0173

POSTING PERIOD: Wednesday, May 4 at 8:30 AM to Tuesday, May 10, 2022 at 4:30 PM

DEPARTMENT: Infrastructure & Geomatics

UNION: C.U.P.E Local 543

JOB CODE: 543350

POSITION STATUS: Regular Full Time; Temporary Full-Time

# OF POSITIONS: 1 (RFT); 1 (TFT)

POSITION # 00003307

RATE OF PAY: $28.49 - $33.49 per hour

SHIFT WORK REQ'D: No

DUTIES:

  • Reporting to the GIS Supervisor, this position will carry out GIS CAD tasks as assigned, the preparation of computer-aided mapping and GIS layers and geo-databases, primarily using ESRI, along with AutoDesk and GeoCortex software. 
  • Other duties will include the development of an attributed street centerline, administrative boundaries, running and checking GIS topology and development of symbology, collecting, updating and analyzing GIS-related data.
  • The GIS CAD Technician will also be expected to: 
  • Source, acquire and collect materials for subject data, verify existing municipal data based on specifications provided, review and convert relevant available data sources, data entry of existing paper-based information, perform quality control checks on converted data, document specifications, procedures and/or completed work. Operate all office and computer equipment including printers, plotters and scanners. 
  • Work in a computerized Windows networked environment. 
  • Maintain amiable relations with co-workers and the public.
  • Perform other related office duties as assigned including deliveries.
  • Will perform Occupational Health & Safety duties as outlined in the Corporation’s Health and Safety Program. 
  • Will perform other related duties as required.                                                                                                                     

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must have a three (3) year Community College Diploma in one of the following disciplines: GIS Technology, Civil Technology or Planning Technology or related field or Ontario Ministry of Education equivalencies;
  • Must have over one (1) year of experience in GIS CAD software, such as ESRI suite, in a municipal civil engineering, planning, GIS or related environment;
  • Must have the ability to travel to offsite locations in a timely and expedient manner as required. If method of travel is by vehicle, a current, valid and lawful Driver’s Licence is required in accordance with the Highway Traffic Act and must provide a driver’s abstract as a condition of employment;
  • Must have a demonstrated proficiency in GIS CAD software and MS Access or a geo-database;
  • Must have proven proficiency or knowledge of the Windows Operating system in a networked environment, file management and data conversion;
  • Must be self-motivated, work with minimal supervision, be prepared to train in the use of new software, have proven verbal and written communication skills;
  • Must have proven organizational and time management skills;
  • Eligibility to obtain certification as a Technician with O.A.C.E.T.T., GIS professional recognized by GIS Certification Institute or other recognized professional organization will be considered an asset;
  • Successfully completing training in the Microsoft Suite of Products (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint) will be considered an asset;
  • Proficiency in the following software is considered an asset: ESRI Products (ArcGIS Server, GeoCortex), Adobe products (Acrobat, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc);
  • Knowledge of demonstrable GIS concepts and some GIS programming will both be considered an asset;
  • The physical demands analysis associated with this job indicates a sedentary to light level of work.                                                                                               

NOTE:

  • Only those applicants selected for an interview will be acknowledged
  • We offer a smoke-free office environment
  • Personal information is collected under the authority of the Municipal Act, c. 25 as amended, and will be used to determine eligibility for employment.

All City of Windsor employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment in accordance with the City’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy.

The Corporation of the City of Windsor is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, the City of Windsor will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities.  If selected to participate in the recruitment, selection and/or assessment process, please inform the City of Windsor Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.
