title: Junior AutoCAD Technician - Amico Corporation
description:
Junior AutoCAD Technician

Amico is looking for a Jr. AutoCAD Technician to join our team!  Responsibilities include but are not limited to creating 2D drawings using AutoCAD software, updating quotes, reviewing plans and specifications, and joining technical calls with clients.  1-2 years’ experience in AutoCAD, MS Word and Excel is required. This is a highly technical position with tremendous growth opportunities. Common sense is more valuable than educational accomplishments.

For more information, please visit us at www.amico.com.

 *We respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from agencies.

 *Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Piping Designer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood, the global engineering and consultancy organization, is seeking a Piping Designer to join our vibrant and growing team in ourCalgary and Edmoston offices.

 

The Projects team in Calgary  has a history of delivering some of the biggest projects in the Canadian Oilsands, with associated pipelines and refinery infrastructure, as well as a strong foothold in the energy transition supporting the rapidly growing decarbonization and

renewables industry.  

 

  • Join a culture of innovation, pushing the boundaries of what is possible to seek the best solutions for our clients.
  • Our teams are making it a priority to develop flexible working arrangements that balance client, team and individual needs.

 

Responsibilities: 

  • Create and develop 3D model using AutoPlant, CADWorx, Aveva and OpenPlant an assest
  • Experience Modeling Pipelines and CPF's
  • Drafting General Arrangement drawing
  • Creating Isometrics
  • Plant Layout drawings

 

Are you ready to join TEAM Wood?

 

 

Skills / Qualifications

  • Diploma in Process Piping Drafting
  • a Minimum of  2 years of experience in piping design and drafting
  • Proficiency witth Autoplant, CADWorx, Aveva, is considered a plus
  • Candidate will be required to live within commutable distance to Calgary

Additional skills required:

 

  • Good communication skills
  • Proficiency with MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)

 

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: DFT Methodology and CAD Engineer (Vancouver, Canada)
description:
Company:

Qualcomm Canada ULC




Job Area:

Engineering Group, Engineering Group > ASICS Engineering




General Summary:


Digital - Oversees definition, design, verification, and documentation for ASIC development for a variety of products. Determines architecture design, logic design, and system simulation. Defines module interfaces/formats for simulation. Evaluates all aspects of the process flow from high-level design to synthesis, place and route, and timing and power use. Analyzes equipment to establish operation data, conducts experimental tests, and evaluates results. Uses System tools, such as National Instrument (NI) products, LabVIEW, and MathWorks MATLAB, SIMULINK, VISIO and other toolboxes. Uses language such as HDL, C, PERL. Provides technical expertise for next generation initiatives.
Analog - Oversees definition, design, verification, and documentation for ASIC development for a variety of products. Determines architecture design and circuit specifications based on system level requirements. Is actively involved in all aspects of the design from system definition/simulation to circuit design and simulation. Heavy involvement in overseeing layout and silicon evaluation is also expected. Uses design tools such as Cadence ADE, MathWorks MATLAB and others. Provides technical expertise for next generation initiatives.




Minimum Qualifications:


• Bachelor's degree in Science, Engineering, or related field and 2+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience.

OR

Master's degree in Science, Engineering, or related field and 1+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience.

OR

PhD in Science, Engineering, or related field.






Preferred Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.
• 4+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience.
• 2+ years of experience with architecture and design tools.
• 2+ years of experience with scripting tools and programming languages.
• 2+ years of experience with design verification methods.
Principal Duties & Responsibilities:
• Uses tools/applications (i.e., Cadence, RTL Compiler, etc.) to execute the architecture and design of an individual block according to design protocol provided.
• Participates in developing an implementation strategy that meets system requirements and customer needs, occasionally relying on help from manager.
• Resolves architecture, design, or verification problems by applying sound ASIC engineering practices with minimal supervision.
• Owns the design and verification strategies of ASICs, SoC, and IP cores of a single block or IC Package.
• Writes tests and regressions to identify any bugs in own work and helps more junior team members do the same.
• Runs power checks on a single block to ensure it meets specifications provided by team lead.
• Interprets the results of performance checks and reports them to team lead.
• Provides ideas and furthers the innovation of ASICs, SoC, IP cores, and/or transistor level integrated circuits.
• Writes, reviews, and edits technical document in accordance with template requirements.
• Communicates directly with lead on any significant deviations from the Plan of Record for assigned block in a timely manner.
• Participates in design or project reviews and project meetings and supports these by providing team lead with progress on own related tasks.
• Provides input (i.e., timing, feasibility) on assigned tasks related to projects.
• Provides input on process improvement by identifying existing resources or work products that can be reused or applied to assigned tasks.
Additional responsibilities might include:
• Designs and implements test keys according to technology requirements.
• Uses modeling/simulation/layout tools to debug issues and help the development of competitive process technology modules.
• Develops and maintains databases for technology data mining and analysis.
Level of Responsibility:
• Working under some supervision.
• Making decisions that are moderate in impact; errors may have relatively minor financial impact or effect on projects, operations, or customer relationships; errors may require involvement beyond immediate work group to correct.
• Using verbal and written communication skills to convey information that may be somewhat complex to others who may have limited knowledge of the subject in question. May require basic negotiation and influence, cooperation, tact, and diplomacy, etc.
• Having a moderate amount of influence over key organizational decisions (e.g., is consulted by senior leadership to provide input on key decisions).
• Completing tasks with multiple steps that can be performed in various orders; some planning and prioritization must occur to complete the tasks effectively; mistakes may result in some rework.
• Exercising creativity to draft original documents, imagery, or work products within established guidelines.
• Using deductive and inductive problem solving; multiple approaches may be taken/necessary to solve the problem; often information is missing or incomplete; intermediate data analysis/interpretation skills may be required.
• May be solicited during strategic planning period.
The responsibilities of this role do not include:
• Financial accountability (e.g., does not involve budgeting responsibility).
Qualcomm is committed to hiring and supporting individuals with disabilities. Although this role has some expected physical activity, an inability to perform one or more of the listed physical requirements should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. We will work with you throughout the application and onboarding process to provide reasonable accommodations. Examples of expected physical activity include: frequently transporting between offices, buildings, and campuses up to ½ mile; frequently transporting and installing equipment up to 5 lbs.; performing tasks at various heights (e.g., standing or sitting); monitoring and utilizing computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day; and continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely.

























Applicants : If you need an accommodation, during the application/hiring process, you may request an accommodation by sending email to accommodationsupport

















To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies : Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.






If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers (http://www.qualcomm.com/contact/corporate) .



EEO Employer: Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or any other protected classification.

title: Engineering Technologist (Civil Drafter) - Intermediate
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

Why Join the IBI Family:

  • Our exhaustive practice covers the full spectrum of engineering services, from traditional projects to emerging technology-driven fields
  • You will be part of an elite team of engineers who are tightly connected to the other architectural, planning and systems experts within IBI Group as part of our “global intelligence/local knowledge” approach
  • You will be valued and given ample of opportunities for further business development within our very own IBI internal career path

Our Values:

  • Integrity – We do what is right
  • Partnerships – We work together
  • Excellence – We pursue design excellence
  • Innovation – We embrace ingenuity
  • Community – We build community
  • Environment – We take action on climate change

Most of the Things You’ll Work on:

  • The primary duty of the Engineering Technologist is to develop complex engineering drawings and be able to prepare designs and estimates from general instruction and/or preliminary sketches, diagrams or schematics, under minimal supervision
  • In addition, the role may recommend modifications and changes for design improvement and simplification and prepare working drawings from conceptual layouts to detailed finished products
  • Coordinate BIM/CADD projects with other discipline personnel, and prepare/assemble project deliverables, as well as, develop basic to mid-level designs/layouts, and prepare basic design calculations
  • This position requires effective time-management and the ability to work well within a team of BIM/CADD technicians and potentially providing technical guidance to less experienced design staff
Qualifications

You'll Need to Have:

  • A Civil Engineering Technology diploma, preferred (or equivalent)
  • Between 3 to 7 years of experience in structural engineering projects within private land development, government, institutional, infrastructure, commercial and/or industrial required
  • LRT/Rail projects and Water & Wastewater experience preferred
  • Current OACETT membership is an asset
  • Must be knowledgeable in basic construction practices for civil/structural fieldwork and have the ability to generate drawings for engineers and make suggestions for further development
  • Must be proficient in both Revit andAutoCAD
  • Must have BIM knowledge
  • MicroStation experience is preferable but not necessary (training will be provided)
  • Should be experienced with Microsoft Office programs
  • Excellent analytical and maths skills are a must
  • Must have effective written, communication, analytical, and interpersonal skills to be able to work well in teams


Additional Information

We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19 but when we do return to the office we're located at 175 Galaxy Boulevard in Toronto. 

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Similar positions/roles: Engineering Technician, Structural Drafter, Civil Technologist, Civil Drafter.  Similar projects: LRT/Rail projects and Water & Wastewater projects.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: CAD Technician
description:
About Houle Electric:

At Houle, we are passionate about building resilient communities. From airports, shipping terminals, and water treatment facilities, to hospitals, universities, and shopping centres, we deliver integrated electrical solutions for our industrial, commercial, institutional and residential customers.

While we are leaders in electrical construction, we also specialize in a wide range of in-house technology solutions, including audio visual, building automation, healthcare systems, network systems, and security and life-safety. As a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, we take pride in our talented people and collaborative culture that bring our client's vision to life.

About the position:

Houle's Project Planning Services department is looking for a CAD Technician to join the team. Our planning department specializes in designing and creating installation drawings from engineering construction documents, to the field stage for installation. This encompasses many electrical systems such as distribution infrastructures, wall elevations, branch power & lighting, fire alarm, and technology systems such as structured cabling, nurse call, and security.

Based out of Kelowna, the Project Planning Services team supports our large Design Build projects across the province, ranging from large residential, office high rises to major hospitals.

As a CAD Technician, your responsibilities would be to support and work closely with our electrical planners to provide CAD assisted drafting. This entails producing a wide range of 2D drawings including, Schematics, build details, templates, technical drawing manipulation, dynamic block design, single line drawings, hand sketches to line layouts, as-builts, dimensioning, equipment layouts, section cuts, process feedback and collaboration.

Not only will you get to operate within CAD, but we also hope that you will take on the challenge of learning some base electrical planning with the close guidance of our planners.

Duties and responsibilities:

The incumbent would be responsible for working with our project planning services team to:

  • Work side by side with our planners to create drawings within CAD, on electrical products, such as Conduit racks, distribution equipment, light fixtures, and in wall devices.
  • Develop drawings using design information provided from hand sketches, Bluebeam and CAD including system line diagrams, floor plans, and elevations

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and attributes:

  • Relevant Education
  • 1+ years of AutoCAD software application experience
  • Revit experience would be an asset
  • Experience with document control
  • Capable of working side by side with planners to adjust detailing
  • Experience in architectural drafting an asset
  • Experience with reviewing and navigating through typical construction drawings
  • Knowledge of Electrical materials and methods is an asset
  • Thorough understanding and efficiency with drafting standards
  • Strong organizational and prioritizing skills with the ability to take initiative
  • Energetic, flexible, problem solving mindset

Culture is important at Houle. You must be collaborative in nature. You are a solution focused team player and always willing to learn. You are a bright, ambitious, honest, and a straight forward professional. Your personable nature will fit well within the friendly working environment.

The compensation for this position will be commensurate with experience. Houle offers an exciting, enjoyable work environment, competitive benefits package as well as a competitive incentive plan and many company sponsored events.

To apply, please visit https://www.houle.ca/current-career-opportunities/ and click on the listing for "CAD Technician". Opportunity will remain open until filled.

For the interview process, please be prepared to showcase your portfolio. Testing may also be required.

*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

title: Leak Survey Technician - Markham
description:
• Full-time permanent position. Monday-Friday
  • Entry-level
  • Competitive hourly rate ($18.58 starting wage) with regularly scheduled opportunities for performance-based raises and bonuses
  • Exceptional health benefits, including for family
  • Defined contribution pension plan and employee assistance program
  • Company cell phone provided
  • Company car provided for work only, which you can park at home
  • Work independently outdoors

Wouldn’t it be great to find a company that will give you a chance to prove yourself, and grow a career quickly?

Look no further. G-Tel is hiring and training new Leak Survey Technicians to complete jobs in and around your area. The G-Tel family includes multiple growing companies providing electrical distribution infrastructure, energy and power generation services.

 

In this role, you will:

  • Receive full 3 - 4 weeks’ training
  • Receive assignments and routes to follow each day
  • Use state of the art equipment (including infra-red and flame ionization) to examine buried gas lines, and detect/report buried gas leaks.
  • Prepare reports and documentation that based on your work
  • From there, your reports will go to the people who repair the leaks, so they can make sure the gas lines stay in good working order.

 

Qualifications

  • Have experience, or would definitely enjoy, working outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Be physically fit and able to walk frequently (up to 20-25km/day), sit in a vehicle, and lift/carry up to 20 lbs
  • Be able to visually distinguish colours
  • Have a valid Ontario “G” class driver’s license and be able to produce a clean drivers abstract
  • Have a high school diploma
  • Be willing to obtain and wear CSA approved steel toe safety boots
  • Be willing to undergo and successfully clear a criminal background check
  • Willingness to work weekends and overtime is an asset, but not required
  • Have general computer knowledge (browser, email, Microsoft Office)

Note: Proof of COVID vaccination is not required.

title: Intermediate Drafter
description:
• Produce overhead/underground electrical and civil design drawings in AutoCAD Map3D, and Civil 3D under the guidance of a Senior Electrical Engineer and/or Senior Drafting
Manager
• You will understand and apply electrical and civil standards while drafting designs.
• Will review third-party drawings such as civil, architectural, landscape, and onsite electrical for conflicts and information as required by the project.
• Ensure the accuracy and availability of filed drawings through proper filing (electronic and paper)
• Enter power distribution designs into AutoCAD and/or GIS mapping systems using accurate drafting and electrical standards
• Ability to receive new drafting requests, assign them to team members, and submit them upon completion
• Communicate with customers, stakeholders, and project team members




Advantages
Competitive compensation package including, competitive salaries, bonuses, Health & Dental Benefits, Health Care Spending Account, flexible work schedules, paid vacation, Company Matching RRSP, flex days.

Responsibilities
Strong collaborative skills
Exceptional organizational skills and the ability to autonomously manage workload to control multiple tasks with a very high degree of accuracy, while meeting project deadlines
Excellent computer skills including AutoCAD, Microstation (optional), MS Office and related products


Qualifications
Engineering Technology Diploma or Computer Aided Drafting Engineering Technology Certificate or Diploma from a recognized college preferred

Summary
If you think you could be exactly who we are looking for, please reach out directly to us today! This position will not be available for long!
We thank all applicants for applying. Only those who are qualified will be contacted for an interview.


Apply via this application link.

Register on our website at Randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Junior or Intermediate Architectural Designer
description:
Junior or Intermediate Architectural Designer
Calgary, Alberta
Competitive Salary + Benefits
Architecture and Design firm

Other titles: Designer, Design Architect, Architectural Designer, Intermediate Architectural Designer, Intern Architect, Design Specialist

OUR CLIENT
An excellent opportunity exists with a leading Architecture, Design & Planning firm for a talented, creative and motivated Architectural Designer to join their Calgary office. With a focus on collaboration, quality design and excellent service delivery, this firm have a strong reputation and some high profile projects across North America.

THE JOB
As an Architectural Designer, you will be involved in the following:
  • Work with Senior staff to develop a wide range ofarchitectural designs in collaboration with clients and design teams, that meet quality parameters, project timelines and budgetary requirements
  • Gain familiarity with current design trends, building systems and presentation techniques to improve skills and implement them on project work
  • Prepare drawings, models and renderings, following office standards
  • Prepare and coordinate presentation materials to ensure project documentation is complete and accurate
  • Perform programming, code research, material and building systems research, site surveys and field reviews, laying out program components and calculating program and building areas
  • Work collaboratively with design and production team as well as project leadsassist the coordination the design through all phases of the project
  • Other architectural tasks as required
WHAT'S REQUIRED
To be considered for this role, you shouldhavethe following skills, qualificationsand experience:
  • Have successfully completed an architectural related post-secondary education - a bachelor of Architecture or diploma in Architectural Technology / other.
  • Possess at least 3 years' experience working with Architectural Design, with at least 2 years coming from within North America
  • Be proficient in design and rendering skills, i.e. Revit, AutoCAD, SketchUp and Photoshop; other programs an asset
  • Have experience in architectural design presentation
  • Have some familiarity withMechanical, Electrical, and Structural permits and building codes
  • Possess superior time management, communication and problem solving skills
  • Demonstrate an ability to coordinate with other team members and to collaborate with other professional disciplines
WHAT TO DO NOW
If you believe this position could be the perfect fit for you, click apply/ We thank allcandidates for their applications, however, only those who meet the requirements of theposition above with becontacted.

Keywords: Architectural Designer, Calgary, Designer, Design Lead, Alberta, Design Architect

title: CAD Technologist
description:
GeoVerra is in acceleration mode. Our growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your GeoVerra career will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

You GeoVerra

Our leaders at GeoVerra set the standard for our company, and the industry. We look for the bestâ€”adaptable managers and professionals with a deep understanding of surveying with an array of projects, challenges and successes under their belt who are always striving for more.

Our new CAD Technologist will be located at one of the following British Columbia office locations: Langley, Kelowna, Victoria, Cranbrook, Invermere or Fort St. John.  Our new CAD Technologist will lead by example: Professional. Positive. Productive. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with excellent communication skills. New ideas or creative flow is important tooâ€”hit us with the strategies or suggestions that makes our team operate even better. Weâ€™re passionate about learning every day and being impactfulâ€”and our leaders reflects that in their daily work.

Responsibilities:

  • Produce and maintain survey plans, industrial plans, civil plans, photo mosaics, record drawings and the collection, analysis, storage, distribution and application of spatial and three-dimensional data used in land development. 
  • Ensure that assignment requirements are understood and what the time allocations are to complete the assigned tasks. 
  • Self-check assignments prior to drawings being given to the CAD Team Lead for final approval.
  • Adhere to current CAD standards and provide feedback as required.
  • Adhere to the use of current departmental check sheets and work flow procedures.
  • Ensure drawings meet client timelines and deliverables.
  • CAD Technologist additional roles:
  • Assist in the development of CAD standards and procedures.
  • Support the CAD Team Lead in coordinating and mentoring junior staff regarding CAD standards and accuracy requirements.

Qualifications:

  • Diploma or Degree in Geomatics Engineering Technology, Engineering Design & Drafting Technology, Civil Engineering Technology, or related discipline; or certification in related CAD courses.
  • Member in good standing or eligible for registration with local Survey or Technologist Association is preferable.
  • An understanding of CAD requirements on various surveying projects.
  • Intermediate CAD Technologist: 4-6 years direct related experience.
  • Proficient in Windows; MS Word and other Microsoft Office applications. Experienced in the use of the latest versions of AutoCAD, Civil 3D and Coordinate Geometry software.
  • Knowledge of civil engineering design components, alignments, grading, volumes and site construction works.
  • Contribute on an on-going basis toward maintaining a safe working environment both for yourself and for those working with you or in your close vicinity.
  • Ability to work to deadlines and see tasks through to completion.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Good analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Must be able to import data and create plans of survey.
  • Must maintain a strong technological base and be able to maintain a high level of production.
  • Ability to work without supervision; effective time management and strong organizational skills.
  • Adaptable and able to think outside the box.
  • Ability to support and mentor/teach other members of the team.

What GeoVerra can offer you:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Comprehensive benefits coverage, vacation, wellness days, and RRSP matching contributions
  • Tools and services to support your mental wellness
  • Flexible workplace program to suit your needs
  • Work-life balance
  • Growth and advancement opportunities
  • Paid professional dues
  • Continuing education and professional development
  • Use of leading-edge technology and equipment
  • Diverse projects and a fast-paced working environment
  • Support to the communities we live and work in

The Partnership Promise

This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Junior Cad Designer (f/m/d)
description:
Descrizione Gruppo

 

Con oltre 120 anni di esperienza nella produzione di auto e un’ampia gamma di servizi, Magna Steyr è leader tra i partner indipendenti degli OEM in ambito ingegneristico e produttivo a livello mondiale.

La nostra vasta gamma di servizi copre i vari gruppi di prodotti sia nell’ambito dei Servizi di Ingegneria - dai sistemi e moduli alla completa ingegneria dei veicoli – sia nella Produzione del Veicolo Completo, dove offriamo soluzioni flessibili a livello mondiale dalla produzione di nicchia a quella in serie. Finora, Magna Steyr ha prodotto più di 3,7 milioni di veicoli, di 29 modelli diversi.

Magna Steyr è il produttore automobilistico su commessa ideale a livello mondiale per la produzione di veicoli con motori convenzionali, ibridi ed elettrici, in alcuni casi, tutti sulla stessa linea di produzione. Questo dimostra ulteriormente l'esperienza come fornitore automobilistico nell'elettrificazione e nell'elettro mobilità.

 

Sommario

 

Se ti piacciono le auto, sei attratto dalla progettazione meccanica, hai voglia di lavorare in progetti con team internazionali e multi-localizzati, abbiamo la possibilità di proporti un percorso di professionale come CAD Designer all’interno del nostro dipartimento di Engineering.

Responsabilitá

 

In affiancamento a colleghi senior e con un sempre maggiore livello di autonomia, ti occuperai di:

  • Definizione completa di modelli 3D con rispetto di fattibilità del componente dal lato geometrico e dal lato tecnologico.
  • Garantire il rispetto dei tempi di realizzazione definiti dal Responsabile di progetto in accordo con Timing di progetto.
  • Assicurare la completezza e correttezza dei dati rilasciati

Imparerai a:

  • Utilizzare CAD 3D per realizzare i modelli matematici per i progetti.
  • Effettuare analisi di fattibilità realizzativa, definizione dei tempi e costi.
  • Metodologia di realizzazione dei modelli matematici e gestione degli stessi tramite l’utilizzo di Data Base

Competenze richieste

 

Sono richieste le seguenti competenze:

  • Diploma di perito meccanico o in ambito tecnico/scientifico. Gradita laurea in ingegneria meccanica, dell’autoveicolo o in design industriale
  • Gradita conoscenza di base di tools di progettazione CAD
  • Gradita esperienza di 1-2 anni come progettista CAD 3D
  • Conoscenza del pacchetto Office
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese (scritta e parlata)
  • Passione per la auto
  • Predisposizione all’apprendimento di nuove tecnologie e nuovi metodi di lavoro
  • Disponibilità a effettuare trasferte lavoro in Italia, EU e resto del mondo.

Informazioni aggiuntive

 

Se sei interessato in questa opportunitá inviaci il tuo curriculum vitae e la tua lettera di presentazione.

title: Drafter
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview

The Drafter will be involved in developing production drawings for various standard and custom concrete products, including pipe and precast components.  

Responsibilities

  • Prepare shop drawings for various pipe products
  • Work with sales staff and project managers to develop production drawings from tender documents
  • Work with production staff to ensure drawings are interpreted properly
  • Look for ways to save production materials, money, etc. while developing drawings
  • Look for and resolve errors in drawings
  • Deal with and solve problems in an effective manner
  • Carry out scheduled ground maintenance work
  • Perform several types of manual work
  • Handle materials, tools and equipment
  • Property maintenance
  • Operate automotive vehicles when required
  • Operate weed eater
  • Assist with general pit clean up 

Qualifications

  • High School Diploma
  • Currently enrolled in Engineering or related program
  • Knowledgeable in AutoCAD 
  • Proven experience using AutoCAD to develop production drawings
  • Demonstrates a strong commitment to safety
  • Excellent communication skills and works well in a team environment
  • Ability to work independently

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Junior Piping Designer - (Job Number: EDM01B9)
description:
Junior Piping Designer

Company: Worley
Primary Location: CAN-AB-Edmonton
Job: Piping<
Schedule: Full-time
Employment Type: Employee
Job Level: Entry Level<
Job Posting: Apr 20, 2022
Unposting Date: May 21, 2022
Reporting Manager Title: Piping Department Manager

48,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.
Wersquo;re not just engineers. Wersquo;re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers andinnovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals andresources get one step closer to solving our planetrsquo;s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition.Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.


Whatever your ambition, therersquo;s a path for you here. And therersquo;s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com

Purpose
Under supervision within the piping discipline, you will assist in the delivery of design and drafting services to Worley and its customers.
Responsibilities
  • Under supervision you will:
    • deliver piping specific design and drafting services that meet Worley, the customer#39;s and applicable statutory and regulatory requirements
    • perform design and drafting assignments on projects while meeting project requirements on time and within budget
    • identify and report changes to project scope
    • prepare engineering drawings and documentation.
  • Communicate effectively with the piping team and project stakeholders
  • Establish and maintain good working relationships within Worley
  • Identify issues and problems and ask for assistance when required
What you will bring
Technical and Industry Experience
  • Developing technical and practical design and drafting skills in the piping discipline in the same or similar industry
  • Developing skills in design software
  • Competent use of relevant software such as MS Office Suite
Education acirc;euro;ldquo; Qualifications, Accreditation, Training
Required:
Completed or undertaking recognised and relevant design courses

What we offer you
Providing our people with an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.

Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.

If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it#39;s time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.

title: Field Survey Technician
description:
Role Overview
McElhanney Ltd. has a rewarding opportunity for an individual to join our team as a Field Survey Technician to join our team in Courtenay, B.C. This position requires a motivated, highly productive person to lead a busy survey crew carrying out legal, topographic, and construction layout surveys.

The successful candidate will work within a team on a variety of legal and topographic surveys for Land Development, municipal infrastructure, and construction projects. In this role you will work alongside experienced survey technicians under supervision of a BC Land Surveyor. Our team offers a welcoming culture which allows staff to learn, grow, and build meaningful relationships. Most importantly, we have nurtured a fun and family like environment, making McElhanney a workplace where our staff choose to grow long-term careers. In addition, we have established programs that support the growth of our future leaders. We have built and sustained a reputation of taking great care in developing our people and fostering a positive, friendly, and rewarding work environment.
 
For additional information on Vancouver Island, visit our customized Vancouver Island careers page

 Responsibilities 

  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety and policy compliance.
  • Interpret field data in order to create accurate survey drawings and legal plans, which will include downloading and editing field data, interpreting field notes and sketches, and processing conventional and GPS data.
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time.
  • Manage flow of information between field and office, and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations.
  • Perform on-site liaison between Project Manager and client/contractor as required.
  • Implementing and ensure quality assurance on all field returns.
  • Maintain, test, calibrate and adjust survey equipment as needed.
  • Work with Project Manager for performance of office tasks.
  • Coordinate the preparation of documents and applications required for regulatory approvals.

Requirements
  • 2-year technical diploma in Geomatics with 0 - 5 years’ previous experience in a similar role; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Physically fit, able to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas, and willing to work in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours.
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset.
  • Valid driver’s license;
  • Periods of travel may be required for the role.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching.
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave.
  • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan.
  • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable.
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all.
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth.
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone.


This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.


Vaccination Requirement

 In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others.  This position requires that the successful candidate is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and as such, proof of vaccination will be required prior to the first day of employment. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation. 

About McElhanney

Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

#LI-JUNIOR #LI-AM3  #LI-HYBRID
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: CAD Designer
description:
About US

In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts.  Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23 navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.

The Job

The CAD Designer supports development of mechanical and electrical concepts, packaging design or redesign of OSI consoles, racks and IBS systems. The CAD Designer is expected to deliver accurate 3D models and 2D drawings.  

Responsibilities:
  • Develop 3D models and 2D drawings suitable for manufacturing
  • Interface with Electrical, Mechanical, Manufacturing and Systems Engineers for design development
  • Level 1 Check of drawings for accuracy and compliance with OSI practices
  • Support preparation of procedures and work instructions for product fabrication
  • Create conceptual drawings and renderings for Sales Proposals
  • Follows workplace operating and environmental, health and safety procedures and guidelines
  • Support preparation, development and sustainment of CAD Operation Team standards, work instruction and operational procedures
You Bring:
Education: 2 or 3 year college diploma with technical training in 3D modeling drafting
Experience: 4 to 7 years of experience
Experience with the following is desirable:
  • Competent with application of Solidworks modeling tools and AutoCAD
  • Familiarity with electrical drawings
  • Working knowledge of ASME Y14 Engineering drawing practices
  • Design for assembly and manufacturing.
  • Manufacturing processes for sheet metal, machined and welded parts.
  • Familiarity with naval platform environment is an asset

Why OSI?

We have a Professional Development program in place that supports our employees in their career development by providing funds, time, and opportunities to become better at what they do.

At OSI you can make a difference. We are a change willing organization that is always looking for new ideas. We strive to improve what it is we do and how we do it. If you have ideas we would love to hear about them.

OSI fosters an inclusive and diverse culture. We celebrate our diversity and strive to be more inclusive because it makes us a better company.

We also offer great benefits: 
  • Extended healthcare 
  • Dental care
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Emergency Travel Assistance
  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
skills: ['Extended healthcare', 'Dental care', 'Create conceptual drawings and renderings for Sales Proposals', 'Working knowledge of ASME Y14 Engineering drawing practices', 'Follows workplace operating and environmental, health and safety procedures and guidelines', 'Develop 3D models and 2D drawings suitable for manufacturing']

title: Drafting Technician
description:
Overview

Term: 12 Months

 

Reporting to the Manager, Electrical Engineering, the Drafting Technician is responsible for managing CADDDD related archive documentation within Plant Ops. This work includes integration of information for new buildings, changes created by recent renovations, in-house produced/available drawings, and drawings produced by various consultants for this purpose. The incumbent is also responsible for the retrieval of electronic files and print production in timely fashion in support of University activities. The materials stored include all drawings, manuals, agreements, and contracts required either by law or for operational supporting the entirUWUW campus with over eight million square feet of space supporting state of the art teaching and ground breaking research.

Responsibilities will align with the Plant Operations goal of contributing towards providing a safe and accessible, invitingly clean and comfortable, functionally-enriched and well-maintained campus environment through service excellence.

Responsibilities

Management of As-built CADD infrastructure drawings

  • Proposes, implements, and maintains structure of as-built CADD documentation in support of Design & Construction Services and other organizational units within the Plant Operations
  • Surveys existing site conditions, takes measurements and/or records information related to structures & base building equipment and sets up new drawing sets if no existing drawings exist
  • Evaluates the accuracy of existing information (conflicting historical sets might exist) and integrates information into existing documents
  • Reviews old materials and decides which are obsolete and safely discards old documentation (printed and electronic format). Coordinates directly with engineers and technologists as part of an integrated multidisciplinary project team at all stages, from concept design to final commissioning
  • Supports all divisions within Plant Operations in retrieving CADD documents in support of procurement documents for various projects (consultants/contractors/etc.)
  • Supports all operating team in managing access or retrieving CADD drawings required for projects, maintenance initiative and strategic analysis
  • Maintains proficiency in the use of current versions of Computer Aided Design and Drafting (CADD) software used in the department
  • Serves as the subject area expert and provides CADD support to the Design & Construction team
  • Provides prints of various CADD documents as requested by Senior Administration and various divisions within Plant Operations

CADD & BIM

  • Prepares drawing sets for special projects as directed by the supervising manager
  • Represents Plant Operations as the Building Information Model (BIM) specialist, converts BIM files into CADD drawings as required, and guides the project team in development of BIM LODs as required for contract documentation

Mechanical & Electrical systems

  • Surveys existing site conditions, takes measurements and/or records site information on existing drawings
  • Consolidates site information and old drawings to ensure that record drawings are accurate and available for Plant Ops staff on request
  • Evaluates accuracy of information on existing drawings and ensures that all as-build documentation is accurate
  • Receives, reviews, and integrates drawings prepared by various consultants and integrates materials into record drawings

Other

  • Performs other related duties and responsibilities as assigned and supports departmental initiatives

Qualifications

  • Post-secondary education, preferably within engineering or architectural technology or equivalent
  • Minimum 3 years’ experience working in the building construction industry preparing drawings and managing documentation
  • Experience in institutional projects is preferred
  • Excellent proficiency utilizing AutoCAD
  • Sound understanding of BIM and REVIT
  • Excellent understanding of drawing conventions and industry standards
  • Understanding of the building code, fire code, and ASHRAE is an asset
  • Training in the maintenance of fire extinguishers, fire suppression systems, and fire alarm systems is an asset
  • Experience with various Geographical Information Systems (GIS) is an asset
  • Intermediate proficiency with various MS office applications
  • Exemplary organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Proven ability to effectively manage multiple priorities
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a deep commitment to customer service
  • Ability to exercise prudent judgement and high level of confidentiality
  • Regular working hours, with some evening/weekend work required
  • May be required to travel to satellite campuses

Vaccination Requirement Statement

Effective May 1, 2022, the University suspended its Vaccination Requirement. Prior to May 1, pursuant to this Requirement, all University employees were required to submit proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 (subject to the University’s obligations under the Human Rights Code to accommodate employees who were unable to receive a vaccination). The University’s Vaccination Requirement website can be found here: https://uwaterloo.ca/coronavirus/return/vaccination-requirement.   

 

The pandemic is ongoing and public health advice continues to evolve. Accordingly, the University reserves the absolute right to reinstate the Vaccination Requirement on short notice, and upon such reinstatement you will be required to comply. You shall also be required to comply with any new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University from time to time, including new policies/requirements related to mandatory employee vaccination. As the University may need to reinstate the Requirement on short notice, it will continue to collect and maintain up-to-date information on employee vaccination status. Please submit your Covid-19 vaccine status (QR code) to: https://checkin.uwaterloo.ca/   

 

Failure to comply with the Vaccination Requirement if it is reinstated, including failure to comply with any future amendments to the Vaccination Requirement, or failure to comply with new health and safety policies/requirements implemented by the University, including those related to new mandatory employee vaccination, shall result in discipline up to and including termination of employment.

 

The requirement to be vaccinated, if reinstated, will be subject to the duty to accommodate pursuant to the Human Rights Code. If you are unable to be vaccinated for reasons related to a ground protected under the Human Rights Code, you may submit a written request for accommodation with an explanation of the reasons and/or any supporting documentation. If you request accommodation, the University may follow up with you for further information if necessary.

Equity Statement

The University of Waterloo is committed to implementing the Calls to Action framed by the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. We acknowledge that we live and work on the traditional territory of the Neutral, Anishinaabeg and Haudenosaunee peoples. The University of Waterloo is situated on the Haldimand Tract, the land granted to the Six Nations that includes six miles on each side of the Grand River.

 

The University values the diverse and intersectional identities of its students, faculty, and staff. The University regards equity and diversity as an integral part of academic excellence and is committed to accessibility for all employees. The University of Waterloo seeks applicants who embrace our values of equity, anti-racism and inclusion.  As such, we encourage applications from candidates who have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including applicants who identify as First Nations, Métis and/or Inuit/Inuk, Black, racialized, a person with a disability, women and/or 2SLGBTQ+.

 

All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

 

The University of Waterloo is committed to accessibility for persons with disabilities. If you have any application, interview, or workplace accommodation requests, please contact Human Resources at hrhelp@uwaterloo.ca  or 519-888-4567, ext. 45935.

description:

1.Exceptional attention to detail
2.Process oriented
3.Strong communication skills
4.Excellent organization capability
Desirable criteria:

title: CAD Engineer
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a CAD Engineer for our Regina location.

CAD Engineers are competent technical people who have demonstrated a knowledge of manufacturing concepts and have skills with 2D and 3D CAD. CAD Engineers are responsible for detailing and simple design tasks. This is both a great learning opportunity for young engineers and technologists as well as a place for senior CAD people to deliver value to the customers by creating and maintaining CAD files and CAD Standards.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Use 3D CAD to detail products and make simple design changes.
  • Use a combination of 2D CAD and other tools to document overall system designs.
  • Focus on DFx, i.e. Design For Manufacturability, Serviceability, Reliability, Affordability, etc.
  • Produce engineering deliverables that meet Quality, Cost and Schedule requirements.
  • Seek continuous improvement in engineering activities, and communicate these to your supervisor.
  • Learn and be mentored by some of the best design engineers and technologists in the province.

  • Professional Engineer or Technologist
  • Experience in machine design and 3D CAD
  • Good communication skills — written and verbal
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • Excellent work ethic

title: Drafter
description:
Your Employer:

Dare to join Englobe

 

Englobe, and itâ€™s more than 2,600 people, concerned about the environment daily, engaged in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage the quality and integrity of assets.

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.

 

We offer

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);

  • a telemedicine virtual health care service;

  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage teleworking.

Englobe is currently looking for a Drafter for its Kitchener, Ontario office.

Dare to join Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.

Your Contribution:

 

  • Produce drawings based on engineering and field sketches;
  • Utilize PDFs and CAD drawings from others for use as base drawings in our site and location plans;
  • Set-up and download handheld GPS units;
  • Experience in gINT Software for drafting borehole logs;
  • Prepare logs for boreholes, monitoring wells and test pits;
  • Prepare figures, charts and graphical representations of laboratory and field test results;
  • Prepare geologic cross-sections and isopach mapping;
  • Import borehole locations into Google Earth borehole database;
  • Manage requests from multiple project managers;
  • Other related tasks.
Your Profile:

 

  • Diploma in AutoCAD Drafting or in a related field;
  • Approximately  2 years of relevant experience;
  • Excellent knowledge of AutoCAD and Civil 3D, 2014 to latest version;
  • Experience with Geotec software (asset);
  • Experience with gInt 8i (asset)
  • Experience with Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access (asset);
  • Ability to read technical plans;
  • Detail-oriented and organized.

title: Survey Technician
description:
Survey Technician

Who we are

Englobe is distinguished by its wide range of services, its presence across Canada, its client satisfaction, and its customized approach with a wide range of services from consulting, turnkey project implementation and soil treatment facilities. Over the years, Englobe has acquired credibility and a reputation for people-centred values. DST Consulting Engineers Inc., a Division of Englobe, provides expert, innovative environmental and engineering consulting services - without surprises.

We offer 
 
  • Full benefits package (group insurance with cost-sharing upon hiring, group RRSP after 3 months, the possibility of time banking)
  • Annual reimbursement of physical activity costs
  • Skills development opportunities
  • Reimbursement of travel expenses
  • Flextime and the possibility of a compressed schedule

We are currently seeking a Survey Technician to work out of our office in Waterloo, ON.

Responsibilities:
  • Perform job site surveys and instrumentation monitoring of civil engineering structures, building, utilities, roadways, railway tracks, and bridges 
  • Install building, surface and in-ground survey monitoring points and other types of structural and geotechnical instrumentation at job sites.
  • Perform high-precision control surveys and baselines.
  • Complete calculations for structure and ground movement in the field and using data collector software.
  • Produce survey reports for Clients and construction project teams
  • Perform all aspects of construction and site surveying including layout, as-built, topographic, quantity, slope staking, grade staking, and various underground utility staking.
  • Work with another crewmate with a team mentality to produce a product and summary reports catered to the client's needs. Ensure crew members are working in a safe environment. 
  • Manage and maintain survey equipment and instruments, survey data, and records
  • Perform pre-and post-construction condition surveys and assist with noise & vibration monitoring operations.

Qualifications:
  • Diploma of Collegial Studies or Degree in Surveying and Geomatics / Construction / Civil / Geotechnical / Engineering Geology
  • Minimum 2 years of experience dealing with road/highway construction.
  • In-depth knowledge of highway/structure surveying procedures.
  • Solid geometry/mathematical background.
  • Good knowledge of data collector software - Trimble Access & Survey Pro.
  • Competent with Trimble & Leica total stations and GPS.
  • Valid driver's licence.
  • Valid First Aid Level C-CPR & AED.
  • Ontario Land Surveyors license is considered an asset.

Englobe & DST adheres to employment equity and equal opportunity programs and encourages all women, visible minorities, Aboriginals, and disabled persons to apply.

Only selected candidates will be contacted.

How to apply
Please forward your resume and cover letter to humanresources@dstgroup.com, and please quote Job # 21-1233



About DST Consulting Engineers:

Providing expert, innovative environmental and engineering consulting services - without surprises - is what DST Consulting Engineers Inc. does best. We are a multi-disciplinary firm providing comprehensive services to clients across Canada. DST’s nation-wide team is comprised of exceptional people in various stages of their career. We come together each day to make the unexpected happen. Growing our team means we are in pursuit of brilliant individuals who can rise to the challenge.

title: Surveyor
description:
Surveyor









Location: Calgary, AB, Canada Job ID: R9801 Job Status: Full-Time



Share:











Apply Now



Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.













Description





Job Summary:

You are an experienced Surveyor seeking a great wage, extensive benefits, and want to work for a company who prides themselves on safety. You have previously worked alongside crews within an industrial environment.


Apply to join the Ledcor team today!







Essential Responsibilities:



+ Complete field survey requests, measurements, and setup / configuring survey instruments.


+ Comfortable working with crews and proficient at communication.


+ Establish secondary control from primary site control networks.


+ Interpret and extrapolate surveying data from construction and design drawings.


+ Install survey stake locations, such as Right of Way limits, pile locations and cut-offs, and site grading.


+ Prepare surveying notes, level notes, grade sheets, and calculate coordinates.





Qualifications:



+ Minimum 3 years of field Surveying experience


+ Preferred to have completed diploma in Surveying, Geomatics, Civil Engineering, or a related field


+ Technical background in surveying, using conventional & digital levels, robotic total stations (Leica), and Trimble GPS equipment


+ Proficient with Trimble Access and Leica Captivate


+ Attention to detail with the ability to recognize & communicate discrepancies


+ Must be able to complete pre-access Drug and Alcohol testing





Work Conditions:



+ Shift based role of 14/7, camp and travel provided


+ Work will be primarily outdoors in various weather conditions


+ Benefits provided by CLAC - extended health plan (prescription drugs, dental, and other coverage)





Additional Information:


Company Description


Ledcor Industrial offers an integrated range of services from construction, engineering, and maintenance to pipe fabrication and module assembly. We offer turnkey solutions to our oil and gas clients and have built some of the continent’s largest oil and gas projects.




But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!




Employment Equity


At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.



Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.




View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here (https://www.ledcor.com/who-we-are/inclusion-and-diversity) .



Date Posted

May 5, 2022



1930 Maynard Road SE, Calgary, AB, Canada

title: Survey Crew Chief
description:
At GeoVerra, itâ€™s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means youâ€™ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If youâ€™re most at home in the outdoorsâ€”where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkersâ€”then our Survey Crew Chief position located in Virden, Manitoba might be the perfect fit.

Our company is in acceleration mode. GeoVerraâ€™s growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your career here will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

The most important thing to know? Weâ€™re a team of experienced and professional employees who genuinely believe in the work we do. We support each other in a safe and positive working environment. At GeoVerra, you never go at it alone. Dig deeper. Broaden your horizons. Weâ€™re here for it all. And with fantastic benefits, work-life balance, and professional development options, we make it easier to chase your dreams.

The Partnership Promise
This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You GeoVerra
Our new Survey Crew Chief must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have
an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

This position requires a quick and engaged learner, with proven success in adaptability, productivity and high physical capabilities. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with strong communication skills and an infectious positivity that encourages this attitude in all team members. You will have a strong handle on equipment and field tools, with a healthy respect for the outdoors and the timeline of
the task at hand.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and perform field survey work;
  • Liaise with Project Managers to coordinate field survey work, to review and manage project budgets, timeline requirements, priorities and survey methodology;
  • Act as a company representative, liaising directly with client field representatives and land owners;
  • Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Survey Assistants working with you;
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of industry best practices, more efficient field processes and procedures and the innovative use of new technology; 
  • Actively participate in and proactively support the advancement of the GeoVerra safety program;
  • Some office technical survey work may be required in this position; and
  • Other duties as assigned/required

Qualifications

  • Our successful candidate will be a graduate of a recognized post-secondary program related to surveying and geomatics or have an equivalent amount of related experience.  
  • 1 years experience;
  • Strong working knowledge of survey equipment and software such as GPS and Total Stations (Including Robotic);
  • Knowledge and experience of Trimble equipment and software, laser scanning and line locating would be considered an asset;
  • Strong problem-solving skills in a field environment;
  • Effective communication skills - verbal and written; ability to produce accurate and legible field notes;
  • The ability to develop and motivate survey staff and work well in a team environment;
  • An aptitude for delivering projects on time and budget;
  • Experience with the use of ATVs/UTVs, snowmobiles and chainsaws would be considered an asset;
  • A valid Class 5 driverâ€™s license and can provide a clean driverâ€™s abstract;
  • Completed training and valid tickets in First Aid, H2S and CSTS safety training, is an asset.
  • All employment offers for Safety Sensitive positions are conditional upon the successful completion of a Negative Drug Screen and Passing Alcohol Screen. 

Timeline
Full time, beginning immediately
 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Survey Technologist
description:
Role Overview
McElhanney is currently seeking an experienced and motivated individual to join our team as a Survey Technologist in Vancouver, BC. This is a great opportunity for a dedicated individual who is looking to gain hands on surveying experience with a multidisciplinary team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work alongside a team of survey technicians and land surveyors on a variety of legal, topographic and construction surveys.

Responsibilities
  • Interpret field data in order to create accurate survey drawings and legal plans, which will include downloading and editing field data, interpreting field notes and sketches, and processing conventional and GPS data
  • Complete calculations as needed and prepare for drafting or client project reporting
  • Liaising with Project Managers and clients regarding enquiries and issues
  • Implementing and ensuring quality assurance on all field returns
  • Maintain, test, calibrate and adjust survey equipment as needed
  • Take instructions from the project manager for performance of office tasks.
  • Coordinate the preparation of documents and applications required for regulatory approvals.

Requirements
  • Degree or technical diploma in Geomatics with at least 2 years’ of progressive experience in a survey tech/party chief role; experience in legal and engineering surveys is a strong asset  
  • BCLS accreditation or working towards accreditation is an asset
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Leica Geo Office is an asset
  • Knowledge of survey and boundary calculation, geodetic coordinate systems and map projections
  • Capable of computations and assessment of found legal evidence in the field when necessary
  • Understanding of the BC Land Titles system
  • Strong communication, leadership, and motivational skills

This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.
#LI-AM3   #junior  #Hybrid

If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 
For more than 100 years, we’ve been an industry leader in the application of leading practices and cutting-edge technology within Surveying and Geomatics. Our survey crews and technical employees are committed to working closely with our clients in the resource, infrastructure, and construction industries, and within the communities we help build.
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.
