title: Engineering Technologist (Civil Drafter) - Intermediate
description:
Company Description

We are a global architecture, engineering, planning, and technology firm defining the cities of tomorrow.

By connecting design and technology, we change how people experience their built environment. We work across disciplines to create the intelligent systems, sustainable buildings, and efficient infrastructure that shapes the way people live, move, learn, and heal.

With over 3,000 employees and 60 offices around the world, we understand what it takes to work locally and scale globally.

At IBI, we’re defining the cities of tomorrow.

Job Description

Why Join the IBI Family:

  • Our exhaustive practice covers the full spectrum of engineering services, from traditional projects to emerging technology-driven fields
  • You will be part of an elite team of engineers who are tightly connected to the other architectural, planning and systems experts within IBI Group as part of our “global intelligence/local knowledge” approach
  • You will be valued and given ample of opportunities for further business development within our very own IBI internal career path

Our Values:

  • Integrity – We do what is right
  • Partnerships – We work together
  • Excellence – We pursue design excellence
  • Innovation – We embrace ingenuity
  • Community – We build community
  • Environment – We take action on climate change

Most of the Things You’ll Work on:

  • The primary duty of the Engineering Technologist is to develop complex engineering drawings and be able to prepare designs and estimates from general instruction and/or preliminary sketches, diagrams or schematics, under minimal supervision
  • In addition, the role may recommend modifications and changes for design improvement and simplification and prepare working drawings from conceptual layouts to detailed finished products
  • Coordinate BIM/CADD projects with other discipline personnel, and prepare/assemble project deliverables, as well as, develop basic to mid-level designs/layouts, and prepare basic design calculations
  • This position requires effective time-management and the ability to work well within a team of BIM/CADD technicians and potentially providing technical guidance to less experienced design staff
Qualifications

You'll Need to Have:

  • A Civil Engineering Technology diploma, preferred (or equivalent)
  • Between 3 to 7 years of experience in structural engineering projects within private land development, government, institutional, infrastructure, commercial and/or industrial required
  • LRT/Rail projects and Water & Wastewater experience preferred
  • Current OACETT membership is an asset
  • Must be knowledgeable in basic construction practices for civil/structural fieldwork and have the ability to generate drawings for engineers and make suggestions for further development
  • Must be proficient in both Revit andAutoCAD
  • Must have BIM knowledge
  • MicroStation experience is preferable but not necessary (training will be provided)
  • Should be experienced with Microsoft Office programs
  • Excellent analytical and maths skills are a must
  • Must have effective written, communication, analytical, and interpersonal skills to be able to work well in teams


Additional Information

We are currently in a work from home model during COVID-19 but when we do return to the office we're located at 175 Galaxy Boulevard in Toronto. 

IBI Group provides a competitive benefit package and pays association dues and licensing fees.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we are proud to support the growth and equality of our people through initiatives like our Mentorship Program, Global Women’s Network, and Diversity & Inclusion Council. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified candidates regardless of age, race, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation. We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Similar positions/roles: Engineering Technician, Structural Drafter, Civil Technologist, Civil Drafter.  Similar projects: LRT/Rail projects and Water & Wastewater projects.

As part of IBI Group's selection process, candidates may be requested to consent to background checks relevant to the role under consideration for, prior to receiving a job offer. These could include: work references, education and credential confirmation, employment verification, identity check, credit report, criminal offence and driver’s license record. Candidates will also need to confirm they are fully vaccinated in accordance with IBI Group’s mandatory vaccination policy in Canada.

title: Leak Survey Technician - Scarborough
description:
• Full-time permanent position. Monday-Friday
  • Entry-level
  • Competitive hourly rate ($18.58 starting wage) with regularly scheduled opportunities for performance-based raises and bonuses
  • Exceptional health benefits, including for family
  • Defined contribution pension plan and employee assistance program
  • Company cell phone provided
  • Company car provided for work only, which you can park at home
  • Work independently outdoors

Wouldn’t it be great to find a company that will give you a chance to prove yourself, and grow a career quickly?

Look no further. G-Tel is hiring and training new Leak Survey Technicians to complete jobs in and around your area. The G-Tel family includes multiple growing companies providing electrical distribution infrastructure, energy and power generation services.

 

In this role, you will:

  • Receive full 3 - 4 weeks’ training
  • Receive assignments and routes to follow each day
  • Use state of the art equipment (including infra-red and flame ionization) to examine buried gas lines, and detect/report buried gas leaks.
  • Prepare reports and documentation that based on your work
  • From there, your reports will go to the people who repair the leaks, so they can make sure the gas lines stay in good working order.

 

Qualifications

  • Have experience, or would definitely enjoy, working outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Be physically fit and able to walk frequently (up to 20-25km/day), sit in a vehicle, and lift/carry up to 20 lbs
  • Be able to visually distinguish colours
  • Have a valid Ontario “G” class driver’s license and be able to produce a clean drivers abstract
  • Have a high school diploma
  • Be willing to obtain and wear CSA approved steel toe safety boots
  • Be willing to undergo and successfully clear a criminal background check
  • Willingness to work weekends and overtime is an asset, but not required
  • Have general computer knowledge (browser, email, Microsoft Office)

Please note: G-Tel does not require proof of Covid-19 vaccination.

title: CAD Technologist
description:
GeoVerra is in acceleration mode. Our growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your GeoVerra career will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

You GeoVerra

Our leaders at GeoVerra set the standard for our company, and the industry. We look for the bestâ€”adaptable managers and professionals with a deep understanding of surveying with an array of projects, challenges and successes under their belt who are always striving for more.

Our new CAD Technologist will be located at one of the following British Columbia office locations: Langley, Kelowna, Victoria, Cranbrook, Invermere or Fort St. John.  Our new CAD Technologist will lead by example: Professional. Positive. Productive. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with excellent communication skills. New ideas or creative flow is important tooâ€”hit us with the strategies or suggestions that makes our team operate even better. Weâ€™re passionate about learning every day and being impactfulâ€”and our leaders reflects that in their daily work.

Responsibilities:

  • Produce and maintain survey plans, industrial plans, civil plans, photo mosaics, record drawings and the collection, analysis, storage, distribution and application of spatial and three-dimensional data used in land development. 
  • Ensure that assignment requirements are understood and what the time allocations are to complete the assigned tasks. 
  • Self-check assignments prior to drawings being given to the CAD Team Lead for final approval.
  • Adhere to current CAD standards and provide feedback as required.
  • Adhere to the use of current departmental check sheets and work flow procedures.
  • Ensure drawings meet client timelines and deliverables.
  • CAD Technologist additional roles:
  • Assist in the development of CAD standards and procedures.
  • Support the CAD Team Lead in coordinating and mentoring junior staff regarding CAD standards and accuracy requirements.

Qualifications:

  • Diploma or Degree in Geomatics Engineering Technology, Engineering Design & Drafting Technology, Civil Engineering Technology, or related discipline; or certification in related CAD courses.
  • Member in good standing or eligible for registration with local Survey or Technologist Association is preferable.
  • An understanding of CAD requirements on various surveying projects.
  • Intermediate CAD Technologist: 4-6 years direct related experience.
  • Proficient in Windows; MS Word and other Microsoft Office applications. Experienced in the use of the latest versions of AutoCAD, Civil 3D and Coordinate Geometry software.
  • Knowledge of civil engineering design components, alignments, grading, volumes and site construction works.
  • Contribute on an on-going basis toward maintaining a safe working environment both for yourself and for those working with you or in your close vicinity.
  • Ability to work to deadlines and see tasks through to completion.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Good analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Must be able to import data and create plans of survey.
  • Must maintain a strong technological base and be able to maintain a high level of production.
  • Ability to work without supervision; effective time management and strong organizational skills.
  • Adaptable and able to think outside the box.
  • Ability to support and mentor/teach other members of the team.

What GeoVerra can offer you:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Comprehensive benefits coverage, vacation, wellness days, and RRSP matching contributions
  • Tools and services to support your mental wellness
  • Flexible workplace program to suit your needs
  • Work-life balance
  • Growth and advancement opportunities
  • Paid professional dues
  • Continuing education and professional development
  • Use of leading-edge technology and equipment
  • Diverse projects and a fast-paced working environment
  • Support to the communities we live and work in

The Partnership Promise

This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Principal Piping Designer - (Job Number: EDM019B)
description:
Principal Piping Designer

Company: Worley
Primary Location: CAN-AB-Edmonton
Job: Piping<
Schedule: Full-time
Employment Type: Employee
Job Level: Experienced<
Job Posting: Apr 19, 2022
Unposting Date: May 20, 2022
Reporting Manager Title: Piping Department Manager

48,000 people. 49 countries. Over 120 office locations.
Wersquo;re not just engineers. Wersquo;re a global team of data scientists, consultants, construction workers andinnovators all working to create a better tomorrow. Every day, we help customers in energy, chemicals andresources get one step closer to solving our planetrsquo;s toughest issues. Climate change. The energy transition.Digital transformation. And how we can deliver a more sustainable world.?


Whatever your ambition, therersquo;s a path for you here. And therersquo;s no barrier to your potential career success. For more information, visit Worley.com


Responsibilities

  • Be responsible to have a full understanding of the projectrsquo;s scope, overall schedule, deliverables, milestones, manhour budgets, industry standards, applicable codes, and procedures
  • Develop hour estimates
  • Develop a staffing plan to satisfy budget and schedule
    Determine line count and estimated isometric quantities based on Pamp;IDrsquo;s
  • Establish design areas within the unit/areas of responsibility
  • Monitor and utilize the Master Pamp;ID MOC (Management of Change) log to identify scope change
  • Utilize a 3D model review software to monitor design quality and progress
  • Coordinate the design effort with other engineering and design disciplines
  • Develop general arrangements of plant facilities, structures and equipment considering safe maintenance and construction while interfacing with all engineering and design disciplines
  • Locate and identify pipe support types; input the field data into a 3D model

What you will bring


Technical and Industry Experience:

  • Minimum 8 years of relevant lead piping designer and layout design experience for power, chemical, and industrial facilities
  • Strong background in discipline work and a competent understanding of regulations, codes, manufacturing standards, and industry standard practices
  • Skilled in estimating project costs and writing proposal content
  • MS Office skills (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) required
  • Experience using 3D model design software
  • Experience with the application of Microstation V8i amp; AutoCAD
  • Leadership and project execution experience
  • Experience developing Piping Models, Pipe Supports, Equipment Models, Isometric and Orthographic Drawing extraction is a plus
  • Field design experience with the capability to perform field walk downs using Pamp;IDrsquo;s, locating tie points dimensionally, and routing pipe through existing facilities

Education ndash; Qualifications, Accreditation, Training:


Required:

  • 2 or 3 year technical diploma with piping design specific training or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience
What we offer you

Providing an agile culture and challenging work opportunities results in a positive work environment. Our people enjoy competitive compensation packages and a fun, personal, collaborative and safe working environment. We value equal employment opportunity and are committed to promoting fairness, equality and diversity.


Our policy is to conduct background checks for all candidates who accept an offer of employment with us.

If you have the passion and talent to keep up, it#39;s time to test the limits of what you can become. Find your future with Worley.

title: Drafting Technician
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

Overview:

The Drafting Technician - CAD is responsible for the articulation of information from contract drawings, addendum, specifications, written documents and oral instruction in providing accurate precast production and construction shop drawings.

 

STRUCTURE:

Reporting to the Drafting Manager, the incumbent will prepare accurate construction and production drawings utilizing CAD drafting techniques showing all details required for the complete fabrication and installation of precast concrete components.   Planning and organization is an important dimension of this position where both internal and external customer schedules requirements must be met. Project collaboration will include working alongside Sales, Project Management and Operation teams.

Responsibilities:
  • Performing all drafting functions, including precast construction (erection) and production drawings in a fast paced work environment.
  • Preparing hardware details and material list and others as may be required
  • Laying out of drawings consistent with company standard details and practices
  • Project document and information retrieval to ensure drawing accuracy and completion.
  • Ensuring project documents are archived according to the Lafarge policy.
  • Planning and organize work priorities to meet customer schedules and demand
  • Ability to interpret specifications related to construction industry
  • Assist in other endeavors, as required
  • Support the continual improvement of the company safety culture.

SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES:

  • Must be a team player with excellent organizational skills.
  • Self-motivated and driven.
  • Ability to maintain good customer relations (prompt to response time).
  • Safety Oriented.
Qualifications:
  • Two or three years Technician or Technology training from technical college
  • Proficient in drafting construction drawings and shop drawings with Auto Cad  
  • Computer skills training programs or equivalent work experience including software applications such as Microsoft Excel, communications and knowledge of network operations
  • Minimum three years experience in construction industry
  • Experience in Precast Concrete Industry is an asset.
  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
  • Excellent  interpersonal skills
  • Good work ethics and possess can do attitude
  • 3D modeling skill with Revit is an asset
  • Capable to read and understand specifications, architectural and structural drawings

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim:

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

 

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

 

Check out our YouTube channel to learn more about our operations and see all career opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers.

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Revit Technician (Hybrid or Remote)
description:
*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

We know the importance of stability during these unprecedented times and as an essential service, we've been steadily growing our employee numbers since March 2020. With many large projects on the horizon, it's an exciting time to join our team and become part of our stable, growing organization and industry.

About Houle Electric:

At Houle, we are passionate about building resilient communities. From airports, shipping terminals, and water treatment facilities, to hospitals, universities, and shopping centres, we deliver integrated electrical solutions for our industrial, commercial, institutional and residential customers.

While we are leaders in electrical construction, we also specialize in a wide range of in-house technology solutions, including audio visual, building automation, healthcare systems, network systems, and security and life-safety. As a certified Great Place to Work, and one of Canada's Best Managed Companies, we take pride in our talented people and collaborative culture that bring our client's vision to life.

About the position:

Houle's Project Planning Services department is looking for a Revit Technician to join the team. Our planning department specializes in designing and creating installation drawings from engineering construction documents, to the field stage for installation. This encompasses many electrical systems such as distribution infrastructures, wall elevations, branch power & lighting, fire alarm, and technology systems such as structured cabling, nurse call, and security.

Based out of Kelowna, the Project Planning Services team supports our large Design Build projects across the province, ranging from large residential, office high rises to major hospitals.

As a REVIT Technician, your responsibilities would be to support and work closely with our electrical planners to provide REVIT and CAD assisted drafting. This entails 3D modeling clash adjustments and coordination, concept modeling, infrastructure layouts, wiring pull plans, and electrical details.

Not only will you get to operate within Revit and CAD, but we also hope that you will take on the challenge of learning some base electrical planning with the close guidance of our planners.

There are both Hybrid and Remote work options available for this role.

Duties and responsibilities:

The incumbent would be responsible for working with our project planning services team to:

  • Work side by side with our planners to repair bulk modeling issues within Revit, on electrical products, such as Conduit racks, distribution equipment, light fixtures, and in wall devices.
  • Develop drawings using design information provided from hand sketches, Bluebeam and CAD including system line diagrams, floor plans, and elevations

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills and attributes:

  • Relevant Education
  • 1+ years of Revit and AutoCAD software application experience
  • Experience with document and asset management within Revit and BIM 360, and the remainder of the Autodesk umbrella
  • Experience with modeling to standard LOD levels (Levels of Detail 100-500)
  • Experience within Revit creating and managing families is an asset
  • Capable of working side by side with planners to adjust modeling
  • Experience in architectural drafting an asset
  • Experience with reviewing and navigating through typical construction drawings
  • Thorough understanding and efficiency with drafting standards
  • Strong organizational and prioritizing skills with the ability to take initiative
  • Energetic, flexible, problem solving mindset

Culture is important at Houle. You must be collaborative in nature. You are a solution focused team player and always willing to learn. You are a bright, ambitious, honest, and a straight forward professional. Your personable nature will fit well within the friendly working environment.

The compensation for this position will be commensurate with experience. Houle offers an exciting, enjoyable work environment, competitive benefits package as well as a competitive incentive plan and many company sponsored events.

To apply, please visit https://www.houle.ca/current-career-opportunities/ and click on the listing for "Revit Technician". Opportunity will remain open until filled.

For the interview process, please be prepared to showcase your portfolio. Testing may also be required.

*Please submit all application documents in PDF format*

title: CAD Designer/Engineer
description:
Job Number: 42069 
Group: Magna Exteriors  
Division: Mytox Mfg. 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: Woodbridge 

 

Group Description

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

 

Position Summary:

Member of divisional application engineering team accountable for creating, updating, and controlling CAD models and drawings in accordance with established engineering best practices. 

Duties and Responsibilities:

•    Work collaboratively with Program Managers and Product Engineers on product designs and review technical inquiries from customers
•    Provide consultation on standard product manufacturing, ease of assembly and benchmarking
•    Perform packaging, conceptual and feasibility studies
•    Create 2D drawings for Tier 2 suppliers
•    Synthesize and analyze linkages/mechanisms that provide desired functionality
•    Check detail component and assembly drawings prepared by detailers for correct tolerancing, dimensioning, and material specifications
•    Understand and follow customer and Mytox standards for drawings (Part Numbering and Revision Levels) and CAD models (Colours, Layers etc.) – proficient at maintaining data control
•    Prepare CAD models and drawings for customers and engineering presentations as required
•    Prepare and track translated files for prototype and Tier 2 suppliers
•    Manage document control and transmittal activities with customers and suppliers
•    Aid in Math Data/CAD Control by maintaining proper organization of CAD files, archives old versions of models and unnecessary files to keep disk usage at minimum
•    Update both model and drawings with engineering changes
•    Track hours spent by project number and activity
•    Improve speed and quality of designs and continuously improves a general knowledge of tools used in design – computer software and hardware through benchmarking and participating in training courses
•    Make recommendations to improve organization and quality of work in design department
•    Prepare presentations materials for Sales and Marketing.
•    Adhere to all policies and procedures as outlined in the Employee Handbook and Mytox’s Quality System and Business Operating Procedures.
•    Perform duties in accordance with all applicable Health, Safety and Environmental company policies and government legislation 
•    Perform other duties as assigned by Management

Qualifications:

•    Certified Engineering Technologist (Mechanical) or recognized equivalent
•    Formal training in Computer Aided Design and/or 5 years of Product Design and Drafting work experience in suitable mechanical engineering field


Additional Skills:
•    Strong Mechanical aptitude
•    Knowledge of Kinematics
•    Working knowledge of CATIA, IGES. NX / UG, IDEAS
•    Ability to quickly learn other CAD applications / software
•    Working knowledge of DFA, DFM
•    Excellent drafting and drawing creation skills
•    Working knowledge of GD&T principles
•    Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills
•    Working knowledge of manufacturing and production methods of high volume electro-mechanical systems
•    Maintain a valid passport and flexible to travel to customer sites in North America and abroad
 

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

title: 19CAD/H A JOB FOR YOU... 3.30 PM-00PM
description:
Picker Packer Night shift with or without experience required.
Join our new team.

In the warehouses, we offer you the possibility of obtaining a permanent position with fixed hours and HAVE YOUR WEEK-ENDS OFF.

Salary :
18.50$ + bonus 0.50cts/H (ASSIDUITY) = 19$/H
Monday to Friday
15h30 - 00h

angela.nemene@randstad.ca

free for all employees;

title: Survey CAD Technician
description:
Role Overview
McElhanney Ltd. has an opportunity for a Survey CAD Technician to join our team in Nanaimo, BC! This role is ideal for someone who is looking for a challenging opportunity in CAD Drafting, with skills to be utilized on a wide variety of British Columbia construction and survey projects. The ideal individual will have five or more years’ experience drafting legal survey plans in British Columbia. AutoCAD Civil 3D experience will be a definite plus.

Live & Work in Nanaimo:
As the second largest city on Vancouver Island which has earned the title “Canada’s Sunporch,” Nanaimo is a thriving mix of restaurants, music venues, shops, galleries, and unique cultural elements—such as the world-famous Bathtub Races! Nanaimo is host to a multitude of retail opportunities including the largest mall on Vancouver Island - Woodgrove Centre. Offering natural beauty at every turn, from mountain wilderness to spectacular beaches, with vast recreational opportunities for everyone, you too can call Nanaimo home!
For additional information on Vancouver Island, visit our customized Vancouver Island careers page.
 
 Responsibilities 
  • Review field notes from the field crews and ensure the records are complete and meet project standards
  • Extract and calculate dimensions and coordinates from drawings, CAD files, and other sources
  • Upload and download survey data from various sources
  • Research an array of data repositories to identify land ownership and encumbrances on land
  • Prepare various legal survey and topographic survey plans

Requirements
  • Certificate or diploma in Geomatics or CAD
  • Previous experience with design/drafting is an asset
  • Proficient with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey, and other applicable survey software
  • Excellent attention to detail, good judgement and clear communication skills
  • Ability to work both independently and within a busy team environment
  • Willingness to work additional hours to meet project deadlines.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle 
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave 
  • Great benefits, including extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching 
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone 
  • A family-like culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all 
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth 
  • Profit sharing through an annual performance bonus program
  • Ability to become a shareholder in an employee-owned company 

Vaccination Requirement
In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others.  This position requires that the successful candidate is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and as such, proof of vaccination will be required prior to the first day of employment. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation. 
 

About McElhanney

Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

 #Junior #Hybrid  #LI-AM3
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: PDK/CAD Engineer - DFM
description:
Company:

Qualcomm Canada ULC




Job Area:

Engineering Group, Engineering Group > ASICS Engineering




General Summary:


Digital - Oversees definition, design, verification, and documentation for ASIC development for a variety of products. Determines architecture design, logic design, and system simulation. Defines module interfaces/formats for simulation. Evaluates all aspects of the process flow from high-level design to synthesis, place and route, and timing and power use. Analyzes equipment to establish operation data, conducts experimental tests, and evaluates results. Uses System tools, such as National Instrument (NI) products, LabVIEW, and MathWorks MATLAB, SIMULINK, VISIO and other toolboxes. Uses language such as HDL, C, PERL. Provides technical expertise for next generation initiatives.
Analog - Oversees definition, design, verification, and documentation for ASIC development for a variety of products. Determines architecture design and circuit specifications based on system level requirements. Is actively involved in all aspects of the design from system definition/simulation to circuit design and simulation. Heavy involvement in overseeing layout and silicon evaluation is also expected. Uses design tools such as Cadence ADE, MathWorks MATLAB and others. Provides technical expertise for next generation initiatives.




Minimum Qualifications:


• Bachelor's degree in Science, Engineering, or related field and 2+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience.

OR

Master's degree in Science, Engineering, or related field and 1+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience.

OR

PhD in Science, Engineering, or related field.






Preferred Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering.
• 4+ years of ASIC design, verification, or related work experience.
• 2+ years of experience with architecture and design tools.
• 2+ years of experience with scripting tools and programming languages.
• 2+ years of experience with design verification methods.
Principal Duties & Responsibilities:
• Uses tools/applications (i.e., Cadence, RTL Compiler, etc.) to execute the architecture and design of an individual block according to design protocol provided.
• Participates in developing an implementation strategy that meets system requirements and customer needs, occasionally relying on help from manager.
• Resolves architecture, design, or verification problems by applying sound ASIC engineering practices with minimal supervision.
• Owns the design and verification strategies of ASICs, SoC, and IP cores of a single block or IC Package.
• Writes tests and regressions to identify any bugs in own work and helps more junior team members do the same.
• Runs power checks on a single block to ensure it meets specifications provided by team lead.
• Interprets the results of performance checks and reports them to team lead.
• Provides ideas and furthers the innovation of ASICs, SoC, IP cores, and/or transistor level integrated circuits.
• Writes, reviews, and edits technical document in accordance with template requirements.
• Communicates directly with lead on any significant deviations from the Plan of Record for assigned block in a timely manner.
• Participates in design or project reviews and project meetings and supports these by providing team lead with progress on own related tasks.
• Provides input (i.e., timing, feasibility) on assigned tasks related to projects.
• Provides input on process improvement by identifying existing resources or work products that can be reused or applied to assigned tasks.
Additional responsibilities might include:
• Designs and implements test keys according to technology requirements.
• Uses modeling/simulation/layout tools to debug issues and help the development of competitive process technology modules.
• Develops and maintains databases for technology data mining and analysis.
Level of Responsibility:
• Working under some supervision.
• Making decisions that are moderate in impact; errors may have relatively minor financial impact or effect on projects, operations, or customer relationships; errors may require involvement beyond immediate work group to correct.
• Using verbal and written communication skills to convey information that may be somewhat complex to others who may have limited knowledge of the subject in question. May require basic negotiation and influence, cooperation, tact, and diplomacy, etc.
• Having a moderate amount of influence over key organizational decisions (e.g., is consulted by senior leadership to provide input on key decisions).
• Completing tasks with multiple steps that can be performed in various orders; some planning and prioritization must occur to complete the tasks effectively; mistakes may result in some rework.
• Exercising creativity to draft original documents, imagery, or work products within established guidelines.
• Using deductive and inductive problem solving; multiple approaches may be taken/necessary to solve the problem; often information is missing or incomplete; intermediate data analysis/interpretation skills may be required.
• May be solicited during strategic planning period.
The responsibilities of this role do not include:
• Financial accountability (e.g., does not involve budgeting responsibility).
Qualcomm is committed to hiring and supporting individuals with disabilities. Although this role has some expected physical activity, an inability to perform one or more of the listed physical requirements should not deter otherwise qualified applicants from applying. We will work with you throughout the application and onboarding process to provide reasonable accommodations. Examples of expected physical activity include: frequently transporting between offices, buildings, and campuses up to ½ mile; frequently transporting and installing equipment up to 5 lbs.; performing tasks at various heights (e.g., standing or sitting); monitoring and utilizing computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day; and continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely.

























Applicants : If you need an accommodation, during the application/hiring process, you may request an accommodation by sending email to accommodationsupport

















To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies : Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Staffing and recruiting agencies and individuals being represented by an agency are not authorized to use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes, and any such submissions will be considered unsolicited. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.






If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers (http://www.qualcomm.com/contact/corporate) .



EEO Employer: Qualcomm is an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or any other protected classification.

title: AutoCAD Leader - Amico Corporation
description:
AutoCad Leader
Amico Corporation – Richmond Hill

We are looking for a leader to supervise a team of 4 AutoCad specialists who work in the Construction field.
The ideal candidate will be a problem solver with some experience in AutoCad and a desire to lead people.
This position provides excellent compensation and benefits for the right candidate.

For more information, please visit us at www.amico.com

*Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: CAD Technician
description:
CAD Technician
Toronto, ON
Architecture & Design
Open to candidates willing to relocate

OUR CLIENT
TalentSphere is partnering with an Internationally renowned design firm specializing in landscape architecture, urban design, and environmental planning looking to hire a CAD Technician. This reputable organization is committed to the process of creating environments needed to sustain humanity in the 21st century.

Responsibilities of this position include:
Preparation and production of Architectural and/or Structural based drawings such as:
  • Architectural Site Plans, Floor Plans, Foundation Plans, Reflective Ceiling, Roof Plans, and details
  • Building cross-sections and details
  • Coordinating any revisions/mark-ups of working drawings.
  • Liaising with sales, estimating, and project management departments, as necessary for the preparation of working drawings.
Qualifications:       
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience.
  • Must be proficient in drawing application programs AutoCAD or Architectural Desktop and Outlook, Word, and Excel
  • Must have strong organizational and communications skills.
  • Strong construction techniques and practices knowledge would be considered an asset
  • Good working knowledge of the Ontario Building Code is considered an asset
All qualified candidates are invited to apply.

Keywords:  Architectural Draftsman, Draftsperson, Draftsman, Architectural CAD Drafter, AutoCAD Drafter, CAD technician, Architectural Design Technologist, Architectural Technician, Design technologist, Toronto, GTA, Ontario, ON

title: Technology Management | Level 2 (CAD)
description:
Job Title: Vendor Risk Management Specialist

Department: Technology and Operations Risk Job Location: Montreal Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. We advise, originate, trade, manage and distribute capital for governments, institutions and individuals. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. We provide you a superior foundation for building a professional career where you can learn, achieve and grow. Technology/Role/Department at Morgan Stanley Technology & Operations Risk (TOR) manages operational and technology related risks on behalf of the Firm. The groups key principles are to provide proactive, comprehensive and consistent risk management, to enable the execution of the Firms strategy. Technology & Operations Risks mission is to deliver first-line defenses to manage risks to Firm technology, information and cyber threats through risk identification, control management and assurance. This allows the business to operate and grow in a secure and legally compliant manner.

Job Responsibilities Assist with the on-boarding of third-party technology vendors used by companies that have recently been acquired by Morgan Stanley Work closely with Service Owners to support the creation of third-party vendor inventory records for new and existing services Work with Sourcing to understand if existing third-party vendor inventory records can be leveraged
Drive discussions with other Morgan Stanley Business Units to determine appropriate ownership of third-party vendor inventory records Report on on-boarding status on a weekly basis, ensuring transparency on progress and any risks or issues that have been encountered Once on-boarded drive compliance with key third party risk management policy requirements such as the creation of vendor contingency plans Assist with the determination of whether a service should be considered outsourcing. If determined to be outsourcing, assist with progressing the service through the heightened requirements for these types of arrangement
Oversee and work with other Business Units to ensure dependent activities are understood and coordinated within the larger program activities Attend regular integration meetings and provide updates on progress Perform Quality assurance of third-party vendor inventory records to ensure accuracy
Provide guidance to Service Owners on key facets of the third-party program Respond to queries from Management and other interested groups in a timely manner Skills Educated to degree level in relevant subject (e.g. Information Technology, Risk Management, Business Management) Experience with third party vendor risk and relationship management Experience in determining whether third party services constitute outsourcing Experience with institutional integrations and/or technology risk management Program/project management experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Good attention to detail and good organizational skills Strong Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint, Visio, Excel) skills Experience of stakeholder engagement at different levels of an organization Accurate, tenacious and delivery focused mindset Comfort working with ambiguity, managing and resolving complex issues

title: Survey Crew Chief
description:
At GeoVerra, itâ€™s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means youâ€™ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If youâ€™re most at home in the outdoorsâ€”where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkersâ€”then our Survey Crew Chief position located in Moose Jaw or Regina, Saskatchewan might be the perfect fit.

Our company is in acceleration mode. GeoVerraâ€™s growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your career here will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

The most important thing to know? Weâ€™re a team of experienced and professional employees who genuinely believe in the work we do. We support each other in a safe and positive working environment. At GeoVerra, you never go at it alone. Dig deeper. Broaden your horizons. Weâ€™re here for it all. And with fantastic benefits, work-life balance, and professional development options, we make it easier to chase your dreams.

The Partnership Promise
This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You GeoVerra
Our new Survey Crew Chief must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have
an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

This position requires a quick and engaged learner, with proven success in adaptability, productivity and high physical capabilities. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with strong communication skills and an infectious positivity that encourages this attitude in all team members. You will have a strong handle on equipment and field tools, with a healthy respect for the outdoors and the timeline of
the task at hand.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and perform field survey work;
  • Liaise with Project Managers to coordinate field survey work, to review and manage project budgets, timeline requirements, priorities and survey methodology;
  • Act as a company representative, liaising directly with client field representatives and land owners;
  • Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Survey Assistants working with you;
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of industry best practices, more efficient field processes and procedures and the innovative use of new technology; 
  • Actively participate in and proactively support the advancement of the GeoVerra safety program;
  • Some office technical survey work may be required in this position; and
  • Other duties as assigned/required

Qualifications

  • Our successful candidate will be a graduate of a recognized post-secondary program related to surveying and geomatics or have an equivalent amount of related experience.  
  • 1 years experience;
  • Strong working knowledge of survey equipment and software such as GPS and Total Stations (Including Robotic);
  • Knowledge and experience of Trimble equipment and software, laser scanning and line locating would be considered an asset;
  • Strong problem-solving skills in a field environment;
  • Effective communication skills - verbal and written; ability to produce accurate and legible field notes;
  • The ability to develop and motivate survey staff and work well in a team environment;
  • An aptitude for delivering projects on time and budget;
  • Experience with the use of ATVs/UTVs, snowmobiles and chainsaws would be considered an asset;
  • A valid Class 5 driverâ€™s license and can provide a clean driverâ€™s abstract;
  • Completed training and valid tickets in First Aid, H2S and CSTS safety training, is an asset.
  • All employment offers for Safety Sensitive positions are conditional upon the successful completion of a Negative Drug Screen and Passing Alcohol Screen. 

Timeline
Full time, beginning immediately
 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

You will have a strong handle on equipment and field tools, with a healthy respect for the outdoors and the timeline ofthe task at hand.', 'Experience with the use of ATVs/UTVs, snowmobiles and chainsaws would be considered an asset;', 'Completed training and valid tickets in First Aid, H2S and CSTS safety training, is an asset.', 'Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;', 'Powered by JazzHR']

title: Field Survey Technologist
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Field Survey Technicianjoin our team! Reporting to the Project Manager or Field Supervisor, you will direct the field crew to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. You will also be involved in engineering, construction or legal surveying in rural and remote areas.

There is a significant opportunity to work in the emerging markets with projects across western Canada to keep you busy. This is a great opportunity for an individual that is looking to further their career in Geomatics Engineering with a well-established company.

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including engineering, construction, and legal surveys
  • Liaise between Project Manager and client representative
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Two-year technical diploma or degree in geomatics or civil engineering with up to 5 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Physically fit, able to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas, and willing to work in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset
  • Valid driver’s license required
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.
Note: The ability to travel and work out of town in remote areas for extended periods of time is required. Pre-employment drug and alcohol testing will be on-going and unscheduled as required.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching
  • Employee & Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support online or over the phone
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Competitive salary, participation in our generous performance bonus plan, and opportunity to join an employee-owned firm with potential share ownership
  • Continuous support for your growth through professional development reimbursement, mentorship programs, and opportunity to join numerous internal committees.
For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.
  #LI-AM3 #intermediate #Hybrid
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Senior CAD Operator
description:
The Opportunity: 
McElhanney has an exciting opportunity for a Senior CAD Operator to join our growing team in Surrey, BC. We are seeking a strong communicator who has excellent drafting skills and experience with AutoCAD Civil 3D. In this role, you will have to the opportunity to collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of technologists, EIT’s, professional engineers, technical design leaders and project managers on a variety of innovative and rewarding Design Build/P3 projects.

Our Surrey office has well-established teams and top tier clients that bring us diverse projects, giving you the opportunity to make an impact in your local community. Looking to make the next step in your career? Join McElhanney, a firm with big company opportunities, and a small company feel!

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Produce complex drawings and layout plans within guidelines and procedures with a high degree of technical accuracy
  • Create accurate drawings which follow project specific standards and guidelines.
  • Transform preliminary concepts and sketches into engineering designs, plans and project informational requirements, using primarily AutoCAD / Civil 3D, as well as other technical software as needed
  • Coordinate the preparation of drawings required for approvals, prepare development and construction cost estimates
  • Collaborate with team members to ensure schedules, budgets and quality control standards are achieved
  • Support, mentor, and train junior staff

What You’ll Bring:
  • Engineering drafting  education from an accredited institution
    • A minimum of 7 years’ of related experience
    • Preference will be given to candidates with local experience in Design Build/P3 work 
  • Advanced proficiency in AutoCAD Civil 3D Software is essential; knowledge and experience with CAD/Mapping/GIS software is also an asset
  • Attention to detail and excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and within a busy, high-performing, deadline

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your lifestyle
  • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan
  • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable
  • Opportunity to become a shareholder in an employee owned firm
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone
  • Participation in our numerous programs that support our Four Cornerstones: people & communities, clients & partners, processes & technology, and financial.

For a full review of our projects, please visit our line portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio


About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 110 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,000 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation, and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.
#LI-AM3  #Senior
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.

title: Survey Party Chief
description:
Position Overview:

We are seeking the right individuals to join our Northern Team at Sub-Arctic Geomatics for permanent and seasonal roles.  Our surveyors and experienced project managers have worked in nearly every community and region over decades of working in the Northwest Territories and Nunavut.

The Survey Party Chief reports to the Branch Manager and is accountable for effectively and efficiently carrying out field survey assignments. 

General Responsibilities:

  • Works independently or leads a crew that conducts field surveys as defined by the project manager.
  • Communicates effectively with the project manager as to their progress.
  • Provides comprehensive survey notes/sketches, computations, and data in support of all field surveys; ensures all documents conform to company standards.
  • Monitors each project from start to completion, as to the quality of service provided and results achieved.
  • Performs all health and safety duties as identified in the company's safety procedures.
  • Ensures all company equipment and vehicles are properly operated and maintained.

Qualifications

  • Must have completed a recognized geomatics post-secondary program OR can demonstrate they have an equivalent combination of geomatics training and experience;
  • Skilled with GPS, Total Stations, and other survey equipment;
  • Willing and able to work outside in the field in all weather conditions;
  • Willing and able to travel extensively and be away from home frequently;
  • Must be able to pass drug and alcohol testing as required to access work sites.
  • Valid Class 5 driver's license


Assets

  • Safety Training (i.e. H2S, First Aid, CSTS, Wildlife Awareness)
  • Line Locating Certifications
  • Microsurvey, Carlson, or AutoCAD experience


Physical Demands:

  • Walking – Frequent  
  • Lifting ±25lbs
  • Carrying ±25lbs – Frequent
  • Driving (sitting) – Frequent

title: Chief Surveyor
description:
Your Employer:

Dare  to join  Englobe  

 

Englobe,  and itâ€™s more than  2,600 people,  concerned about the environment daily, engaged  in sustainable engineering, process soils and biomass, and manage  the quality and integrity of assets.    

 

At Englobe, we adopt innovative, human-centred  management. We welcome new ideas and are open to discussion. We are determined to succeed in partnership with our teams.    

 

We offer  

 

  • A full range of benefits (group insurance with shared costs upon hiring, group RRSP);
  • A telemedicine virtual healthcare service;
  • An annual reimbursement of sports expenses;
  • Opportunities for skills development;
  • Flexible hours and ability to compress working hours;
  • Internal policy to encourage teleworking.

 

Dare  to join  Englobe and lead a career marked by growth and accomplishments.    

Your Contribution:

As a Chief Surveyor, you will work in collaboration with  the Instrumentation  & Monitoring  team.

 

Your main  responsibilities  will be:

  • Apply and promote  Englobeâ€™s  health and safety rules.

  • Leading the Surveying team in carrying out daily monitoring/surveying activities.

  • Consistently executing prescribed technical procedures, safe work practices and work plans in a safe, efficient manner under all applicable regulatory requirements and contract specifications.
  • Coordinate and undertake planning and implementation of survey requirements to facilitate construction activities.
  • Maintain accurate survey records, documentation, and stamped submittal.
  • Generating deliverable documentation including technical reports and letters, summaries, data sheets, graphs, proposals, and qualification packages.
  • Work with field staff project needs to develop project specific plans and documents.
  • Produce work plans in which objectives are clearly defined and steps for achieving them are well detailed for project crews to follow.
  • Provide clients (internal and external) with efficient responses to inquiries.
  • Anticipate client needs and respond within a timely manner to each inquiry.  
  • Monitor project and team performance. Forecast project outcomes and adjust where necessary to deliver successful project outcomes.
  • Manage client expectations and scope changes through active communication.
  • Identify and resolve client, project and/or team issues.
  • Performs various tasks, including analyzing proposed project solutions to ensure structural reliability, resource efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
Your Profile:
  • Diploma or Degree in Geomatics Engineering Technology, B.Sc. in Geomatics, or related discipline.
  • Must be an Ontario Land Surveyor (OLS) in good standing with the Association of Ontario Land Surveyors (AOLS).
  • 5+ years of previous project management experience, ideally within the engineering industry.
  • Active participation in the Ontario legal survey industry.
  • Ability to work effectively and competently with people at all levels in the organization; is a great team member.
  • Ability to work without supervision, effective time management and strong organizational skills.
  • Contribute on an on-going culture of safety in all work environments.
  • Ability to work to deadlines and see tasks through to completion.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Previous consulting experience is an asset.
  • Valid provincial driverâ€™s license required.
  • Demonstrated sensitivity and consideration for occupational health and safety.

title: Senior Drafter
description:
Department: Engineering
Reports to: Design Manager
Location: North Bay, ON. Remote work location will be considered with travel to North Bay as required
Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent, 40 hours per week
Date Posted: September 8, 2021
Application Deadline: October 5, 2021

About Cementation Canada:

You feel passionate about what you do. You made the right decision choosing your career path. The question is, are you in the right place? Is your full potential being realized, are you continuing to develop expertise in your chosen field, and does your passion remain strong? At Cementation we respect experience; we get excited about potential.

Cementation is an underground mine contracting and engineering company. We build mines. Structured to deliver design-build solutions for technically challenging projects, our people build world class shaft sinking and mine development projects. Our work requires a team approach where respect is expected and innovation is encouraged as long as safety is not compromised.

Being an employer of choice in the mining industry has always been a mainstay of our mission statement, and Cementation is proud to have been selected as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers for seven years. Open the door to new opportunities and grow with us.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Work in compliance with all Health and Safety rules and regulations for Cementation applicable to outside clients and Operations Groups projects.
  • Design and drafting for permanent and temporary works related to the construction of underground mine shafts, facilities and infrastructure.
  • Create preliminary drawings and rough layouts or sketches.
  • Collaborate with Project Services and Operations to produce "Best For Project" designs that are safe, reflect the client's operability requirements and are constructible.
  • To produce a deliverable that is on time, on budget and has correct scope in accordance with the project requirements.
  • Produce drawings that effectively and simply communicate the design and that comply with Cementation Engineering Standards and conform to job specifications with respect to clearances, tolerances and applicable codes.
  • Collaborate with the team lead, project manager and project engineer to develop design criteria and drawing layouts.
  • Review and mark-up drawings for drafting and presentation purposes.
  • Ensure all applicable safety codes and regulations are met by appropriate design and use of technology.
  • Design of buildings and equipment which incorporate client operability and maintenance requirements.
  • Design and drafting for mine development, related infrastructure and equipment for clients and Cementation Operations.
  • Development of design drawings consisting of but not limited to: site plans, general arrangements, plans and elevations for surface and underground structures, mechanical installations, equipment, concrete installations, underground development, mine shafts and related mine infrastructure.
  • Technical mentoring of drafters and designers on engineering projects under the direction of the engineer of record.
  • Check for dimensional accuracy and fit up of engineering designs.
  • Check drawings for compliance to company and governmental health and safety guidelines and regulations.
  • Identify risk and opportunities to optimize the scope, schedule and cost of the project.
  • Investigate, troubleshoot, and recommend solutions for site and client concerns and suggestions.
  • Provide project drafting and be accountable for schedule and efficiency.
  • Be accountable for drawing production and quality.
  • Show a good working knowledge and understanding of plot plans, P&IDs, PFDs, isometrics, GAs and line lists.
  • Prepare bulk material take-offs.
  • Work with designers in other disciplines to coordinate project designs.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:

  • Leadership
  • Collaborative team player.
  • Respectful and professional.
  • Excellent communicator.
  • Engaged.
  • Innovative.
  • Self starter who is responsible and accountable for their work, and the work of others.
  • Positively reacts to change.
  • Expert Knowledge in the operation of the following software: MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, TEAMS, and Vault, Autodesk Docs, AutoCAD, Revit, Advance Steel, Inventor, Revit MEP or any other Autodesk AEC and PDM collection 3D software.
  • Working knowledge of the following software considered an asset: ProjectWise, Bentley Micro-Station, Microsoft Project, SolidWorks, Hexagon Smart-3D or any other 3D parametric platforms.

Qualifications:

  • Secondary school diploma.
  • Applicable post-secondary technician or technology diploma.
  • Previous experience in heavy construction, mining or fabrication.
  • Minimum 5 years experience in drafting and design.
  • OACETT registration considered an asset.
  • Previous experience as a team lead.

All external candidates can apply by submitting their application to https://cementationjobs.applicantpool.com/jobs/

We build mines. Structured to deliver design-build solutions for technically challenging projects, our people build world class shaft sinking and mine development projects. title: Lead Piping Designer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood, the global engineering and consultancy organization, is seeking an experienced Lead Piping Designer to join our Conventional Energy team in Calgary. The Conventional Energy team in Calgary has a history of delivering some of the biggest projects in the Canadian Oilsands, with associated pipelines and refinery infrastructure, as well as a strong foothold in the energy transition supporting the rapidly growing decarbonization and renewables industry.  

 

  • Join a culture of innovation, pushing the boundaries of what is possible to seek the best solutions for our clients.
  • Our teams are making it a priority to develop flexible working arrangements that balance client, team and individual needs.

 

Responsibilities: 

  • Piping Lead Designer
    • Maintaining budgets
    • Checking Designs
    • Coordinating workloads with Calgary and HVEC
    • Create and develop 3D model

 

Skills / Qualifications

  • Diploma in Piping design, production or similar
  • 15+ years of experience in piping design
  • 5+ years leading small projects
  • Experience in Upstream and Downstream Oil Sands project preferred

Additional skills required:

  • Managing manhour budgets
  • Estimating projects
  • Proficient in AutoPlant, Cadworx, Navisworks.  Aveva experience preferred
  • Familiar with handling large Excel spreadsheets

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.
