title: Survey Party Chief
description:
Our Culture:
Our employees choose McElhanney because they value what our company does day in and day out. We are friendly, down-to-earth, collaborative, passionate, committed to safety, and contribute to the communities where we live, work, and play. Our company has a history of employees who have spent their entire careers at McElhanney – celebrating 30-, 35-, and 40-year anniversaries – thanks to rewarding projects and long-lasting relationships with amazing staff. At McElhanney, you get big company opportunities with a small company feel.

Vaccination Requirement: 
In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others.  This position requires that the successful candidate is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and as such, proof of vaccination will be required prior to the first day of employment. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.

The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Survey Party Chief to join our Major Project team in and around Alberta! Reporting to the Pipeline Division Managers of Regulatory, Cadastral and Engineering Design Surveys, Construction As-built Surveys, or Operations and Maintenance Surveys and the Project Manager on your assigned projects, you will direct the field crews to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. The successful candidate will be working on major pipeline projects throughout the full lifecycle of our client’s pipeline projects, primarily focused on providing geomatic services to our clients in the Pipeline Operations and Maintenance Division.

This is a great opportunity for a dedicated individual who enjoys working in the great outdoors, looking to gain hands on surveying experience and gain valuable experience in the pipeline industry. This is also great opportunity for an individual that is looking to grow their career in Geomatics Engineering with a well-established company.

What You Can Expect
  • Secure project work for 2+ years
  • Competitive salary, including overtime
  • Flexible work rotations suited to your needs. As per work rotations and schedules provided by our clients and their prime contractors, rotations and shift schedules may change based on the industry and project type you will be working on.
  • Camp work, accommodations and living allowance provided based on travel requirements
  • Safety Training and certification
  • Safety allowance for personal protective equipment

What You’ll Be Doing
  • Participate and contribute to McElhanney’s Heath, Safety and Environment (HSE) program.
  • Attend and participate in McElhanney’s monthly field safety meetings.
  • Attend and complete all required onboarding orientations, safety training and meet or exceed all the required elements for certification.
  • Prepare, participate, and contribute to the daily HSE Safe and Quality Production (SQP) plan and facilitate morning toolbox safety meetings.
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes.
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time.
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including pipeline, engineering, construction, and legal surveys.
  • Liaise between Project Manager and client representative.
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise, and accurate field notes, records, and calculations.
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring
  • Two-year technical diploma in Geomatics or Civil Engineering with at least 5 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Capable of working independently and taking ownership of tasks with support from office staff.
  • Physical ability to work on busy sites with varied terrain and ability to lift heavy equipment.
  • Confidence performing high precision surveys for layouts and control surveys.
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset.
  • Experience with Underground Utility Locating and Ground Disturbance is an asset.
  • Valid driver’s license required.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.

This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching.
  • Maternity and parental leave top-up.
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program, which offers support in person, online or over the phone.
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all.
  • Competitive salary, participation in our generous performance bonus plan, and opportunity to join an employee-owned firm with potential share ownership.

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio:https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation, and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

        #LI-AM3  #Junior  #LI-onsite
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

Sunny skies, a strong growing economy and no provincial sales tax make Calgary a destination of choice. With the pristine wilderness of Banff National Park less than one hour’s drive away, Calgary offers the best of two exciting worlds – from stimulating city life in Canada’s newest urban playground to the spectacular scenery and nearby outdoor adventure in the Canadian Rockies, the rolling foothills, and expansive prairies. Residents enjoy superb winter sports attractions like skiing and snowboarding which are matched in the summer by golf, hiking, mountain biking, camping, and fishing.
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

title: Senior Architectural Designer
description:
SENIOR ARCHITECTURAL DESIGNER 
Oakville, Ontario
Competitive Salary & Benefits Package
Architecture, Design and Engineering

Other titles: Architectural Design Technician, Architect, Senior Designer

A leading and reputable Architecture and Design firm is currently searching for a talented Senior Architectural Designer. This architecture firm are well known for their excellent service delivery and their portfolio is compiled largely of commercial and retail projects - they are experts in this sector. This well established firm are head officed in Toronto but have locations across Western Canada.

RESPONSIBILITIES: 
  • Develops technical designs and edits architectural drawings to ensure an exemplary solution is delivered that meets quality parameters, project timelines, and budgetary requirements.
  • Performs design activities such as programming, code research, material and building systems research, laying out program components, and calculation of program and building areas
  • Evaluates site conditions and performs site surveys
  • Reviews project products, services, and shop drawings
  • Processes permit response letters and coordinates revisions with engineers and consultants to obtain necessary documentation and permits
  • Coordinates with contractor, sub-consultants, or relevant building authorities to address and document issues with constructability or owner concerns
  • Comply with accepted project management methodology; document and manage scope, work effort, budget, cost controls, schedules
  • Integrate engineering requirements, site surveys and field review information, adhering to applicable codes and jurisdictional requirements
  • Attend meetings to coordinate drawings and resources, determine project criteria and provide information, 
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
  • Post secondary education in Architecture or Engineering. M.Arch an asset
  • 6+ years' experience as an Architectural Designer/Technician or Architect with strong experience in design 
  • Proficient in architectural and design software skills (i.e. AutoCAD, Revit, SketchUp, Photoshop etc.//0
  • Familiar with Mechanical, Electrical, and Structural permits and building codes
  • Experience working on large and complex projects in mixed use, institutional, public sector, commercial and multi-family projects
  • Demonstrate creativity in design and leadership skills
  • Prior experience in project management, project delivery, client management is required
  • Demonstrate an ability to coordinate with other team members 
  • Membership with a relevant professional architectural association is an asset
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU
  • Excellent, entrepreneurial company with a strong collaborative team and amazing reputation in the industry
  • Competitive compensation and benefits plan
  • Opportunity for professional growth and development with opportunity to lead and implement new strategies
  • Amazing opportunity to work directly with the Senior Leadership team on strategies to develop the company further
Please apply directly if you feel like you are the right candidate and are excited about this excellent opportunity.

title: Land Surveyor, Project Manager
description:
Position Overview

The Project Manager is a land surveyor responsible for managing all phases of their projects. Preference will be given to candidates with a Canada Lands Surveyor (CLS) commission or those who have previous experience working in northern communities.

The successful candidate is expected to complete duties from inception to completion of the project and is expected to potentially cover all office and field aspects of the project. They must be able to work independently and be willing to travel within Nunavut and the Northwest Territories as needed. Support will be available from Yellowknife and other Challenger offices, but will often work with one other local team member.

The Project Manager will need to be able to perform a wide spectrum of survey work including legal surveys, real property reports, subdivisions, lot boundary retracements, construction layout, topographic surveys, control surveys, and mineral claim surveys.

This position will be located out of Iqaluit, NU, and will report to the General Manager, Sub-Arctic Geomatics. The successful candidate will be required to stay in Iqaluit from June to the end of October, with the possibility of working in our Yellowknife office during the off-season. They will set up and manage our seasonal office during this time and also prepare to close down the office at the end of the season.

Other Responsibilities:

  • Meets with clients to discuss project requirements and drafts proposals based on the agreed scope of work
  • Develops each project plan and assigns tasks to appropriate field and office staff
  • Continuously monitors project progress against budgetary and profit targets, and initiate appropriate changes as required
  • Ensures each project is carried out according to the standards set out by the company's health and safety program; regulatory requirements; professional requirements; and Challenger policy and procedures
  • Keeps abreast of technical, professional, or regulatory developments affecting the field and office procedures and is knowledgeable to expert in their use
  • Provides the information required for the development of proposals, project reports, client invoices and assist in collections on an as-required basis
  • Meets with local communities and different individuals on behalf of Challenger / Sub-Arctic and promotes our company and services

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Familiarity with logistics of working and traveling in the Northwest Territories and Nunavut
  • Solid working knowledge of MicroSurvey or Carlson, AutoCAD and the operation of Leica GPS and Total Station instruments.
  • Experience in the survey of mineral claims in the Northwest Territories and Nunavut an asset.

Qualifications:

  • 3 to 5 years of field and project management experience.
  • Degree from a Geomatics Engineering Technology program is considered an asset.


Corporate Overview:

Sub-Arctic Geomatics (Sub-Arctic), a Challenger Geomatics Ltd. company, is a professional northern survey firm with headquarters in Yellowknife and a seasonal field office in Iqaluit. Since 1992, Sub-Arctic has provided quality survey and geomatics services for a wide range of projects in Yellowknife, Iqaluit and across the Canadian North. Sub-Arctic has an excellent history of managing the relationships, logistics, and delivery of survey and geomatics services for projects in nearly every northern community and region. Since its inception, Sub-Arctic also holds the distinction of having been involved in the exploration and construction of every diamond mine in the north, and of having prepared approximately one-third of all Plans of Survey registered in the Northwest Territories and Nunavut.

We offer challenging and rewarding employment along with on the job training and educational courses that allow our team members to rise to their full potential. We pride ourselves in offering opportunities for growth across all our offices. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages to our employees. We are always looking for "talent"- people who will be challenged and engaged in a growing company. We know that it is through our talent that we can continue to attain our goals and realize our vision

title: Intermediate CAD Drafter/Designer - Water and Wastewater Group - Work from Anywhere in Central / Southern Alberta!
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Work from Anywhere in Central / Southern Alberta!

 

Wood (Southern Alberta Water and Wastewater group) is seeking a Junior / Intermediate (CAD) Drafter/Designer with experience in Civil Water and/or Infrastructure Projects to support a rapidly growing Design team. The ideal candidate will be an energetic, self-motivated professional with experience in preparing construction drawings for civil projects using AutoCAD Civil 3D.

 

This position can be based anywhere in Central / Southern Alberta!

 

The successful candidate will work in a team environment where experienced senior staff are supported by intermediate and junior technical staff.  Intermediate staff are expected to be self-starters with a desire to grow the business and support the development of younger staff.  Suitable candidates will enjoy working in a team environment and bring strengths in oral and written communication.

 

Responsibilities include:

  • Preparation of report figures and construction drawings as directed by Project Engineers;
  • Developing 3D models using AutoCAD Civil 3D; and
  • Adhering to company and client CAD Standards and Procedures.

 

Skills / Qualifications

  • Engineering Design & Drafting Technology diploma from a recognized community college;
  • 3+ years of AutoCAD Civil 3D experience;
  • BIM 360 / Autodesk Construction Cloud experience an asset;
  • Experience with Autodesk Revit (Structural) an asset;
  • Experience with Civil Water Projects (i.e., ponds, ditches, dams, spillways, concrete structures) or Municipal Infrastructure projects (i.e., roads, buried utilities, site servicing);
  • Good organizational, technical, writing, communication and computer skills; and
  • Ability to follow directions and communicate effectively in a team environment.

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Survey Crew Chief
description:
At GeoVerra, itâ€™s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means youâ€™ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If youâ€™re most at home in the outdoorsâ€”where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkersâ€”then our Crew Chief position might be the perfect fit.

The Partnership Promise

This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You GeoVerra

Our new Crew Chief in Calgary must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

What GV Provides

  • Full time, flexible benefits program, RRSP match, wellness days, and paid vacation time
  • Paid training for all safety tickets required

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and perform field survey work with the help of Survey Assistants;
  • Liaise with Project Managers to coordinate field survey work, to review and manage project budgets, timeline requirements, priorities and survey methodology;
  • Act as a company representative, liaising directly with client field representatives and land owners;
  • Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Survey Assistants working with you;
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of industry best practices, more efficient field processes and procedures and the innovative use of new technology; 
  • Actively participate in and proactively support the advancement of the GeoVerra safety program;
  • Some office technical survey work may be required in this position; and
  • Other duties as assigned/required.

Required Skills, Experience, & Behaviours

  • Our successful candidate will be a graduate of a recognized post-secondary program related to surveying and geomatics or have an equivalent amount of related experience;
  • Strong working knowledge of survey equipment and software such as GPS and Total Stations (Including Robotic);
  • Knowledge and experience of Trimble equipment and software, laser scanning and line locating would be considered an asset;
  • Strong problem solving skills in a field environment;
  • Effective communication skills - verbal and written; ability to produce accurate and legible field notes;
  • The ability to develop and motivate survey staff and work well in a team environment;
  • An aptitude for delivering projects on time and budget;
  • A valid driverâ€™s license and can provide a clean driverâ€™s abstract; and
  • Pre Employment Drug and Alcohol Testing;
  • All employment offers for Safety Sensitive positions are conditional upon the successful completion of a Negative Drug Screen and Passing Alcohol Screen. 

Working Conditions

Out of town work and frequent travel required;
Ability to carry, lift and push 50lbs on a regular basis;
Ability to work outside in all weather conditions;

 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Survey Technologist
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Survey Technologist to join our team in Prince George, BC! Reporting to the Project Manager, you will direct the field crew to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. You may be involved in engineering, construction, or legal surveying in urban and/or rural areas.

Why go north? The town of Prince George offers a small town, tight-knit community feel with affordable housing, local schools and no traffic. Hike, fish, ski, golf, canoe, camp, mountain bike, sled, trail run or hunt – this town offers it all!

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including engineering, construction, and legal surveys
  • Liaise between Project Manager and onsite client representative
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Two-year technical diploma in geomatics, civil engineering or Mineral exploration and mining technology with 0-2 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Physically fit, able to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas, and willing to work in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset
  • Valid driver’s license required
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.
Note: This role is designated as a safety sensitive position. The ability to travel and work out of town in remote areas for extended periods of time is required. Pre-employment drug and alcohol testing will be on-going and unscheduled as required.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching
  • Employee & Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support online or over the phone
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Competitive salary, participation in our generous performance bonus plan
  • Continuous support for your growth through professional development reimbursement, mentorship programs, and opportunity to join numerous internal committees.

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio


Vaccination Requirement

In accordance with the recommendations and guidance provided by government health authorities, McElhanney strongly encourages all employees to get fully vaccinated to protect themselves and others against the health and safety risks and the transmission of COVID-19 to others.  This position requires that the successful candidate is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and as such, proof of vaccination will be required prior to the first day of employment. McElhanney will consider all accommodations required due to a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation.
 

About McElhanney

Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation, and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

  #LI-AM3  #LI-Junior #LI-Hybrid
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

  • Ability to follow directions and communicate effectively in a team environment.

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Construction Survey Crew Chief
description:
At GeoVerra, itâ€™s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means youâ€™ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If youâ€™re most at home in the outdoorsâ€”where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkersâ€”then our Construction Survey Crew Chief position might be the perfect fit.

Our company is in acceleration mode. GeoVerraâ€™s growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your career here will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

The most important thing to know? Weâ€™re a team of experienced and professional employees who genuinely believe in the work we do. We support each other in a safe and positive working environment. At GeoVerra, you never go at it alone. Dig deeper. Broaden your horizons. Weâ€™re here for it all. And with fantastic benefits, work-life balance, and professional development options, we make it easier to chase your dreams.

The Partnership Promise
This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You GeoVerra
Our new Construction Survey Crew Chief must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have
an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

This position requires a quick and engaged learner, with proven success in adaptability, productivity and high physical capabilities. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with strong communication skills and an infectious positivity that encourages this attitude in all team members. You will have a strong handle on equipment and field tools, with a healthy respect for the outdoors and the timeline of
the task at hand.

Key Position Details

  • Full time, flexible benefits program, RRSP match, wellness days, and paid vacation time
  • 2 weeks on and 2 weeks off rotation
  • 10-hour day and night shifts (night shifts receive premiums)
  • Travel to and from Northern Ontario mining site and accommodation included
  • Paid training for all safety tickets required

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and perform field survey work with the help of Survey Assistants;
  • Liaise with Project Managers to coordinate field survey work, to review and manage project budgets, timeline requirements, priorities and survey methodology;
  • Act as a company representative, liaising directly with client field representatives and land owners;
  • Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Survey Assistants working with you;
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of industry best practices, more efficient field processes and procedures and the innovative use of new technology; 
  • Actively participate in and proactively support the advancement of the GeoVerra safety program;
  • Some office technical survey work may be required in this position; and
  • Other duties as assigned/required.

Required Skills, Experience, & Behaviours

  • Our successful candidate will be a graduate of a recognized post-secondary program related to surveying and geomatics or have an equivalent amount of related experience;
  • Minimum 1 year of experience in a Construction Survey Crew Chief role;
  • Strong working knowledge of survey equipment and software such as GPS and Total Stations (Including Robotic);
  • Knowledge and experience of Trimble equipment and software, laser scanning and line locating would be considered an asset;
  • Strong problem solving skills in a field environment;
  • Effective communication skills - verbal and written; ability to produce accurate and legible field notes;
  • The ability to develop and motivate survey staff and work well in a team environment;
  • An aptitude for delivering projects on time and budget;
  • A valid driverâ€™s license and can provide a clean driverâ€™s abstract; and
  • Pre Employment Drug and Alcohol Testing;
  • All employment offers for Safety Sensitive positions are conditional upon the successful completion of a Negative Drug Screen and Passing Alcohol Screen. 

Working Conditions

Out of town work and frequent travel required;
Ability to carry, lift and push 50lbs on a regular basis;
Ability to work outside in all weather conditions;

 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

title: Field Survey Technologist
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Field Survey Technicianjoin our team! Reporting to the Project Manager or Field Supervisor, you will direct the field crew to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. You will also be involved in engineering, construction or legal surveying in rural and remote areas.

There is a significant opportunity to work in the emerging local markets with projects across western Canada to keep you busy. This is a great opportunity for an individual that is looking to further their career in Geomatics Engineering with a well-established company.

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including engineering, construction, and legal surveys
  • Liaise between Project Manager and client representative
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Two-year technical diploma or degree in geomatics or civil engineering with up to 5 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Physically fit, able to lift heavy equipment, willing to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, able to work in wildlife populated areas, and willing to work in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset
  • Valid driver’s license required
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.

Note: The ability to travel and work out of town in remote areas for extended periods of time is required. Pre-employment drug and alcohol testing will be on-going and unscheduled as required.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching
  • Employee & Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support online or over the phone
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Competitive salary, participation in our generous performance bonus plan, and opportunity to join an employee-owned firm with potential share ownership
  • Continuous support for your growth through professional development reimbursement, mentorship programs, and opportunity to join numerous internal committees.

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

#LI-AM3     #intermediate
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor
McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

title: Drafter, Intermediate
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood currently has an exciting opportunity for an Intermediate Drafter. Reporting to the Electrical Department Manager, this position is located in our Vancouver, BC office. If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

 

Key Responsibilities

 

  • Creating drawings and diagrams under the direct supervision of an Engineer or Designer such as: General arrangements, sections, elevations, bills of materials, cable, duct, and bolt schedules, electrical room layouts, equipment layouts, grounding layouts, panel layouts, single line, three line and DC schematics and wiring drawings
  • Supporting overhead, crossings, and underground distribution design work.
  • Create plans, profiles and cross sections from surveys and maps.
  • Retrieving, entering, and updating design data within drawings
  • Creating all aspects of design documentation including e-mails, letters, memos, forms, schedules, work plans, and technical reports
  • Checking drawings for conflicts and conformance with project CAD Engineering standards
Skills / Qualifications:
  • Diploma in Computer Aided Design technology from an accredited University/College or equivalent
  • Minimum 5 year experience in direct industrial, mining or process plant experience or transmission and distribution design
  • Knowledge of AutoCAD, MicroStation and MS Office
  • Proficient in 2D/3D, Isometric CAD drafting & manual drafting
  • Familiarity in Civil 3D, GIS, Inventor, Raster Design, Auto Turn or REVIT is an asset
  • Familiarity with LISP, VBA programming for AutoCAD is considered an asset
  • Knowledge and experience using electrical safety design codes
  • Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
  • Open minded and fast learner
  • Good verbal and written communication skills are required
  • Must be able to handle multiple tasks and functions
  • Ability to work independently and in a multi-disciplinary team environment with minimal supervision
  • Effective organizational and time management skills with the ability to work in a fast-paced, high volume and deadline-driven environment
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship
  • Clean driving record/abstract
Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO):

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Party Chief
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Party Chief to join our team in Fort St. John, BC This is a great opportunity for an experienced surveying professional to join career enhancing projects in the Northeast of BC. In this role, you will lead a team in completing local surveying projects in the resource industry, including facilities and pipelines, and construction and legal work. If you’re looking to take the next step in your career, this position may be the right step for you to grow your career in the Geomatics Engineering with a well-established company.

The ability to travel and work out of town for extended periods and pre-employment drug & alcohol and fitness for work testing is required.

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Work with Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including engineering, construction, and legal surveys.
  • Liaise between Project Manager and client representative
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance
  • Provide coaching and supervision to junior staff and survey assistants.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Two-year technical diploma in geomatics or related field
    • 0-4 years of experience for junior candidates
    • 5+ years of experience for intermediate/senior candidates.
  • Physical ability to lift heavy equipment
  • Willingness to work in varied environmental conditions, including wildlife populated areas and in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset
  • Must possess and maintain a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.

About Fort St. John
Located in the heart of the majestic Peace River country, Fort St. John is the largest city in Northeastern BC and supports a trading area of more than 70,000 people in the city and outlying service region. The population is dynamic, young, and energetic and, as the population continues to grow, so does the supply of retail shopping and other amenities. The friendly, small town feel is matched with big city amenities, creating a fantastic combination for many to call home. Fort St. John offers top-notch indoor recreation facilities and endless opportunities for outdoor adventures, and being “The Energetic City”, has hundreds of events taking place every year that entertain people of all ages and interests.

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation, and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

Lead projects and manage junior staff with minimal direction from Principal in Charge and work directly with clients. title: Drafter, Intermediate
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood currently has an exciting opportunity for an Intermediate Drafter. Reporting to the Electrical Department Manager, this position is located in our Vancouver, BC office. If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

 

Key Responsibilities

 

  • Creating drawings and diagrams under the direct supervision of an Engineer or Designer such as: General arrangements, sections, elevations, bills of materials, cable, duct, and bolt schedules, electrical room layouts, equipment layouts, grounding layouts, panel layouts, single line, three line and DC schematics and wiring drawings
  • Supporting overhead, crossings, and underground distribution design work.
  • Create plans, profiles and cross sections from surveys and maps.
  • Retrieving, entering, and updating design data within drawings
  • Creating all aspects of design documentation including e-mails, letters, memos, forms, schedules, work plans, and technical reports
  • Checking drawings for conflicts and conformance with project CAD Engineering standards

Skills / Qualifications

  • Diploma in Computer Aided Design technology from an accredited University/College or equivalent
  • Minimum 5 year experience in direct industrial, mining or process plant experience or transmission and distribution design
  • Knowledge of AutoCAD, MicroStation and MS Office
  • Proficient in 2D/3D, Isometric CAD drafting & manual drafting
  • Familiarity in Civil 3D, GIS, Inventor, Raster Design, Auto Turn or REVIT is an asset
  • Familiarity with LISP, VBA programming for AutoCAD is considered an asset
  • Knowledge and experience using electrical safety design codes
  • Excellent attention to detail and accuracy
  • Open minded and fast learner
  • Good verbal and written communication skills are required
  • Must be able to handle multiple tasks and functions
  • Ability to work independently and in a multi-disciplinary team environment with minimal supervision
  • Effective organizational and time management skills with the ability to work in a fast-paced, high volume and deadline-driven environment
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship
  • Clean driving record/abstract

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Survey Crew Chief
description:
At GeoVerra, itâ€™s about more than surveying land. Joining our team means youâ€™ll step into a career with wide-open opportunities. Experience new places, challenges that grow you, and a dynamic pace of work in which two days are never the same. If youâ€™re most at home in the outdoorsâ€”where fresh air, towering trees and occasional wildlife become your second-favourite coworkersâ€”then our Construction Survey Crew Chief position might be the perfect fit.

Our company is in acceleration mode. GeoVerraâ€™s growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your career here will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it. We value your sharp skills, creative mind, and technical brain.

The most important thing to know? Weâ€™re a team of experienced and professional employees who genuinely believe in the work we do. We support each other in a safe and positive working environment. At GeoVerra, you never go at it alone. Dig deeper. Broaden your horizons. Weâ€™re here for it all. And with fantastic benefits, work-life balance, and professional development options, we make it easier to chase your dreams.

The Partnership Promise
This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family.

You GeoVerra
Our new Crew Chief in Vernon, BC must be passionate about spending time in the field. Whether you have a technical background or love exploring every nook and cranny outside, you should have
an unquenchable thirst for seeing and doing it all.

This position requires a quick and engaged learner, with proven success in adaptability, productivity and high physical capabilities. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with strong communication skills and an infectious positivity that encourages this attitude in all team members. You will have a strong handle on equipment and field tools, with a healthy respect for the outdoors and the timeline of
the task at hand.

Key Position Details

  • Full time, flexible benefits program, RRSP match, wellness days, and paid vacation time
  • Paid training for all safety tickets required

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and perform field survey work with the help of Survey Assistants;
  • Liaise with Project Managers to coordinate field survey work, to review and manage project budgets, timeline requirements, priorities and survey methodology;
  • Act as a company representative, liaising directly with client field representatives and land owners;
  • Prepare and communicate field notes, sketches, checklists and digital data in required formats for Project Managers, Land Surveyors and Drafting personnel;
  • Provide guidance and mentorship to Survey Assistants working with you;
  • Contribute to the development and implementation of industry best practices, more efficient field processes and procedures and the innovative use of new technology; 
  • Actively participate in and proactively support the advancement of the GeoVerra safety program;
  • Some office technical survey work may be required in this position; and
  • Other duties as assigned/required.

Required Skills, Experience, & Behaviours

  • Our successful candidate will be a graduate of a recognized post-secondary program related to surveying and geomatics or have an equivalent amount of related experience;
  • Minimum 1 year of experience in a Construction Survey Crew Chief role;
  • Strong working knowledge of survey equipment and software such as GPS and Total Stations (Including Robotic);
  • Knowledge and experience of Trimble equipment and software, laser scanning and line locating would be considered an asset;
  • Strong problem solving skills in a field environment;
  • Effective communication skills - verbal and written; ability to produce accurate and legible field notes;
  • The ability to develop and motivate survey staff and work well in a team environment;
  • An aptitude for delivering projects on time and budget;
  • A valid driverâ€™s license and can provide a clean driverâ€™s abstract; and
  • Pre Employment Drug and Alcohol Testing;
  • All employment offers for Safety Sensitive positions are conditional upon the successful completion of a Negative Drug Screen and Passing Alcohol Screen. 

Working Conditions

Out of town work and frequent travel required;
Ability to carry, lift and push 50lbs on a regular basis;
Ability to work outside in all weather conditions;

 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

title: Survey Party Chief
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney Ltd. has an opportunity for a Survey Party Chief to join our team in either Calgary, Lethbridge or Medicine Hat! Reporting to the Project Manager you will direct the field crew to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. Within this role, you will be involved in surveying resource industry related facilities and pipelines and local construction and legal work in the Calgary area. There is also a significant opportunity to work one some major pipeline projects situation. This is a great opportunity for an individual that is looking to grow their career in Geomatics Engineering with a well-established company.
 
  • Pre-employment drug and alcohol testing will be on-going and unscheduled as required.
  • Must maintain a valid class 5 operators license and a clean driving record.

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including well site(s), right of way(s), pipeline construction, urban, construction and legal
  • Liaise between Project Manager and client representative
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Two-year technical diploma in Geomatics and combination of 3 years of previous experience in a similar role
  • Experience using snowmobiles and ATVs
  • Ability to travel out of town for periods of time
  • Must possess and maintain a valid driver’s license and clean driving record
  • Previous pipeline construction survey experience is considered an asset
  • Physical ability to work in mountainous/forested/coastal terrain and remote areas
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.
This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals. 
Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.
              #LI-AM3       #Intermediate
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.
McElhanney is aware of activities where individuals have received fraudulent job offers. Please be advised that McElhanney will not ask applicants for any form of monetary exchange at any point in the recruitment process. To learn more visit: www.mcelhanney.com/careers/fraud-warning

The disclosure of your information in accordance with this Policy and applicable law, including to third party service providers may result in your personal information being transferred outside of Canada, including to the United States. Such transferred personal information may be subject to the laws of these other countries and the laws of other countries regarding the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information may be different from the laws of Canada.

title: Piping Designer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities:

Wood in Calgary / Edmonton is looking to add   Piping Designers to our Conventional Energy team for a fixed term of approximately 6-12 Months.

 

Responsibilities

  • PID Drafting
  • Create and develop 3D model using AutoPlant, CADWorx and OpenPlant
  • Experience Modeling Pipelines and CPF's
  • Drafting General Arrangement drawing
  • Creating Isometrics
  • Plant Layout drawings

 

Skills / Qualifications:
  • Diploma in  Process Piping Drafting
  • 2 years min of experience in piping design and drafting
  • Candidate will be required to live within commutable distance to Calgary

Additional skills required:

 

  • Familiar with handling large Excel spreadsheets
  • Good communication skills

 

Company Overview:

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the worldâ€™s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

title: Survey Party Chief
description:
The Opportunity: 
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Survey Party Chief to join our team in Edson or Whitecourt! Reporting to the Project Manager, you will direct the field crew to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. Within this role, you will be involved in surveying at remote and local locations primarily for resource industry related facilities and pipelines and construction and legal work.  There is also a significant opportunity to work one some major pipeline projects situated in the area and throughout Alberta and BC.  This is a great opportunity for an individual that is looking to grow their career in Geomatics Engineering with a well-established company.

The ability to travel and work out of town is required and pre-employment drug & alcohol and fitness for work testing is required.

What You Can Expect:
  • Secure project work for 2+ years
  • Overtime earned at time and a half
  • Flexible work rotations suited to your needs
  • Camp work, accommodations and living allowance provided based on travel requirements
  • Hands on training and safety allowance for personal protective equipment

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Work on multi-disciplinary projects with our team of Surveyors, Engineers, Landscape Architects and Environmental Professionals
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including engineering, construction, and legal surveys
  • Liaise between Project Manager and client representative
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise, and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Two-year technical diploma in Geomatics or Civil Engineering with at least 5 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Capable of working independently and taking ownership of tasks with support from office staff
  • Physical ability to work in on busy sites with varied terrain and ability to lift heavy equipment.
  • Confidence performing high precision surveys for layouts and control surveys
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset
  • Experience with Underground Utility Locating is an asset
  • Valid driver’s license required
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge
This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio:https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose: Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.
              #LI-AM3       #Junior
If this is the opportunity for you, apply now or visit www.mcelhanney.com/careers to apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

McElhanney is committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion which celebrates the successes that comes from a team diverse in expertise, experiences, and perspectives. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, welcoming all ethnicities, religions, colour, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, or people with disabilities. Requests for accommodations can be made at any stage of the selection process.

title: Piping Designer
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood in Calgary / Edmonton is looking to add  Piping Designers to our Conventional Energy team for a fixed term of approximately 6-12 Months.

 

Responsibilities

  • PID Drafting
  • Create and develop 3D model using AutoPlant, CADWorx and OpenPlant
  • Experience Modeling Pipelines and CPF's
  • Drafting General Arrangement drawing
  • Creating Isometrics
  • Plant Layout drawings

 

Skills / Qualifications

  • Diploma in Process Piping Drafting
  • 2 years min of experience in piping design and drafting
  • Candidate will be required to live within commutable distance to Calgary

Additional skills required:

 

  • Familiar with handling large Excel spreadsheets
  • Good communication skills

 

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.

title: Land Surveyor in Training
description:
The Opportunity: 
McElhanney is looking for a Land Surveyor in Training for our Kelowna, BC office to manage land development and infrastructure projects, utility right of way surveys, topographic surveys, construction and engineering layout, surveys on provincial and First Nations lands, and to provide advice to clients.    

This is a fantastic opportunity for an enthusiastic new graduate looking to kick start their career in geomatics. The successful individual will undergo training and mentorship under the experienced guidance of a senior land surveyor to further develop their project management and technical skills.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Working in a team setting to establish project scope, budget and schedule, and other project or client expectations
  • Leading survey crews on projects; communicating scope and scheduling information to crew members
  • Managing project budgets and financial reporting
  • Managing various survey project types including statutory surveys including land development (subdivisions) and infrastructure, topographic, engineering and construction layout
  • Liaising with both internal (McElhanney) and external Project Managers and clients
  • Managing information flow from field to final deliverables
  • Ensuring quality assurance procedures are carried out for proposals, field returns, drawings, legal plans, documents, and other deliverables
  • Providing advice to clients on property and legal survey matters
  • Other duties as required.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Registered Land Surveyor in Training or eligibility to register
  • Two-year technical diploma in Geomatics and previous experience in a similar role
  • Proficiency in computer applications (MSCAD and GNSS processing software at minimum)
  • Ability to travel out of town for periods of time
  • Must possess and maintain a valid driver’s license and clean driving record
  • Physical ability to work in mountainous/forested/coastal terrain and remote areas
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.

This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Great benefits, including extended health & dental coverage, healthcare spending account, & RRSP matching
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Competitive salary and participation in our generous Performance Bonus Plan
  • Financial assistance with relocation if applicable
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Continuous support for your professional development and growth
  • Employee and Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support for all employees and their families either online or over the phone

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio:https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

title: Survey Branch Lead
description:
GeoVerra is in acceleration mode. Our growth is based on real partnerships, and we credit it to the people and culture that make us who we are to set us apart. In fact, your GeoVerra career will be unique to you, and thatâ€™s how we like it.

You GeoVerra 
Our new Branch Lead in Mississauga will lead by example: Professional. Positive. Productive. Ideally, you are organized and highly collaborative, with excellent communication skills. New ideas or creative flow is important tooâ€”hit us with the strategies or suggestions that makes our team operate even better. Weâ€™re passionate about learning every day and being impactfulâ€”and our professional staff reflects that in their daily work. 

The primary purpose of this role is to provide operational leadership and direction for the Mississauga office in Ontario. The Branch Lead is responsible for the daily operations, leading a team of land surveyors and geomatics professionals, in collaboration with other branch offices and GeoVerra business support teams. This role will work closely with the VP, Geomatics, Ontario to ensure successful project delivery within the region, and to develop organizational objectives that deliver operational performance. A Branch Lead is a leadership position and has significant impact with external clients and internal team members, and therefore needs to be connected and live out the Companyâ€™s Vision, Mission and Values through actions and results.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead project delivery teams to deliver quality work on time and on budget.
  • Support operational activities in coordination with the Field Crew Coordinator and CAD Team Lead.
  • Provide expert advice to internal team members and clientele in the field of land surveying and geomatics.
  • Manage day-to-day facilities operation in coordination with administration and the Property Manager.
  • Promote a positive workplace culture aligned with GeoVerraâ€™s social initiatives.
  • Be a performance leader, improve profitability of projects through effective planning, active scope/schedule management, and forecast project outcomes and adjust where necessary to deliver successful outcomes.
  • Support Project Managers in client and project expectations, scope creep and scope changes through active communication.
  • Conduct Management Field Observations on a regular basis to discuss safety with employees and ensure that safe working conditions are being maintained in accordance with GeoVerraâ€™s standards.
  • Ensure that quality, safety, legislation, and industry standards and specifications are met or exceeded.
  • Take appropriate action to minimize operational performance gaps.
  • Be a trusted mentor, manage and develop team members toward a successful career.
  • Lead and/or assist in preparing quality proposals in conjunction with our proposal office that meet the clientâ€™s requirements.
  • Participate in industry associations and proactively work to raise local GeoVerra brand awareness.
  • Be a change leader, take responsibility to understand various national initiatives and provide support and training to staff to implement these locally.
  • As part of our on-going commitment to employee engagement and our strategic promise to retain and develop top talent, leaders will develop and implement engagement action plans aimed at increasing retention and reducing turnover.
  • Partner with the Human Resources team and actively participate in the recruitment process to effectively manage your workforce needs.

Required Skills and Behaviours

  • Diploma or Degree in Geomatics Engineering Technology, B.Sc. in Geomatics or related discipline.
  • 10 years of experience surveying and geomatics.
  • 5 years of experience in a leadership role.
  • Ontario Land Surveyor (OLS) designation is an asset.
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) designation is an asset.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Expert knowledge in project management fundamentals through the entire project life cycle.
  • Expert knowledge of laws, regulations, statutes, and codes pertaining to project impacts and Land Surveying services.
  • Knowledge of project financial processes including estimating, managing and controlling costs, operating profit/margins, and forecasting.

What GeoVerra can offer you:

  • Competitive compensation 
  • Comprehensive benefits coverage, vacation, wellness days, and RRSP matching contributions 
  • Tools and services to support your mental wellness 
  • Flexible workplace program to suit your needs 
  • Work-life balance 
  • Growth and advancement opportunities 
  • Paid professional dues 
  • Continuing education and professional development 
  • Use of leading-edge technology and equipment 
  • Diverse projects and a fast-paced working environment 
  • Support to the communities we live and work in 

The Partnership Promise 
This is our commitment to provide responsive, trustworthy, industry expertise and a solutions-oriented approach to our clients, but we extend this way of thinking in all we do. It shows up in the form of work ethic, teamwork, safety and support for our GeoVerra family. 
 

At this time GeoVerra does not mandate COVID-19 vaccine for employees. With that, many GeoVerra clients have incorporated proof of vaccine practices due to COVID-19 and this may require you to provide proof of immunization when accessing their sites.

GeoVerra has every intention of fostering diversity within and across our organization. We welcome those who would contribute to the further diversification of our staff including, but not limited to, women, visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Piping Designer , Lead
description:
Overview / Responsibilities

Wood Mining & Minerals business performs consulting and EPCM services for many of the world’s leading mining companies and is executing world-class projects on five continents. 

 

Wood is seeking a Lead Piping Designer to join our Mining & Minerals business group. Reporting to the Engineering Manager, this position is located in our Vancouver, BC office.  This role has overall responsibility for providing design and technical support for the layout, design, supporting and specification of piping and components for industrial plants and mining infrastructure. If you have a successful track record and thrive on challenges in a fast paced environment, this is the opportunity for you.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Providing design and technical support for the layout, design, supporting and specification of piping and components for mining projects
  • Providing conceptual front end design and material take-offs
  • Designing and drafting of piping and auxiliary components in 2D and 3D drawing environments
  • Preparing and verifying designs on site including creation of tie-in drawings
  • Reviewing project documents for scope, presentation and technical accuracy
  • Providing project management skills including man-hour estimating, budget control and scheduling
  • Leading work groups and project teams
  • Supervising and mentoring junior and intermediate staff
  • Establishing good working relationships and communication with area leads, department managers, clients and other team members to coordinate, ensuring the compatibility of design

Skills / Qualifications

  • Degree or Diploma in Mechanical Engineering or Engineering Design technology
  • 10+ years experience in piping design of mining facilities
  • Proven experience and proficiency with AutoCAD 2D and PDMS 3D design/drafting
  • Site experience
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work efficiently and effectively when managing multiple tasks
  • Ability to work independently and in a multi-disciplinary team environment
  • Self-motivated with good leadership and interpersonal skills (past leadership experience is an asset)

Company Overview

Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in more than 60 countries, employing around 40,000 people. www.woodplc.com

Diversity Statement (EEO)

We are an equal opportunity employer that recognises the value of a diverse workforce. All suitably qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective criteria and without regard to the following (which is a non-exhaustive list): race, colour, age, religion, gender, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other characteristics in accordance with the relevant governing laws.
