title: Survey Technologist
description:
The Opportunity: 
McElhanney Ltd. is looking for a Survey Technologist to join our Survey Team in Campbell River, BC. This is a great opportunity for an experienced individual who would like to be exposed to a mixture of office and field experience. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work alongside a team of survey assistants, technicians, and land surveyors on a variety of legal, topographic and construction surveys.

Learn more the benefits associated with living and working in Campbell River here.

What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Interpret field data in order to create accurate survey drawings and legal plans, which will include downloading and editing field data, interpreting field notes and sketches, and processing conventional and GPS data
  • Interpret Engineering plans for layout and quantities as well as quality assurance checks on heavy civil construction projects
  • Complete calculations as needed and prepare for drafting or client project reporting
  • Liaising with Project Managers and clients regarding enquiries and issues;
  • Implementing and ensuring quality assurance on all field returns
  • Take instructions from the project manager for performance of office tasks.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Degree or technical diploma in Geomatics with at least 3 years of progressive experience in a survey tech/party chief role; experience in legal and engineering surveys is a strong asset  
  • Experience with AutoCAD and survey computation software and/or GPS 
  • Knowledge of survey and boundary calculation, geodetic coordinate systems and map projections
  • Capable of computations and assessment of found legal evidence in the field when necessary
  • Understanding of the BC Land titles system
  • Strong communication, leadership, and motivational skills
  • Ability to travel for field positions, sometimes for extended periods
  • Ability to work effectively in various geographical settings, weather conditions, and climates.
This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Flexible work hours to accommodate your busy lifestyle
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching
  • Employee & Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support online or over the phone
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Competitive salary, participation in our generous performance bonus plan, and opportunity to join an employee-owned firm with potential share ownership
  • Financial assistance to support your relocation
  • Continuous support for your growth through professional development reimbursement, mentorship programs, and opportunity to join numerous internal committees.

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.

Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.

To learn more about employee experience at McElhanney, visit us on Glassdoor 

 Known as the “Salmon Capital of the World”, Campbell River is located on the east coast of Vancouver Island and offers sensational outdoor recreation opportunities including kayaking, hiking, skiing, whale-watching, fishing, and golfing. Residents of Campbell River enjoy year-round mild climates, spectacular views and a thriving arts community.

title: Party Chief
description:
The Opportunity:
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Party Chief to join our team in Lloydminster, AB! Reporting to the Project Manager or Field Supervisor, within this role, you will be involved in surveying resource industry related facilities and pipelines and local construction and legal work in Lloydminster. This is a great opportunity for an individual that is looking to grow their career in Geomatics Engineering with a well-established company.
 
  • The ability to travel and work out of town in remote areas for extended periods of time is required
  • Pre-employment drug and alcohol testing will be on-going and unscheduled as required.

What You Can Expect
  • Overtime earned at time and a half.
  • Flexible work rotations suited to your needs.
  • Camp work, accommodations, and living allowance provided based on travel requirements.
  • Hands on training and safety allowance for personal protective equipment.

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including oil and gas well sites and pipelines, engineering, construction, and legal surveys
  • Liaise between Project Manager and client representative
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring:
  • A high school diploma; technical diploma and previous experience is an asset but not required.
  • Physical ability to lift heavy equipment.
  • Willingness to work in varied environmental conditions, including wildlife populated areas and in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours.
  • Must possess and maintain a valid driver’s license with a clean driving record.
  • Ability to travel out of town for up to three-week periods.
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, and general computer knowledge.
  • Pre-employment drug and alcohol and fitness for work testing is required. 
This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio:https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

title: Survey Party Chief
description:
The Opportunity: 
McElhanneyis looking for a Survey Party Chiefto join our Survey Team in Victoria, BC. This is a great opportunity for an experienced individual who would like to be exposed to field experience. Within this role, you will be involved in surveying at local locations primarily for resource industry related facilities, construction layouts, land development and scanning work. There is also a significant opportunity to work on projects using drones and scanning technology. This is a great opportunity for an individual that is looking to grow their career in Geomatics Engineering with a well-established company.

For additional information on Vancouver Island teams, visit our customized Vancouver Island careers page.

What You Can Expect:

  • Secure project work for 2+ years
  • Overtime earned at time and a half
  • Flexible work rotations suited to your needs
  • Camp work, accommodations and living allowance provided based on travel requirements
  • Hands on training and safety allowance for personal protective equipment

What You’ll Be Doing:
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise, and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Interpret field data in order to create accurate survey drawings and legal plans, which will include downloading and editing field data, interpreting field notes and sketches, and processing conventional and GPS data
  • Interpret Engineering plans for layout and quantities as well as quality assurance checks on civil construction projects
  • Complete calculations as needed and prepare for drafting or client project reporting
  • Liaising with Project Managers and clients regarding enquiries and issues;
  • Implementing and ensuring quality assurance on all field returns
  • Take instructions from the project manager for performance of office tasks.
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

What You’ll Bring:
  • Two-year technical diploma in Geomatics or Civil Engineering with at least 5 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Capable of working independently and taking ownership of tasks with support from office staff
  • Physical ability to work in on busy sites with varied terrain and ability to lift heavy equipment.
  • Confidence performing high precision surveys for layouts and control surveys
  • Experience with Civil 3D, MicroSurvey and Trimble Business Centre is an asset
  • Valid driver’s license required
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge
  • Ability to travel for field positions, sometimes for extended periods
  • Ability to work effectively in various geographical settings, weather conditions, and climates.

This role is designated as a safety sensitive position.

What Can We Offer You?
  • Maternity leave top-up and parental leave
  • Extended health and dental coverage, healthcare spending account, and RRSP matching
  • Employee & Family assistance program, which offers 24/7 support online or over the phone
  • A workplace culture that is characterized by respect and inclusion for all
  • Competitive salary, participation in our generous performance bonus plan, and opportunity to join an employee-owned firm with potential share ownership
  • Financial assistance to support your relocation
  • Continuous support for your growth through professional development reimbursement, mentorship programs, and opportunity to join numerous internal committees.

For a full review of our projects, please visit our online portfolio: https://www.mcelhanney.com/portfolio

title: Survey Party Chief
description:
Role Overview
McElhanney has an opportunity for a Survey Party Chief to join our team in Vancouver, BC! Reporting to the Project Manager or Field Supervisor, you will direct the field crew to complete projects in an accurate, timely, and efficient manner to meet contractual and legal obligations. You may also be involved in engineering, construction or legal surveying in urban and/or rural areas.
 
  • The ability to travel and work out of town in remote areas for extended periods of time is required
  • Pre-employment drug and alcohol testing will be on-going and unscheduled as required.

Responsibilities
  • Take direction from Project Manager to understand the following: project objectives, allocated budgets, goals, schedules, and timeframes
  • Communicate scope and schedule information to team members, set expectations, and ensure project tasks are completed on time
  • Field completion of various types of surveys including engineering, construction, and legal surveys
  • Liaise between Project Manager and client representative
  • Manage information flow from field to office and prepare clear, concise and accurate field notes, records and calculations
  • Ensure implementation of quality assurance, safety, and policy compliance.

Requirements
  • Two-year technical diploma in geomatics or civil engineering with up to 5 years of previous experience in a similar role, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Experience using chainsaws and ATVs
  • Valid Canadian passport with the ability to travel to the US, and overseas
  • Physical ability to lift heavy equipment
  • Willingness to work in various environmental conditions with varied terrain, in wildlife populated areas, and in remote areas for extended periods and varied hours
  • Valid driver’s license required
  • Good written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, good attendance, sound judgment skills, and general computer knowledge.

About McElhanney
Based in Western Canada for over 100 years, McElhanney offers innovative and practical engineering, surveying, mapping, planning, landscape architecture, and environmental services. As a 100% employee-owned and operated firm, with over 1,100 staff members in 33 locations, we are proud to offer qualified staff with shareholding options in our company. At McElhanney, we work in teams to build strong connections with our staff, clients, and local communities. Our employees enjoy working here because of our varied projects, high levels of autonomy, opportunities for career development, excellent total compensation and benefits package, and collaborating with a team of great professionals.
Our Purpose:  Amaze our clients. Care for our communities. Empower our people.
